reviews.review: A beautiful walk. The park is beautiful and well maintained. There are benches and you see a lot of local people using it. I found the homeless dogs friendly and one followed us all the way to the hotel.

Time for yourself. The park is right next to the Topkapi Palace and is a commuter park in which locals walk from work to home. The surrounding of the park is full of cheap eats of chestnut sellers, corn on the cob and fresh bread with a small shop in the centre, small Mosque and WC facilities that do cost 1 lira. There is a Islamic Science and Technology Museum and Restaurant on the side opposite the Topkapi Palace and the tall trees, gardens, sculptures and many cats make this park the most calming place in Istanbul.I went there everyday to sit and relax, perfect to calm things down or reflect.
Green place. It is a Green place in the middle of the old cityYou can walk and watch few artistic formsYou should go on day
Escape the crowds. If you need a break from the heat, crowds or just have had enough of looking at old buildings, take a stroll through Gulhane Park next to Topkapi Palace.

Exciting Time Out Space. I made a point of going into the park on my way to our hotel every day and each time I enjoyed it more than the previous time. There are always people sitting around enjoying the peace and quiet and generally just chilling. An amazing calm space right amidst the extremely busy Sultanahmet area.

A large park at our hotel doorstep. We stayed in a hotel located along Alemdar Caddesi and Gulhane Park is literally at our hotel's doorstep. Gulhane Park was part of the Topkapi Palace in the old days and there were buildings in there which were part of the palace administration buildings and now converted into other use.It now is open to public. Peddlers selling grilled corn and chestnuts ply their goods at the gate fronting Alemdar Caddesi.
Very nice so much to see . Very nice park greenery all around and there are statue of girls holding flower bucket and simling I really like these stuff and also very clean and maintained

Relaxing location and history. This park is located beside the Topkapi palace.This park was built during the reign of the Ottoman Empire.The landscape is very beautiful and has a lot of trees.There are many statues of Ataturk - Ashik Veysel &...If you're looking to relax, go to the park ;)
Excellent . Beautiful park worth visiting. It suitable for families and couples. Clean bathrooms too. I would go again and again.
Very nice for all ages. Very nice for walking, for kids.. There is toilets and praying place, near to sultanahmet square, and it considered as an entry to top kapi palace. nice to be visited

Amazing. This is one of the best place to walk, run or even sit down and enjoy the beautiful atmosphere. I like the coffee shop at the end of your journey on the top of the hell (the gate on the bosphorus)
Nice place to walk. We were at this park on a hot day and appreciated the shady trees. It is a pleasant place for a walk.

Green space . Green space between the very many attractions that Sultanahmet hosts. Museums surround the park. Great views of the Bosphorus specially at night. Well maintained and adequately safe. Can get busy at times. Toilets available. No entry fee applicable.

"I'm walnut tree in Gülhane park...neither you nor police notice this". Title is a famous Turkish song of Cem Karaca,nice park and a historical park by Topkapi Palace.You may feel that suddenly meet an Ottoman Sultan wandering araund☺.Additinalyy you are very close to historical heart of istanbul
Nice place to relax. Public garden free of charge having a lot of nice flowers different colors were you can sets to set and enjoy the atmosphere and fresh air hearing the sound of the birds

Just a park. This park is in neighborhood of Topkapi palace and after visiting the palace you can walk down in this park up to seaside. When we were there, it was so crowded and the visitors didn't consider the cleanness of park unfortunately.
Nice place. Really very nice park for everyone amazing views with beautiful tall and big trees the smell of roses just feel like a heaven and at the end of the park there is the sea side
We had a lovely early moring walk in the park. We discovered this park during one of our early morning walks and were drawn into it. The park did not disappoint.

Nice Place. This park is located beside Ayasofya Museum. It is very peaceful place to take rest and relax after a long day of city life. The trees are very huge and tall which tells us how old those trees are.
A very beautiful park. This is a very beautiful park. Actually it was once a part of the Topkapi Palace. One of the beautiful sights of SultanAhmet Area.

lovely park. Great shady place to strole through away from the bussle of the istanbul streets. Lots of pretty flowers, pleasant fountains and parrots in the trees. Locals seem to come here to get away from it all

A wonderful oasis in the midst of Sultanahmet. This lovely park is next to Topkapi Palace. The park gardens are certainly much better than those in the Palace. The park offers a wonderful respite from the tourist hordes at the major attractions. The tall deciduous (Poplar) trees provided much welcome shade from the heat. There is an abundant number of benches throughout; many seem to be taken up by young couples! Definitely a place for families, and also those seeking some ‘solo’ quiet time with a book. I consider this place better than Topkapi Palace.

A garden in the city. When I discovered the park I was already tired from the walking I did. So it was an excellent place for me to rest. Big trees around. People , mostly families with children and young people, all around enjoying the environment. Great place to rest. Visit it if you have kids with you.
Seren place for a stroll. Do spend some time walking in the park. It's a great place for a bit of respite from the crowds and the carpet sellers.

Very peaceful. We were going to the islamic science museum and had to walk through the park. Very beautiful fountains and layout. Though not many flowers at this time, still a beautiful walk. At one area the wind through tall trees was making sounds like flowing water. Very peaceful.
Nice park. Deserve a visit in the afternoon. Green park. Nice cafés. Even though it is with 20 mins walking distance from Eminönü, better reached using auto bus or taxi.

Great for escaping the heat.. If you keep walking down from Sultan Ahmet along the tram route you will come across Gulhane Park. As soon as you enter the park, on the right there is water feature resembling a book having its page turned and on the left, a small footbridge with a pond, both lovely for photos. The park is covered by very tall trees which provide a reprieve from the hot summer days and there is also a lovely playground for children. If you need refreshments there is a small vendor selling drinks/ice cream and a nice cafe. There are a few well maintained toilets and a small mosque, conveniently located too.

Nice evening at gulhane park. This is located just besides the Topkapi Palace, & in front of our Gulhane suite hotel. This is a big park & we walk all the way from our hotel to the other end at bosphorus with excellent view of it. There is a lot offering for kids interests like water fountains (with changing colors at night), water fountain book, ataturk statue, old female dress (to stand behind for a photo), hilly areas, flowers & few more.

Beautiful park!. Nice place to visit in combinations with the Topikapi palace. At the richt spot there is very good view at the Bospurus! Seeing the big ships enter the harbour, it is a pleasure to sit and relax.

Lovely national park. Beautiful park to visit to get a break from all the other sites... there were not as many flowers but that is due to the season. It was lovely to see families having picnics, even saw a bride and groom who had come to get photos taken at the park.

Welcome break from the hustle of Istanbul. Gulhane Park is looking located at the back & below Tapaki Palace. Can be reached either from near Topkapi Palace / Archeological Museum entrances or directly next to Gulhane tramway stop.The park is quite large and a very well kept space in bustling Istanbul. A place to gently stroll amongst the numerous varieties of flowers and soak up the fresh air. Sit down on one of the many benches situated on the main thoroughfare or in the quieter lanes off to the side.A must to visit, even to take a snack and eat while watching people stroll by.

Pleasant place for a stroll with a great lookout over the Bosphorus. Right in the historic district of Istanbul. Some pleasant flower beds, lots of shade, a few fountains, a children's play park. A lovely paved walkway wide enough to cater for groups, prams, bikes and joggers. A lookout over the Bosphorus is a bonus.

Relaxing and beautiful. I visited in april at the time of the tulip festival so the whole park was full of tulips and other types of flowers.It was a medium sized park but I had fun it was very clean and you could lay on the grass which was relaxing.A great place for reading a book under a tree.

Natural - Time for relaxing - Top adress. I stayed for a short walk at the Gulhane Park! I was really impressed about this big area with many different areas!There are some small lakes with bridges, many different options for sitting down and many different ways for a walk.You are feeling free and although feel the spirit of the nature!I recommend this park as a POI on a sunny day. Inside the Park it is really easy to relax and cool down! In my mind it is a "Must see"!The Gulhane Park is really close to the Bosphorus River and Galata Bridge. You can use a cab or bus!Enjoy!

Nice park depending on the time of year you visit. Just returned from a trip to Istanbul and managed to squeeze in a visit to the park. I was last there in April 2014 and the park looked much more beautiful then as the famous tulip flower beds were resplendent. This time there were very few flowers in bloom and the park looked a little unkempt. Nevertheless if you walk through to the end you can have nice views over the Bosphorus and walk under the outer walls of the Topkapi Palace

Amazing tree garden. This park is about 20 minutes walk alley, with a century plus old trees. This attraction good to take mid day as trees provide excellent protection from sunlight. There is nothing on the north end though, you're choice would be walking back or taking taxi as exit street is just ugly and unattractive
Have a Rest. After long journey to mosques, musiems and grand market, Gulhan Park is the place than you need to be in for resting at same time enjoy nature

Very tranquil and peaceful park. Our hotel was very near the park, so we walked through lot of times. There is a lovely cafe, venors selling water, fountains lots of people. There is a museum next to the cafe. Topkapi Palace is there and the places where you have to buy the tickets. Would have wanted to explore it more, but had a jam packed schedule. Be sure to explore Gulhane Park, Gulhane means Rose. Our family loved it, a haven among the hustle and bustle.

Beautiful gulhane park. A really beautiful place to spend 2_3 hours in .. full of different kind of roses and flowers. Some status of ataturk and others . It's a beautiful peacful place and it's 2 minutes away from hagia sophia
Nice quiet park. Although very close to sutanahmet this is a lovely park where you easily forget the hustle and bustle only a few metres away. Lots of flowers out, streams and a nice cafe.

Beautiful garden. I stumbled here by accident and was impressed, the gardens are really beautiful and well kept, with a beautiful fountains. It is also very quiet, which is refreshing if you want to escape from the tourists around Sultanahmet. Definitely worth a visit!
Peaceful. The ultimate place in Istanbul to get away from the rush. Greenery all around and just a great place to relax after a day of walking around the city
Nice part. This is great and beautiful park. There is plenty of place to relax. We visited and our kids enjoyed the park.
Beautiful. This a big park right in the middle of the city with lots of sculptures and play areas for the kids. A large walking path right down the middle to stroll on.

Relaxing walk. A very quiet park to wander through the Old trees give shade from the sun.plenty of benches to sit on,and a very Nice view over the Bosphorous from the end furthest away from the tramline entrance.
Tulips. Lots of tulips.. If you are by any chance in Istanbul in April, this place is a must! They'll be filled with lots and lots of beautiful tulips.
Great for a gentle walk. Nice scenery, worth going through get from Topkapi Place to Serkeci, which is close to the sea. Great views

Watch the world go by. The perfect place to take your Sunday constitutional, along with many other citizens. Families converge on this city park, right under the walls of Topkapi palace. Grab an ice cream, stroll along, join the throng.
A lovely place. This is a nice park with lovely little features spread all over. There is a couple of museums and a cafe on the grounds, so it can be a great day out.

A pleasant walk. Not much in the park but well used by locals on holidays with some artworks on display. Good for a stroll away from the bustle of the streets before plunging back into the maelstrom that is Istanbul.

Delightful calm and shady place. What a lovely park, lots of shade, relaxing seating and fascinating sculpture/flowers.
Well worth spending a couple of hours here with a picnic.

A nice park if you haven't had enough walking. This is a great little park near Topkapi Palace and the Archaeological Museum. It's a nice spot to spend a little time people watching, eating ice cream and relaxing. Especially if you want a little space away from the crowds at the Palace.

Tulips kingdom in spring. Most people used to think that the greatest tulips are in Holland. One can be really surprising seeing beautiful and huge collection of tulips in Gulhane Park in Istanbul. I have spent there a few hours photographing tulips in Gulhane. On the next year I did the same, and again. The pleasure is absolutely incredible. In other times of the year Gulhane park is full of flowers, perhaps not as attractive as Turkish tulips, but still this is nice place to walk. At the very end of the park there are small cafeterias where we used to take a pot of tea and seat for hours watching birds and ships on Bosphorus.

The best part is at the end. I always ignored this park on my visits to Istanbul, even though it's only a few metres from Haghia Sophia. I finally went and had a great time. Near the entrance (if you're coming from Haghia Sophia) there's nice fountain with a couple of small bridges, perfect for pictures. There ar2 overpriced restaurants, as well. The rest is just a massive park with tall trees, benches and lots of families coming for picnic. Towards the very end, there's a tea house with one of the best views of the Bosphorus in the whole of Istanbul.Worth the visit!

Gülhane (house of roses) park. A vast park near Topkapı Palace, located from Sultanahmet to Sirkeci area. It is an important area for Turkish democracy as Tanzimat Fermani was announced in this park on 19th century and area for education revolution of Atatürk as Atatürk firstly introduced Latin letters to the public in this park.

Beautiful clean and green park. Situated in the centre of old Istanbul the former gardens of the Topkapi Palace are a great place to have a picnic, relax and watch the passing parade. Read the inscriptions and explanations which put the park in context.

Cok guzel. I came to Istanbul in April the weather was good and I was very happy...We decided to go for a walk with my friends and we go to Gülhane park...You know I loved this place very much...The Park is really very big and very nice. ..There you can be relaxed because there are no any noise....There are a lot of cafes if you want to drink something or if you are hungry...You can make really nice foto there...I like this place very much....You Must visit it also....

An interesting city park that surprises. En route to the Topaki Palace and Archaeology Museums, you can duck into this green space for a bit of respite from the crowds. There are lots of shady spots (though not enough benches to sit on) and simit and ice-cream sellers at the entrance. There are some notable relics to discover, but the best thing is you can cut through right to the Marmara seashore and its shoreline path. As a runner, I found it safe to be in the early morning and a great way to connect with the city.

Beautiful and relaxing spot!. Excellent place to cool off from the heat or take a break before your next visit! Very well kept, with unique vegetation offering great shades in the heart of Istanbul! You can very rarely find green places like this in a city centre!
A beautiful place. It's a wonderful place to just rest and enjoy the sights and smells. The park is well maintained and clean.

Oasis in a city of people. On a very hot day after walking from Taksim Square I discovered this wonderful city park to cool down in and enjoy the peace and quiet. The park runs from Kennedy Parade to just below Topkapi Palace and was once the orchards of the Palace. It is well cared for with ponds and many places to sit and relax. When the hustle and bustle of the city gets too much, these gardens are a great place to relax and restore.

superb Tulip garden. if your a fan of colorful parks, then don't miss this unique park at spring season late march , you shall be dazzled by the wonderful colors of of different types of tulips, and a place to rest and enjoy peace and serenity. a place not to miss at all .just right out of the park head down to the eminuno sea side area where you can enjoy a snack of the famous Balik fish sandwich , which you can pick at one of the boats selling this famous traditional type, and sit there enjoying it with many people arround .
Relaxing walk in the city centre. Beautifully maintained park, cool under the trees with abundant birdlife. Great way to relax after a whistle-stop tour of the city sights.

Nice park with character. Last year around this time, I had visited istanbul and saw almost all the attractions. This time around, I got to see a few places only and this was one of the places. A nice large park, with a lot of statues and historic background. If you have the time give it a try.

Perfect for families. Park is very very beautiful, huge and calming. There were many couples with childrens, park ia clean with many surfaces for roleskating but nobody use them. Park is near other historical beauties and it is perfect if you want take a break of sightseeing.
Lovely place to cool down. great park to walk through. Well presented and cool after being out in the hot sun. this used to be park of the Topkapi Palace so was the recreation area of the Sultans.
Amazing. Very relaxing and beautiful must visit especially at sunset !Recommended for families and couples also when in need for a quiet time by yourself
Peaceful place!. If you want to take your loved one and looking for a peaceful place, that's the only place to go! Please don't forget to drink a Turkish tea front of the bridge...

The tulips are best in April/May. Silent piece of the city in a very busy area. Nice to walk around, sit down and enjoy the silence. In April and May you find many colourful tulips here, very nice to visit the park around that time.

Gulhane Park - a reprieve from the bustle of the city. We visited the park after the Topkapi palace. A lot of locals and great place to people watch. Views of the Straight are beautiful at the very edge of the park.It's well tended, super clean, and has a beautiful layout of garden beds, spaces, playground and even historically significant monuments. We found it well worth the visit. It's a beautiful walk as well.

Beautiful park in the middle of old city Istanbul. While visiting Sultanahmet, make sure you take a walk in this beautiful park. Fresh air, lots of walking area in an amazingly clean city park. There are benches, fountains, caffe...a must see for sure.
Beautiful park. I love this park. Everything is so green and peaceful, right in the middle of everything. I recommend this all travellers, you won't regret it.

relaxing. a superb park to walk and relax in, after the night before , lovely scenery and meet lots of people,the gardeners deserve a special mention for the great work they put into making the park look has good has it does
Amazing Park in the heart of the city. such an amazing park in the middle of busy Istanbul, a great place to start your day, the sound of water and birds, makes it relaxing.
Such a beautiful city park.. Wear comfortable walking shoes and treat yourself to a visit to this expansive and lovely garden park!

Pleasant bit of garden paradise.. Such a beautiful park, very well maintained. Although we missed out on the tulips, there were workers everywhere replanting for the summer. It was very impressive to see. It was a great stop after visiting Topkapi Palace. Grabbed a doner kebab and had a picnic on our Turkish towel rug.

A very tastefully decorated Garden very close to SultanAhmet. A very well maintained garden right from the ottoman times with adequate space to seat and enjoy .I will suggest to first enjoy Topkapi palace and then to come back here for relaxation or after seeing all the attractions in the historic district of Istanbul.

Lovely, Calm, Serene & Green!!. This was probably one of the best parks that I have ever seen. I went there on a cloudy rainy day and the environment was full of energy and peace. You can see kids playing, running all around and people having the time of their lives by sitting on benches, having picnics etc. There are a few restaurants and food places inside too.I had a wonderful time there.

Loved it. Amazing place , nice view nice sight , the huge trees , the beautiful flowers , the oldness feeling of the place gives it glory , the children also enjoyed the walk , had a nice cup of tea up the hill , worth visiting every time i come to istanbul , good for bicycles... Free entrance , close to the sultan ahmet area , there is also the topkapi palace ..
Such a pretty sight, close to the Marmara. Must visit while in Istanbul! It is very close to the main attractions so you should not miss it. It really looks like a royal park.

in private garden of sultans. this park is an excellent place to run away from the city and it is just in the heart of the historical peninsula next to topkapi palace. sit on the grass to listen the tales of the of ancient trees which witnessed so many sultans and different times of the empire. btw, there is a place inside where they serve wonderful nargile (hookah or shisha) and you can have your tea in semaver while gazing the waves of Bosphorus.

Beautiful Park. Full of tulips and very serene. It's very close to Topkapi Palace and a short walk from the Blue Mosque/Hagia Sophia. I would recommend taking some time out when its sunny and going for a stroll through the park.
Relaxing walk... It was a nice walk in the park and we enjoyed the greenery. It is huge and historic.. Go there if you are in Sultan Ahmed area and TopKapi
A Lovely Park for a Walk. Nice for a walk to relax for a while away from all the sight-seeing. Make sure the weather is not hot though.

Gorgeous park . Such an unexpectedly huge park hidden behind some rather anonymous tall stone walls in Sultanahmet. That it's spectacularly beautiful with some great playgrounds is a most welcome added bonus.
nice. great gülhane parkı for relax and very big a place and free :) we really like it gülhane parkı... for everybody must this this lovely a place....

Gulhane Park. One of the most beautiful parks I've seen. It's very close to the Topkapi Palace and all the other major sights in Sultanahmet. If you have the time you should bring a book and sit down for a while to enjoy the beauty of the park. Lots of flowers and wonderful fountains make you want to stay forever. If you get hungry you can stop at the restaurant located inside the park.

Beautiful place to spend all day. Lovely park suitable for all ages, very scenic for photographyMake sure you walk up to the top to get a beautiful view of the Bosphorous seaAlso they have built a small mosque and washing facilities to complete your prayers so you can spend the whole day there.

Beautiful. Filled with wonderful things to see. I wish I could have spent more time here, but it was pouring rain and we had no umbrellas! This is a beautiful park, filled with lovely flowers and greenery, of course, but also lots of benches for relaxing, fountains, bridges, statues, even a little whirling dervish outfit--you can stand behind and get a photo op. Pristine landscaping throughout. I especially like the fountain that resembles a book, with the jet of water that looks like a turning page. My impression of Istanbul is that if something can be made more beautiful, they will do it. Every surface in the city is adorned in some way. A fantastic place to visit, I cannot wait to return and spend more time in the park.

Peaceful Oasis in the Heart of Istanbul. This park is ideal for those seeking to relax and calm down away from the permanent rush and bustle this city has to offer nearly everywhere else. When you get to the park, you can immediately dive into an atmosphere of peace and quiet, leaving the outside world behind. Enjoy a stroll and feel the joy to be amidst beautiful trees, flowers, and bushes. There are also a handful of nice water fountains, and children will be delighted to spend some time at one of the playgrounds available.Whether you enjoy sunbathing or just catching a breath in the shadow, this park has something to offer for everyone who loves a peaceful paradise away from every day life.
Couples park. A cute little park where couples walk around and just enjoy the small piece of nature in the middle of the city. Be careful with the dogs though :D

Beautiful park. I have come to Istanbul, 3 times. I always come to Gulhane Park, the location is just beside the Topkappi Palace. When I came on May, I saw beautiful and colourful roses, and in April I found tulips garden. So beautiful and lovely. At the back of this park, there are some coffee and tea shops, we can enjoy tea while seeing Bhosporus from above. So romantic for the couple.
beautiful gardens. Nice to walk through. lovely gardens for a stroll. Its free , next to the Topkapi palace. If you climb to the top of the gardens, you get a lovel view across the Bosphorus.

Beautiful green area in the Sultanahmed District. A green enclave in Sultanahmed. What used to be the gardens of the old Bizantyan palace. Very local with beautiful photo spots. Dont miss the view of the Topkapi harem and the view of the sarayburnu.

Tea break watching lovely Istanbul. You may lay on the grass and see tulips on May. One of the good points to have a cup of tea in Istanbul while watching Istanbul's beauty. Do not quit before hanging out in cafes next to the exit.

Well-manicured. This is a clean and well designed city park. I was hoping to see some new birds, but there are no wild areas to attract them. There were some black-crowned night heron roosting in the tops of the trees and even the common city birds are interesting when a birder is in a new region for the first time, so it was still worth it on that score.The highlight at Gulhane is the great view of the Bosporus from the far back of the park. There's a cute tea pavilion there that was closed when I visited in early morning, but looks like it'd be a great spot for an afternoon break.

Beautifully landscaped free park. While it was too early to be fully planted, what was there was a feast to the eyes. Hedges were neatly trimmed. Great place for family strolls or kid on the playground
Beautiful place to rest your legs and relax. A green oasis with a lot of flowers and plants. One of the top 10 sights in Istanbul. Park is right next to Topkapi Palace.

Lovely park. . Since arriving in Istanbul we have walked around this park several times. It has everything from flowers, trees and animals to nice dining areas as well. A nice way to relax from the buzzing streets of this city. Recommend this park anytime.
Beautiful place to take your pictures in Istanbul. The park is beautiful, we went in and took pictures, when back home, we realized they were the best pictures we took throughout our trip!
just relax. nice and quiet to sit look around the design of the garden and a lot of varieties of flowers ,stretch your legs for the next walk in the city

I have expected more. There was not that much flowers (April 30 -May 1). But seems like good place for families. And make sure you visit cafe (forgot the name, to the left from the entance- they havesurprisingly good chocolate cake))

Green Haven in busy city. This green space is in some ways like a traditional victorian UK park, with roses & other flower beds ,well cut lawns. Nice for a walk in the early evening ! Good for kids ,play areas etc.

Lovely park in middle of Old Town Istanbul. Lovely landscaping and topiary throughout the park. I birded there briefly and found Gray Heron and Alexandrine Parakeets nesting in the park. Beware of people trying to get you to go to their shops outside the park. I was with a guide and he cautioned me to stay away from these people as they might take advantage and try to steal from you. Otherwise a lovely oasis in the middle of Old Town Istanbul.
My favorite park in Istanbul. Gülhane park is my favorite park in Istanbul, especially in April, when is tulips festival in Istanbul. You must to see this beautiful park with lots of flowers.

Huge park, pleasant for a stroll.. We found this whilst wandering around and decided to walk through it. Haven't seen a review that warns tourists of all the hills there are to climb up and down! Took quite a while to walk from one end to the other. There are security guards at each gate, which is reassuring.

Natural beauty . Our hotel was very near to this park, we always go in and out to old sultanatement street through this park. There are three gates of this park...we use to come from the gate which was near to sirkeci metro station and near to our hotel golden horn istanbul...first we went there on 11th April 2016,as that time we were staying at a different hotel near aksaray....the garden was blooming with thousands of tulips and was very well maintain but after our visit from bursa around 17 april till 21 april...some of the tulips dead due to the hot temperature but still there were enough to enjoy.I was very disappointed that people were plucking the tulips and distroying the tulips while taking pictures.There is a islamic museum also inside the gulhane park.I would highly recommend it if you are nature lover and the park is free of cost . The nearest tram station is gulhane parki station.

A lovely public space. We strolled through Gȕlhane Park, Istanbul’s answer to New York’s Central Park. Although it is not nearly as large and skirts the edge of a cliff overlooking the Boshorous, rather then being settled in the middle of the city, like Central Park Gȕlhane is popular with both locals and visitors. On this particular sunny spring day, families strolled the walkways edged with roses. Two crisply-uniformed police officers mounted on horseback posed for pjhotos. Little outdoor cafes served tea and sweets.

A riot of colors :). Gulhane park is a soothing point after a days walk though palaces, museums and mosques of Istanbul.We visited during Tulip Season and it was blooming with tulips of all colors and sizes. Such a beautiful sight from wherever you see. A must visit after a busy day!

Good Walk with clam atmosphere in midst city Crowd. The Park is average if your trip is just to visit the park. However, we have clubbed the park visit with the old city walk. As we entered the park all the city crowd and noise will fade away. We really enjoyed 40 mins of relaxed mode. Sat for few minutes on the bench listening to birds.Note that the green areas differ with seasons and the experience of the park changes with weather changes.If you are around this area, it is worth visiting the place.

good to relax and fresh air. As Sultanahmet is hilly and you will spend the majority of your day on your legs, it is a good spot to relax. The flowers are beautiful and it offer ample shade. Free entry.
It also houses the Science museum which I wud recommend for a visit

Nice Peaceful Park. This is a beautiful peaceful park, with a fountain, that is a great place to relax and unwind after a long day visiting the Topkapi Palace. It used to be part of the palace. There were not a lot of flowers in bloom when we visited (Oct) but I imagine it looks great in spring or summer.

Respite in the Historic Pennisula. This is a medium sized park conveniently located next to the Topkapi Museum. It is an easy walk from Sultanhamet Square, and the tourist trolley stops just outside its gate. There are nice views of the Golden Horn from one end of the park. There are no facilities to speak of in the park, but the street just outside has shops and restuarants. This would be more of a convenient place to sit and rest up than a "must-see" attraction.
Nice family park. Lots of locals go to this park with familiy on the weekend,it's great for walking and lots of shade under the huge trees,
Beautiful gardens, just under the Topkapi Palace. Spectacular swathes of colour in the amazing flower beds. Lots of seats for flower / people watching and some really nice fountains. Enjoy.

A lovely city stroll. We walked through this on chance, the gardens are wonderful! They are in the process of updating the flower beds for spring but it was still tranquil and lovely, not many sounds of the city outside the walls to be heard.

Spring Break Istanbul 2016. The park was beautiful. We went there in the spring when the flowers were in bloom. Its a great park to take pictures when the flowers are in bloom. Walking thru the park you can visit the Islamic Science and Technology museum. It a break from all the hustle and bustle of the city. Nice place to sit and relax.

Beautiful!!!. Luckily we were there during tulip season!Beautiful fields of flowers all over everywhere.Apart from tulips there are lots of other flowers & labanda fields.... Ohhhh ... What a smell <3 !

Tulip 💕💕. Breathtaking panoramic, with millions tulip blooming when i came. Everyone enjoyed walking around or just enjoyed the tulip. I came on the weekend, a lot of tourist and locals, but well maintained, clean and must visit park when you come to Istanbul (especially on April).

Keeping Walking till the end!. Extremely peaceful park in the middle of the touristic area in Old Istanbul. keep walking till the end and you will find a breath-taking panaromic view of Istanbul. For only 10TL you can enjoy the view with an "ibreeq" of chay!
April Flowers..... The tulips were out in force in April. Not sure if they do this all summer or not. In any case, it was a beautiful and free stop, with a lot of locals and children playing.

Tulip Season!. A beautiful park anytime but we were lucky to be there during tulip season. A relaxing way to spend time wandering thru a masterpiece of a park people watching, bird watching and strolling by the Bosphorus. Nearby tram stop, Archaeology museum and wonderful boregis at the park restaurant. I left my bag with passport at this restaurant and when I went back 20 minutes later, the staff rushed to me to say they had found it and put it in a safe place. Whew!

Tulip were blooming in early April. We visited this park on 2 April 2016. The tulips planted there were already blooming and very beautiful.There is a playground there and my son was enjoying himself there while we enjoyed the scenery. Highly recommended for a visit in early April.

Beautiful Park - a must visit. What a beautiful outdoors activity this was! Even though winter is has just drawn to an end, the park was beautifully colourful with an abundance of tulips and other flowers. Well kept and very clean. Interesting to see how popular this park is, also with locals!
The tulips are out. Visited in April when the tulips were in full bloom. Really beautiful and a great place for a time out in Istanbul.

Great fun for kids and chilling out. We went here with adults and young children. Everyone enjoyed walking about and sitting.We enjoyed purchasing fruit from the stalls and sitting and just enjoying the flowers and views with the kids.As it was the weekend, it was extremely busy, quite a lot of rubbish about too because of the sheer number of people.

Peaceful, peaceful, peaceful. The park is located net to the ancient palace and is filled with flowers, fountains, walkways, and bridges. It is just spectacular and is so nicely maintained. As you sit on a bench don't be surprised is a few very nice Turkish men strike up a conversation with you and then invite you to their carpet shop. A visit to a carpet chop will cost you bout 1-2 hours and they just might talk you into spending $3000!The park is free and is just nice. If you watch the tree tops you can often see the storks fly in and out of their nests and in the trees you might see the parrots.It is a peaceful and magnificent place to be!

The Kids will Love It. Located just below the palace, this pretty park is full of sculptures and flower art that the kids will love. It's peaceful, and a lovely stroll when you need a break from sightseeing. The tulip arrangements are spectacular and you'll see a lot of birds. On your stroll back up towards the palace, there is a lovely little tea garden with spectacular views across the Sea of Marmara
TIME TO RELAX. Excellent time to relax. After walking through the city where live 17 million people, nothing better than walking through the park and see exotic birds.
very beautiful park. Nice place to walk, there a lots of tulips air was nice and crisp, really like the walk away from buildings

good park to relax with children. we sat at the park for tea after we finished day's touring with our guide. it's great space where you can see the locals meeting friends and enjoy a non-touristy part of Sultanahmet.

Park beside Topkapi. Gulhane park is a nice park just beside the Topkapi palace. It is sort of sandwiched between the palace and the tram/railway lines.
At the end of September the trees had that autum look. I'm told April is a very nice time to visit the park.

Tulips in gulhane park. What a treat! We were on our way to see Topkapi Palace Museum and saw the garden at the side of the entrance. So we thought we would spend some time there. Wow it was like a mini keukenhof (in holland). There was colour galore ...different coloured tulips blooming in delightful formations. Take a stroll over the bridges and have an ice cream before you start your momentous journey into ottoman history!

Must do especially in Tulip season . Visited when we went to the Topkapi Palace. A magical place in bloom season. We didn't do justice and woukd have liked to spend more time there. A nephews hay fever kicked in so we had to escape sooner so be prepared. The most amazing display if flowers

Stunning at any time of the year. Gulhane Park is the perfect place to escape the madness of the city and just destress underneath the beautiful trees, while watching the world go by. The flowerbeds are always stunning, but particularly so in April when the tulip festival erupts in a mass of colour and dinner-plate sized blooms. Go on Saturdays to watch the newly weds (or newly engageds) having their official photographs taken on the many bridges across the tiny streams that criss cross the park.
Its a must!. The most amazing parc i have ever seen...so many tulips, they all smell so good, so powerfull, loved the way they arranged the flowers, its a great place to walk in the night or day

Well-cared for park. We were fortunate to have a bird's eye view of this lovely park from our hotel balcony. It was March and there were already gorgeous tulips and hyacinths everywhere. New sod was being added and the entire park was being spruced up for spring. If you have time, you will find the park a serene and restful break from your touring. Be sure to look up and see the huge stork (I think they were storks) nests high in the trees.

very beautiful park, especially during the tulip festival. This is the outer garden of the Topkapi palace and it is a very nice place in a city which has a shortage of green spaces.It is especially nice in april when the tulip festival takes place....lots of great flowers.
A true oasis. The most beautiful park I've ever been. Tulips are beautiful, everything is so tidy and they have those bird houses on trees. Relaxing!

Very Convenient Location For A Spell Of Relaxation. Almost everyone who visits Istanbul spends time around Sultanahmet Square, The Galata Bridge and Eninonu. There is so much to see here that it's hard to avoid, even if like me you like to avoid the tourist hoards. That is what makes this lovely park so great. When you're feeling a bit harassed, it's a very conveniently located place to have a rest and calm down for a while. Everyone seems relaxed here. I sometimes take a picnic and nobody seems to mind.

Awesome Tulips in April. I don't know when it starts or ends, but this year the tulips were very lovely. Amazing with the many different colors and arrangements. This park is for strolling among the flowers. You are not allowed to walk on the grass in most areas. They have a cafe and WC. This might be were you end up if you walk down the hill from Topaki Palace.
Royal garden. Great place to walk, relax and take in the amazing views. Tulips are in full bloom in April. Such a buzzing place on weekends.

Fabulous during april. Tulips is full bloom during April. What a lovely place to walk around. Visited on a Sunday and it looked like all of Istanbul was there. Went back the next day and almost empty. great place to sit and relax during the afternoon

Take a little rest from the Istanbul attractions. You've been to the Hippodrome, the Blue mosque, the Hagia Sofia and the Cistern. Buy a simit and take a rest at the Gulhane park before the Topkapi palace.

Pretty place to take a brewk. We strolled through the park after visiting Topkapi Palace and found it very pleasant, even though the flowers were just starting to bloom on March 22. Our hotel concierge recommended we come back in the evening, as she said it would be magical and even more beautiful. She said Istanbulites loved to visit the park at night after work. We wanted to go back but, alas, our tired legs couldn't make the trip. Because she was spot on with all her recommendations, we hope to get back sometime to experience the magic of the park at night.

Great during tulip season!! . Take a time out. Enjoy the beautiful flowers and a huge park in the middle of a busy city!! The park is perfectly located around the major attractions and on a hot day will give you some shade and peace.

One Of The Best Parks That I Have Visited So Far. Located in the middle of Istanbul, Gulhane Park was a miracle for me. I visited it in April of 2015 which means that whole park was full of numerous colors of blooming tulips. Although the park itself was not something tremendously new, lots of birds and flowers made it really attractive.Parrots, cranes, pigeons and many other birds directly flew above us. I found myself in alive zoo and so close to nature in the center of the city! Lying on the grass, eating simit bread and watching lovely birds and flowers was something I will never forgive.

Beautiful & Relaxing. This is a lovely relaxing park with beautiful follower gardens. I'm not sure what it be like in winter! It's the ideal place to have a takeout meal while in the Sultanahmet area. The atmosphere is tranquil and there are plenty of benches around the park. But your food and have it here while you are in the area.
Beautiful. Gulhane Park is a very beautiful place to go to during March and April because of the many beautiful and colorful tulips.
Wonderful oasis.. The park was in bloom when we were there. Be sure to look for the Islamic Museum of Science and Technology opened in 2008.

Peace. If you're looking for peace, this is the best place on european side to escape from the noise and bustle of the city. There is one cafe-house (Setüstü Çay Bahçesi) on the sea side of the park and it has amazing view

Take a walk. This park provides an excellent avenue to just stroll, even aimlessly, along. Fantastic in summer, but equally serene and beautifull in winter. Take a walk to the end where you can see the Bhosporus - my personal favourite.

Amazing little park, take a walk around the grounds. This is popular with locals and tourists. Take a walk around the grounds or sit and people watch on the bench. There's a nice, clean bathroom (for 1 lira) and some snack vendors.

Peace and Tranquılıty. Walking downhill towards Eminönü, along the tramway, a large gate in a high wall, on the right, leads through to the Archaeological Museum and to Gülhane Park, which was established in 1912. This was formerly the outer gardens of the palace, where several varieties of roses were grown. Rose oil and rose water were in great demand for use in the palace, the harem and the palace hospital, for its scent and disinfectant qualities. The Isparta Scented Rose Garden was opened in 2013. The generous donation of approximately 40,000 roses trees by the Isparta-Güneykent Municipality, were planted in a reconstruction of the historic Gülhane Rose Garden, in its original location, within the park.Today it is a place in which to enjoy a gentle stroll and is very popular with the “İstanbullu’s”, particularly on Sundays and public holidays. The throngs of people stroll around nibbling on nuts and sun-flower seeds, the shells littering the paths. A subterranean cistern from the Roman era served as an aquarium and a rather tatty set of cages were passed off as a zoo, filled with some very pitiful animals and birds. In July 2009 renovations of the park were completed and the zoo closed. On one of my visits to the city, Şeker Bayramii was being celebrated in the park. There were numerous attractions such as "Roll-a-Penny", where a 50Kr coin is rolled down a chute with the object of placing the coin within a square. If the coin does not touch the sides of the square you win your stake. Hoopla, throw a ring over a wooden square, which also has the prize sitting on top of it, and its yours, and Pick a Duck, choose one of the plastic ducks, which are floating in a container full of water, and the number on the bottom denotes the prize, usually a penny whistle or a balloon. There was also Candy Floss, Toffee Apples and stalls selling Windmills and Balloons. It brought back so many memories of my childhood, when the fair came to the town every year.Simple pleasures, especially for those who do not have fat wallets. Gülhane Parki open every day. Museum open every day except Monday, 09:00-17:00.

April Wonders. We were lucky enough to visit in April when this beautiful park was smothered in amazing tulips. The gardeners must spend hours working out the fabulous displays which are absolutely amazing - not to be mised

Nice and romantic. This is a nice, quiet and cool place to go for a walk.The Museum of the History of Science and Technology in Islam is here which many people miss - make sure you visit it, its very interesting!

An oasis of Istanbul. This park is an oasis of Istanbul, just a walking distance from Topkapi palace and Archeological museum. It was sunny and bright when I visited here, so I took a walk and had some tea at the park cafe. There is a botanical garden inside the park, too. The roses were not blooming, but there were laurel trees or other herbal plants. Keep in mind, the park closes at 17:00 in the evening.
okay but nothing special. okay but nothing special. its a good place to rest for a few minutes after long walking or to ecsape he summer sun under one of the threes
Park and Palace of Harem. One can understand the position women had within the Ottoman Empire. The area is fascinating and breath taking.

A beautiful oasis in a major city.. Gulhane Park is a glorious park. When I was there last Sunday, the park attendants were very very busy planting thousands of summer flowering plants. There is a quaint little wooden bridge over a lovely stream beside a statue of a Turkish national costume which people can pose with for photos. You can walk from the Gulhane Tram Stop through the park to hillside cafes where you can sit sipping coffee and watch the sea faring ships sailing The Bosphorus. The locals love this park and last Sunday I saw a wedding party having there photos taken .

Delighful oasis in the middle of a very busy city.. A delightful park that was so peaceful after the hussle and bussle of a busy city. Fountains emit the calming sound of water and the flower beds will be stunning in summer. In the evening the birds came in to roost in the trees and was an amazing sight and a cacaphony of sound. Loved it!!

Get away from the buzz. There was this moment after leaving a crowded Topkopi that I wanted to get away from it all -- I wondered into Gulhane Park and did just that. A pleasant walk, quiet and no cars/motorcycles, and a neat view reward at the end.

Not a quiet place. Pretty crowded for a park, we saw a lot of locals coming here to picnic, also a lots of children groups.If you have a little time and your feet are not giving you up, can also take a short visit to Istanbul museum for the "History of Science and Technology in Islam", located few hundred meters far from the entrance of the park.

great for a stroll. A little hidden gem and great for a Sunday stroll. There are masses of parrots and herons flying around high in the trees. Gardens are so well kept and the Spring flowers just coming into bloom, museums in there too. A stop at the café terrace at the end gives a great view over the Bosphorus and chance to grab a Turkish tea and enjoy.
Perfect place. Nature, green , quiet , and right int he middle of the historical area.. really enjoyable place and a must visit

A relaxing place. I love the flower landscape and the place is quiet and peaceful. You can take a long break after hours of walking. Near the entrace I saw few cats sitting around and they were fed by the tourists passing by. So nice of them!.I really enjoy the scene, the smell and it is really relaxing.

Lovely place. This park has a very nice place. It is very peaceful, so you can enjoy every moment or just sit and relax. There is a small cafe, where you can see Asian part of Istanbul. Make sure, you will be there when it will be dark :)
Pretty. Pretty park close to the Hagia Sopia and Blue Mosque. You can walk through it while visiting the other two.

A serene oasis!. This is a peaceful, well kept, flower-filled, undulating park amidst the crowded, concrete, historical center of Istanbul. This used to be the main courtyard of the Topkapi Palace, where the imperial edicts were read by the viziers. It also had formal rose gardens which were strictly for the use of the Sultan, his family and harem. It was made free for public in early 1900s. Various museums are located in this park. I found it a very restful place as the kids could run around freely while the adults relaxed. It is an ideal place to mingle with the locals.

Lovely Place for a Stroll. What a pleasure to return to this beautifully restored and maintained park after a 30-year absence. In the mid-1980s, I couldn't get out of the place fast enough. I found its condition to be deplorable and the small zoo on the grounds to have severe maintenance issues. it was also the only zoo I've visited worldwide that included domestic cats in some of the cages. These were white cats with one amber and one blue eye. But on this visit, I wanted to linger in the park.The zoo is long gone, and the renovations undertaken in 2003 have made the 40-acre park into an urban oasis with much more open space. We strolled by myriad tall plane trees that looked elegant, even with leafless limbs. Fountains splashed in small ponds, crossed by footbridges, and flowerbeds brought color to the winter landscape. Stone Lions and statues added interesting details. A playground brought families with children into the area. Had it been a bit warmer, we could have easily sat for a spell on one of the numerous benches.This park nudges the western wall of Topkapi Palace and was once part of the palace's outer garden. It offers a lovely view of the Golden Horn from its Northeastern edge and the Ahmet Hamdi Tanpinar Literature Museum Library on the Southern end.I think Gulhane Park would be an especially nice place for a picnic in milder weather and we look forward to returning in spring or summer.
charming. Located right near the Dohlabache Palace, this is an amazing place with some nice gardens and a nice clock tower that is many years old
Sunset in the Gulhane. Beautiful garden next to Topkapi palace overlooking Bosphorus. Secure place in the cafe and watch setting sun colour the windows on Asian side and reflect in water.
Relaxing. Nice relaxing place. Perfect for a break from the busy Sultanahmet area. Lots of different birds. Nice fountain at the entrance.

Nice relaxing break. although all Istanbul is suggested for a walking tour, Gulhane Park is the place where you can just walk and relax in the heart of the city surrounded with green grass and trees, water, birds, having Topkapi on the south, marmara sea on the east, ayasofia and blue mosque on the west and crowdy istanbul downtown on the north side. containing the fascinating Museum of Islamic Technology, it is a must visit.

Park with the best view in the world. I dont miss opportunity to go to Gulhane, each time I visit Istanbul. That is kinda my first stop after I check into a hotel. Drinking tea at the very end of park with the most amazing view is priceless!!
Walking and drink Turkish tea!!!. It is very close to sultanahmet mosque and public transport. After your trip you can rest in gulhane and drink Turkish tea with a Bosphorus view!!!
Nice for a walk. This was a pleasant walk but beware the park is not small! there are lovely views of from the café at the far end of the park.
Well kept park. A pleasant stroll through tree lined paths from Topkapi Palace down to the sea. Very peaceful and tranquil.
Nostalji. Gulhane is one of the most nostaljic place in istanbul.. We realy enjoyed our walk at gulhane park. It's just beside Topkapi palace

Very nice park with great tea places. Very nice place, just in the middle oа Old city! If you want to see nice view - just turn left and go little bit up and you will see nice cafes. It is no alcohol there, but view is really great!

A joy for the heart: grandiose, beautiful relaxing place, with wonderful view towards Bosphorus. Huge old gorgeous trees, that seems to have witnessed the great Sultans days. The blessed shadow and air freshness are hosting joyful, colourful and garrulous big parrots. There are several nice terraces with wonderful view towards Bosphorus and Anatolian side. The tall and imposing wall of Topkapi Palace let one guess the wonders hidden in the sultan's palace.

wonderful park. Even during the winter, the park is soothing with the winter breeze. You can use up your museum pass by going through the Islamic Technology Museum (10-20 mins is enough) and go to the Goth Column with a view of Bosphorus.
It has nice decorations around like lion statues and so on.
A beautiful park. We were lucky to be visiting when the flowers had blossomed and the place was absolutely a delight. Very clean and well maintained providing good view of places around.

Wonderfully peaceful in heart of city. In the midst of bustling chaotic Istanbul, this park is a haven of peace, with its tree-lined pathways, gloriously colourful flowerbeds, and shady canopy of green trees. Parakeets provide a cheerful backdrop. Formerly part of the Topkapi Palace gardens. Delightful
Gorgeous. It's a wonderful place. Visit it in April, you will admire the wonderful tulips.....all colours....Just amazing, don't miss it for the world!
Peace. Nice big park right next to the archaelogical museums and topkapi palace...was crowded with locals and tourists alike....nice for a stroll or sit down after walking for so long...

Nice and relaxing green spot. I enjoyed a walk in the park with a couple of friends. A very nice recreational spot within the old city. Plenty of space to move around, when we were there. We also sat down for some tea with a wonderful view if the Bosphorus. I recommend a stroll and a tea break with a view.

Clean Quite. we spent approximately 2 hours just exploring the park its just give you the calm your looking for there is some coffee / Tea places i recommend after you finish you sit and drink tea looking at the sea and the park
Beautiful park with art work. Nice park to walk and enjoy with several art work peaces to discover mainly made out of ceramic.....

Beautiful place!. We accidentally found this first moment we arrived in Istanbul, and what a pleasant surprise!
lovely walk, and places to sit and relax...
Such a peaceful park in Old Town. If you are tired of the crowds, looking for a place to rest and eat your snacks, meanwhile enjoy the beautiful flowers and birds, this is it.

Nice but visited in the wrong time of the year. We walked through Gulhane Park, in December, a lot of gardening was being done so probably not the best time to visit, otherwise it was very peaceful and looking at all the flowers that were being planted, I am sure it looks lovely in the Summer!
Lovely green oasis in old istanbul. Lovely park to wander around in, with some water features around and sculptures dotted about. Great place also for a picnic.
Amazing. I met a Turkish guy while in Istanbul on vacation, who took me here on a date. It was fun and relaxing, I had a great time.
Look at the pictures!. It's a beautiful park. The images speak for themselves. The gardens are impeccable. A good place to escape. Very quiet.

Peaceful but Empty. This was a calm walk around with some nice designs around the trees, and fancier than usual benches. Police security on both ends, but that also means the occasional car driving through (sometimes a bit too quick).
Calm stop, but it was lacking a little bit of pizzazz.

Peaceful get away for it all. Really enjoyed walking through this park. I can imagine that in the heat of the summer it is a great place with the trees providing shade. In the shadow of the palace and a very central location to the other sights.

Tip toe through the tulips. Our room at the Sirkechi Mansion had windows that looked out over the park so we knew it was full of flowers. But there's nothing quite like the massive beds of tulips found throughout the city in April. Walking through the park on the way to Topkapi Palace was a delight.

Great park to visit. We went on our last day to visit this park. It was a nice landscape and very quite and peaceful.
We just walked and took several pictures as the view was very nice.
Highly recommend you visit.

Historical Garden. This place was an attractive park hosting a very poorly managed zoo recently. It host thousand year trees and some nice flora. This park inspired many and became one of the landmarks of old city of Istanbul. Poets wrote poems. Unfortunately, like very many other beauties, it has not been well kept and looks pretty worn. It is still a definately see if you stay at a hotel near Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmet), in 5 minute walk from the square. There is also a tram that stops at the gates. There is no entrance fee to it. Avoid a lot of unhealthy food sold throughout this gigantic park.
nice walk. the back yard of top kabi palace, well cared and nice to have a walk. avoid the cafes on the seeside, unrealistically very expensive, with limited service....
Very cool park. One of the first places we strolled through upon arrival. Very relaxing and spacious. Lovely green area and fun sculptures to look at.

Great Historic Park. When my last visit in this park, its no like other park because its history and recently the government make better and well managed park so people could enjoy their coffee in this park.
Near Topkapi palace. Open park with many cats. Beautiful big trees. Relaxing and quiet. Popular with tourists and locals.

Very nice!. If you don't have time to go inside Topkapi or Archeological museum or other places, but would like to get a glimpse of the area around, Gulhane is a perfect place. You get to walk inside the old wals around Topkapi with old trees and also some stuff from the Archeological museum nearby. You also see the wall of Hagia Irene, and the gate to Topkapi. It does not take long, and it is quite pleasant. There is a small cafe in the corner where you can rest, have a drink and look at the people passing towards Topkapi. You can also access the museum's shop and get something as a reminder of the visit :)

Nice. If you take a walk from Sultanahmet square to the Eminonu, the part of it will be through this park. This is the place where you can take a break and rest for a while before you move from Eminonu to the other location. There are few nice sculpture and restaurant where you can have a lunch.
Nice. Nice but not a park like we are used to as far as diversity is concerned. Just a park. Not bad but nothing special.

Glorious Gulhane!. My husband and I visited the park in mid-April this year. It was during the peak season to see tulips in full bloom, and in full bloom they were. The park was really beautiful, and it was really nice experience to visit this park before embarking on travels of Topkapi Palace etc. It is not too big, but is very beautiful.
Took a stroll in it on our way through. In December it is just a cut through. Mature trees adds a touch of class to the area. It is beside Palace and museums so you cant miss it.

Perfect in April!. The first time we went there with my wife was in April and we actually did not know at all it was the special time of the year to visit it! Simply because it is Spring and that it is amazing to see a "sea of tulips" from many different colors. We did not miss the occasion to go back the year after for a photo shooting as our baby was just born. Must see in Istanbul!

A nice stroll in the park during winter. We visited in the park in the winter time and had a nice day of weather to do so. There were not too many people and the park was rather nice. Don't know how it would be in the summer time?

What a view !!!!. when i visit İstanbuli feel i should visit Gülhane !!! ( necessarily)
end of Gülhane small cafe ( tea garden ) , just order turkish coffee and watch to asia and europe side of turkey! (Bosphorus)

peaceful. nice morning stroll here, so peaceful and quiet, so much tranquility,
beautiful design and nature
it used to be a royal garden after all.
great walk. Spend some time here , really nice gardening designs .The park is full of birds and little parrots,nice place to relax
good location. park is pretty nice to have a rest. very certral location. maintenanence is ok but could be better. try cafes inside.

Very dull park. Park was not in blossom when we visited in October 2015 - so rather disappointing! It's within walking distance to the Hagia sofiya and close to the entrance to the museum.
Would be great to visit during spring when flowers are blooming. It was once part of the palace gardens - so adjacent to the topkapi palace as well.
A good park. A very beautiful parc with coloured flowers and slow little rivers. it is situated in sultan ahmet and easily accessible.

Not the best in December rain. Walking in the Gulhane Park in a drizzling December rain is not the nicest of walks. The parks is vital for Istanbul inhabitants, but for a tourist it is not an impressive park and especially so in December, when it is cold.

Beautiful Urban Oasis. Gulhane Park is a blessing in the bustling historic district that surrounds it with Topkapi Palace and the Hagia Sophia nearby. It is a wonderful respite and ideal for a picnic, a late lunch or just to get off your feet when touring around. There are many beautiful trees, flowers and at one entrance, a most unique fountain. Definitely worth a visit and a breath of fresh air.

Stroll through the autumn leaves. Fortunately, the park was quiet, and we enjoyed strolling through the park, dappled autumn sunlight through the trees, past the fountains. A half hour of bliss, away from the mainstream busyness of being a tourist.
Calm and Beautiful!. Nice pak for daily stroll. It's nearby Topkapi Palace so you can rest after a trip from Museums and then head to the palace.

New F1 track?. This track (or should I say park?) is situated in the sultahamet area of Istanbul and is only a 5 min walk away from the supposedly overrated blue mosque. Entry is priced at 0 lira as this park is free to enter. When I say free I don't actually mean free - because this park has cars racing up and down it like nobody's business which could cost you your life - isn't that a big price to pay. If you manage to dodge the cars then you can appreciate the views of the park which is well maintained with beautiful trees and ponds. I researched the park afterwards to establish why there were so many cars racing about and found out that Istanbul had lost the opportunity to host the F1 GP which of course explains it all.

I liked the trees. First of all the trees in this park are exquisite, so many shades of gray . It is very well kept like most of Istanbul and gives great views of the walls surrounding topkapi palace. I was alarmed by the figures of lions standing on balls, all but one were right footed. This discriminates against left footers, Lionel Messi, the greatest player ever, is a leftie for goodness sake. We need to encourage more kids to be left footed or we will end up with people like Phil Neville playing left back all around the world.

Nice park in the heart of Istanbul !. This place is just adjacent to the Istanbul Archaeological Museum. After the visit to museum one can spend few minutes walking in the park and eat ice cream and relax !!

Peaceful. I loved Gulhane. It isn't a park that is anything out of the ordinary, but its location is what makes it so nice. Istanbul is an overwhelming, overcrowded and noisy city and right in the middle of all of it, you can just turn the corner into Gulhane, and you can have some peace and quiet.

Nice, but nothing special. What makes this park interesting at all is its proximity to Topkapi, Aya Sofia and other Sultanahmet attractions. Other than that and the chance to stroll among greenery in this rather paved over city there is no great reason to visit the park.
Small but cute park!. Nice park to have a walk and relax. If you are looking for a place to run this might be too small, but still nice of you do a few loops.

Massive and well designed. Just next door to Topkapi Palace, this spacious park is a good and free location for a sunny day. Hopefully you don't get so many school boys and girls visiting there, because their noise could ruin your experience.
Very interesting. My over all experience with Turkey trip was great, Gulhane Park is preety nice to visit specially in evening time..
Best Park in Fatih Area. The best thing you can do after finish your tour at Fatih area is to relax at this park and enjoy the seats on front of Bosphorus.

Beautiful and peaceful. Beautiful and peaceful park in the heart of Istanbul right next to major attractions. Nice landscaping that includes some sculptures, bridges, fountains. A few strolling lanes lined by trees and flower beds. Since I've only visited in autumn/winter, I haven't had a chance to see the park with flowers, but must be breathtaking. I plan to spend some more time here next time I'm in Istanbul .
Tranquillity in central Istanbul. A small bit of peaceful green space in central Istanbul, near Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and other central attractions

a delight to the eyes in spring!. ever thought of keukenhof in holland in spring time? legends say that the tulips that we enjoy there actually originated from Turkey, especially Istanbul. It is seen in the city logo that one can see everywhere. this oldest and most expansive public park in istanbul is such a beauty in spring time...with beautiful, marvelously colored tulips! this is easy to reach by the tram that passes by the sultanahmet area. it is adjacent to topkapi palace and the archaeology museum and a short walking distance to hagia sofia and blue mosque.

Nature & Beauty...A great combination of Almighty. A place where anyone can enjoy walking through the geen walkway. The beauty will definitely surprise you. Dont forget to enjoy a cup of tea with the mesmerizing beauty of Bosphorous.
under my hotel directly. under my hotel directlymy way to and from hotel and Taksim squaresome times i sit for resti do not like the unfriendly dogsand the beggars and some biggers

A very nice city park. If you want to get away from the crowds and take a break, take a walk in Gulhane Park. It is clean and quiet and offers great views of the Bosphorus and the city. The public restrooms are great as well. Very clean and well maintained.
Wonderfullllll. Very beautifulllll. It was amaizing. Very quiet very pacefull. I higly recomand it. Spend a cuple of hours there and felt like minutes...

Nice place . I respect the fact that Turkey acknowledge every effort thats done by its individuals. The place is nice, wide, and close to the bay. If you are on Kennedy Road.. just pay the park a visit. Youll love it.

great park for a family stroll. This is a lovely, medium-sized park that is great for sitting on a bench and people watching, or strolling along slowly on a free day. I went on a Wednesday around 3:30pm and it was FULL of young children and families enjoying themselves.

Peace and tranquility amid the bustle of istanbul. This park is so peaceful, set amongst the busy Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. Lots of seating for a short rest, clean toilets just don't forget your 1TL, there are cafes for refreshment and the day I was there a man walked around the park selling tea. It's a safe area, lots of family groups but still peaceful amongst the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. It can be found down the hill from the Topkapi Palace.
beautiful to see during the fall months.. Beautiful to walking though. very peaceful place to sit and people watch. many great photo opportunities.

Nice atmosphere. It's a big park. It's perfect for a couple or friends. Inside there is science museum which is not known by many tourists. Inside there is a coffee shop where I met and had tea with my new friends at least twice there.
I also took a walk through the park at night without noticing until last day.
A beautiful place to relax. It's a nice little break in the city and it's relaxing to sit down for a minute or just to walk through it.
Without flowers still pretty. November is not the best month to visit this park. Nevertheless we enjoied it, especially preparation park for spring time.
Lovely view on a hill overlooking Istanbul. This is a lovely park to stop and look over the expanse of Istanbul from high up on a hill. Can rest, have tea and mezes in a peaceful surrounding

Lovely Roses. Gulhane Park is on the edge of the Old City and a Tram stop with the same name. A lovely stroll with many water features and landscaping. Like its name the roses are stunning in summer and I enjoy seeing the families out walking and bicycling or relaxing under the old trees with a cay or an ice cream from the various vendors. The famous flock of wild Istanbul parrots can sometimes be seen or heard in the trees. I never have felt unsafe in Gulhane and it is closed at night. Go out and enjoy the afternoon and listen to the fountain and see the smiles in gorgeous Istanbul.

beautiful view. From my room I could see the park. There were interesting birds flying around. There were parrots which was interesting for me. The park is a lovely place and the city give a lot of attention by planting flowers and make it look nice.

Nice park. Walking around Istanbul in the old city and ended up walking through the park It was huge and had lots to do and loads of wee cafes etcVery busy with lots of PeopleWell worth a walk through

A wonderful place to spend an afternoon. Serene and moments from the National Museum and Museum of the History of Science (well worth a visit) this is definitely a wonderful place to spend an afternoon.
An oasis from the bustle of the city. We stumbled upon this park on our way to SultanAhmet from our hotel. It is a lovely park, quiet and peaceful with little bridges to cross and water features.

Wonderful park. Amazing park to spend the day with your family there, u can use the Tram T1 from Aksaray station to reach the park. I strongly recomend Istanbul's Visteros to vist this park with no regert on every single mintue that you guys spend it there.

Nice park. Very beautiful park and at the end there is an amazing sea view do not miss it.
حديقة ممتازة وجميلة جدا ولايفوتكم في نهاية الحديقة مطل روعة علي المضيق وشكرا
Beautiful Park. A sprawling park that is free for all to use, plenty of items to peak your interest if so desired, alternatively sit back and watch the world go by
Great for a stroll. Spent my first morning in Istanbul taking a stroll through this park. It was drizzling but the park is still very beautiful to walk around.

A simple park.. just another park near the palace, but needs lot of cleaning and maintenance , the fountains where good but had lot of rubish thrown in the ponds but worth a walk around and a nice place to rest if you are tiered of the heat.

Nice park, peaceful walk, lovely views of the Asia side. It is what it is, a well maintained and clean park, trees and benches galore. Good for a stroll or picnic, there is an overpriced cafe on site at the back, with excellent views
Nice for a walk. This park is located next to the archeological museum and below Topkapi Palace. There isn't something special, but quite a large place with many big trees. We enjoyed a walk.
Tranquil Park. It was very nice to walk through the park. We walked through it around 4:00 pm. Not that many people so you could enjoy a leisurely stroll.

Nice for a visit in the evening.. Its a lovely central area to go to the Topkapi, as well as Bascilica, etc.
Great restaurant and cafe as well!

Large park with lots of interesting statues. We happened on this park by walking past the Topkapi Palace. The park is very large and has lots of interesting statues and fountains. We walked through during the night and felt safe and walked all the way down to the waterfront. This is a beautiful park and a great place to wander after spending the day touring the mosques, museums, etc.

Quiet oasis when we visited. A large and beautiful walk through a well laid out park!
We walked from one end to the other and wound up in the Spice Market area. Don't miss it!

Beautiful and relaxing. It is a beautiful park to visit, whether you just pass it trough or spend whole day. It's beautifully decorated, and it gave me a feeling as if I were in a fairy tale. It's very clean and well taken care of.
Really cute. I loved this park. Very clean, the benches and the light poles are very ornate giving the park an old feel to it. Definitely would recommend spending some time here.

Beautiful peaceful park. Do take a walk through this park next to Topkapi Palace. Lots of people walking through, sitting on the benches and having picnics. The grounds an flowers are beautifully kept.
Good for relaxing. Gulhane park is located at the heart of the old city. It is nice for short breaks and also the tea house nearby offers a perfect view.

Lovely park in the heart of the Sultanahmet area. This lovely park sits below the Topkapi Palace. It provides a break from the hustle and bustle of the Sultanahmet area. Enjoy the gardens, you may see wedding photos in train, or families enjoying a day out. It is worth stopping for a tea at the cafe overlooking the waterfront. My tea came the traditional Turkish way, with 2 pots, one with water and one with tea.

Pleasant, but rather busy and surprisingly small. Not really suitable for running if you are in need of a bit of exercise to set yourself up for a good dinner: rather busy and surprisingly small (the Topkapi Palace bisectingthe park means that a walk/run is a little disjointed). The long terrace and tea shop facing the Bosphorus is worth a stop-off though - the tea is awful - but take your time over the views, which are wonderful (try and secure a table by the edge).

Amazing Tulips right below Topkapi Palace. Visit during Tulip Season...the flowers are not very creatively planted, but the sheer amount and varieties rival Emirgan Park's. Gulhane Stop on the Tramway and there is a very nice restaurant that over looks the park.

Relaxing. Frequently missed by the average visitor the once private garden of the Sultans was used to provide Rose Oil for the royal household. Today it is a relaxing haven away from the bustling metropolis yet only a stones throw away from the attractions of Sultanahmet and is usually full of families enjoying the peace and tranquility whilst children are given a free reign to enjoy the park.

Great views. The cafe in the middle of the park was a very relaxing place to have a cup of tea and watch the world go by. Don't go in October though if you are interested in flowers as they had all been dug up. It must be beautiful in the Spring though.
Good place to relax. If you want to get away of all the noise of the city you will always find a quite place on one of those benches.
A great place to picnic and unwind. When the frenetic pace of Istanbul gets to you, this beautiful, tree lined park is almost the perfect place to escape it.

Love the tulips. The road from Sirkeci to Gülhane park and out of the park trough the city walls,near the Bosphorus is my favourite route in Sultanahmet.Do visit the museums,find a lovely cafe wth a scenic view on the right, uphill,enjoy the tea and sea breeze.İts beautiful all over the year,but the Tulip festival(April-May) with its vibrant colors makes it even more vivid.
Wonderful park. A wonderful park, a very good view on Bosphorus, you should go there for that alone. A romantic place also.

Nothing spectacular here. This park was located close to our accommodation and attracted many people at lunch time - probably local workers! The park itself was a disappointment to us with lots of bare ground where we expected lawn, not many entrances - meaning a long walk from front to back. It's still a green place within a built up city but certainly different from what I conjure up in my mind when I think of 'park' and what we're used to in Australia.

Nice park to go for a stroll and some views. This isn't the most amazing park I've been. I'd say not to have high expectations, as not much to see, but you do have a few sculptures around and I think it will look much prettier during spring/summer. The views are quite nice, you have very cute tea houses at the top of the hill - and it does make it worth a while to go! We did it in about an hour and half (including sitting down and getting some snacks and drinks), so you can get it done easily. Don't leave Istanbul without seeing it!
