Awesome little park. great park in the middle of the tourist area that you can stop and have picnic or tea. I heard in the Spring that they have tulips everywhere

Relax and stroll through this smaller community park. This is a lovely Plain tree-lined mature city park that makes for a nice recreational breather after all of the indoor museums. There are benches, low key community art sculptures, and when we were there, free flying parrots! The parrots make their homes in the trees and fly/squawk to one another. We probably spent 1/2-1 hour walking around, resting, and just enjoying the flora and fauna (plenty of Istanbulite cats as well).
Mingle with the locals on a sunny afternoon. Pleasant place for a respite from the busy streets of Istanbul. Enjoyed a coffee in the central cafe looking out over the gardens.

When you need a respite in Istanbul. Istanbul is a brash and bustling city. The crowded streets, the traffic, the grand bazaar, the spice marker and the humanity. Suddenly you will need a break from it all, so go to the Gulhane park. Nestled on the eastern side of "European" Istanbul, this large park is a maze of pathways between beautiful beds of grass and flowers; there are also a couple of fountain too. No one will hustle you here, just sit and enjoy it or stroll about. Enjoy!

Great birds in the park. We saw parrots going in the boxes.. We had many walks in the park. We are bird watchers so seeing the herons coming back and building nests was great. A great place to people watch.

Huge and scenic. Of course it's scenic, it's a park, but the laid is so nice and enjoyable with a nice walkway lined with benches. There are also some secluded areas as well. Try to avoid those areas that are not well lit - for obvious reasons. But give yourself some time to enjoy the space.

Beautiful grounds. Beautiful grounds of Topkapi Palace & Istanbul archeological museum here. Great for photography or just sitting to relax, have a bite to eat......food vendors at gates entering into here......definitely worth a visit.

Love is in the air in Gulhane Park. A good park but could do with some directional signs as quite easy for tourists to detour from main path and lose bearings. Very crowded on hot days. Evening is pleasant with tucked away benches near palace wall where lovers/couples relax cuddling.
Lovely Park. Beautiful peaceful park to escape the crowds on Saturday. We walked through on our way to Topkapi Palace.

Great Location to Chill in the Shade. Lovely park area with lots of benches and trees providing sometimes much needed shade. This is a lovely place to take a break during sight seeing in the city especially on a hot day

Great park. One of nice area and must see green park so big and looks in very expensive area
It's organized very well and so clean with bice workers

Don't miss out on seeing this gem of a place!. Well and truly remarkable park that is right next to Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace in Istanbul. It'll take about 30 minutes to go through most of the park area and one must spend time just adoring the lovely tulips that are in full bloom in April! We loved every minute of our visit to this wonder and I suggest that make sure one spends some time here when visiting Istanbul.
Gulhane Park. A pleasant walk but nothing special. Alot of old columns and other bits and pieces of ancient buildings strewn around, with no attempt to explain where they had come from.

Never miss it in April. I love this park, free entrance, it used to be the females sultans park back then at the great Ottoman Empire time, it's lovely at April when its the Tulips festival, it becomes like heaven.. I would always recommend it i love this park and especially if you are touring at Sultanahmet area just follow the tram line and you will find it, you can take the metro from sultanahmet to the gulhane but I would suggest the lovely walk especially when its not a typical sunny day at istanbul
A good place for travelers with children. This park is a beautiful place to have a rest with your children after you visit Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace.

A beautiful and historical park. It is located next to the Topkapı Palace. Sultans used this park for hunting and walks. At the end of the park, there is coffee shop which has a great view to the Marmara sea and Bosphorus. In the spring, the park is full of coloured tulips!
Beautiful Park. Beautiful park, well maintained and perfect for a relaxing stroll and or picnic. Easy access by metro
Nice, but in catastrophic condition. The park itself looks nice, but when I was there there were literally heaps of trash. It was also very noisy and crowded.

awesome design. Take a walk through this park. It's a wonderful escape from the city within the city. Once in it, the Istanbul pace mellows down. It's designed so beautifully too. People are happy there.
Relax after chek out of your hotel. Very nice and quiet park .A walk through is worth a million.In sultan Ahmed district .So you can go walking.Fresh air lot of seats to sit and enjoy waiting.

Visited to fill in some time on our last day here. Beautiful park in the heart of the tourist area, great spot for a picnic or, as we did, just a wander with an ice cream to while away the last hours of our trip. Well kept and a credit to the groundskeepers who do a fantastic job looking after this wonderful park

Best Park Ever. We came to this park by mistake but I have to say it is one of the most beautiful parks ever. entrance is free. at the end of the park there are a few cafes overlooking the bosphorus where you can enjoy a cup of tea. Its a must-do in Istanbul!!!

A wonderful Park to take your breath. A park where you carnets among old trees at the shadows of Top Cape. You can rest there after visiting Top Cape or have tea or coffee at the coffeeshops on top the hill overlooking the Bosphorus.

Must visit. Hiden behind the wall where tram line goes (near Gulhane tram station) we were taken by our friend from Adore Restaurant through door and were surprised by size of this park. Because it was Sunday, the park was paked with locals and brides and grooms. It was beautiful to take walk around, to go uphill and to see Bosphorus from the higher point. View is amazing and cafes placed nicely offer tea and coffee for reasonable cost. This is the place where locals are having their Sunady "unwinding " time.

Worth a walk through after leaving Topkapi, but nothing special. After spending the morning touring Topkapi, we walked through this park on our way to another site in the old city. The park was nice and quiet - seemed to be peaceful, but there didn't seem to be anything to make it specifically stand out as special.

Great green space. A beautiful cool space of green, tranquil and relaxing. So close to the bustling crowds and heavy traffic which is istanbul, But an oasis of tranquility and well worth the visit, to spend a few lazy hours and think what life might have been like there a thousand years ago
Sad. I saw its old pictures and decide to visit the park. But i could not find the things that i waited to see.

It's OK . It's ok if you have plenty of time or tired of waking around to relax but not much to see. It's a very ordinary park with local people.
But if you end up there, ensure to visit the "Chai Saray" cafe enjoying spectacular view of Bosphorus bridge and Sultanehmet historical side.
Ordinary simple park. Normal park, for European standards a bit to simple...basically alleys and trees. At least clean and maintained that is not so typical for this region.
Really nice park . Its a huge park that's really peaceful and nice. Would absolutely be the best when is full of tulips in their season, but its also enjoyable every other time of the year

One of my favourite parts of Istanbul. Gülhane is beautiful, safe, busy, relaxed and charming, being a favourite spot for couples, families and many besides. Situated just beneath Topkapı you get that sense of history but also a sense of seclusion, of rising above the busy city, hard to find elsewhere. There's a beautiful little cafe and some fantastic views over the Bosphorus and it seems relatively undiscovered by tourists. An absolute must.
Nice quiet cool clean place in the middle of it all. Chill oyt here on the way from 1 zone to the next. Make a few local friends.can go to evrrywhere from here

very nice park. The park was nothing like those of other cities. Nice benches under trees to have rest under the shades of trees, ornamental bushes and flowers. Flowers round and water fountains. Trees are huge and lush greenery… Situated right next to TOPKAPI palace, not far than 10 minutes walking. Be careful about the extremely overpriced restaurants specially this at the exit of the garden
Heaven. I wish there was a better rating than excellent ! My visit was early April - just in time for all the tulips, which made the place really stunning. Loved it and would go there again
Great People Watching. A great place in Istanbul to people watch. Lots of young families walk up and down the park. At one end you are in Sultanahmet and the other at the Bosphorus.

Tıme for a break. It ıs a nıce break from a very tırıng day, jumpıng from an attractıng to another. Just sıt relax and enjoy the beautıful vıew ın this cıty park. Great opportunıty to ınteract wıth the locals.

marvellous view of istanbul. the best garden in the world because of it`s view it is really amazing view overlloking all parts of istanbul Bosphorus, Asian and European side .. it is not that famous in sulatan ahmed square but you must ask and visit and walk till the end of the park then go right side up to the cafes there which are very cheap and has a marvellous view

Beautiful city park. Very nice and big park that used to be a Topkapi garden. Very nice place to visit before or after visiting Topkapi Palace tour where you can rest in the peaceful environment. It is free of charge to enter the park and you can find very beautiful sculptures and view to the sea area.Visited in May

Peaceful Escape!. Head to the tea gardens at the very end of Gulhane Park. Great view & no matter what time of year this mark is so beautiful. The pathway lined with the beautiful trees - a nice escape from a bustling City!

A place to sit down and let your legs rest. The park is quite big with many benches. Some people just sit on the grass. After lots of walking from the Blue Mosque to Hagia Sophia and to Topkapi Palace, this is a nice place to relax in the evening, below the tall trees, away from the sun. Men selling tea and snacks walking about but won't pester you. Beware of women selling flowers. She'll talk to you in Turkish or a different language and put the flower on your lap. Tell her no and ask her to take it away. I didn't touch the flower just in case "once touch, you have to pay" policy we experienced a day before. We were cheated by a shoe shiner in Karakoy just by being a Good Samaritan because he dropped his brush without him realising. We told him and picked it up and he said he will clean my partner's shoes for free. All he did was wet them with soapy water. My partner wanted to give a few lira coins even though it was free, but the shoe shiner said that's money for bottle water and asked for 19liras. Gave him 10liras and walked away.

A nice place to sit and have some rest.. Visited after completing Topkapi Palace tour. A nice place to sit and have some rest. Easy to access. There's a story of a poet who had been chased by police and came here, climbed a tree, and his lover also arrived and she did not notice him either.
Beautiful Fountains!!!. Lovely park right near Topkapi palace with 3 pretty fountains.The park is a haven amid the bustling center where tourists and locals retreat.
Time out. A great place to take time out from exploring the area and have a sit down and watch life go by or picnic on the bread and corn available at the stalls around the entrance to the park.
Peace & Beauty. Even though this place is always packed, you'll be able to find your comfortable spot. Have a nice picnic, enjoy beautiful flowers, relax.
Peaceful place. Nice and peaceful park, great place to escape the busy city area of Sultanahmed. Also can visit Topkapi palce here which is also nice to see
A place to relax. It is a wonderful historical park , you can find sometime during your visit to Ayasophia museum to visit this park as it located beside it.
nice park. it's about a nice and peaceful park with a lot of shady trees , benches and decorations, it's also a nice place for a relaxed break after a long walk.

nice place to have a rest in between excursions. nice place to relax. lots of locals are here for the sake of the shadowy and chilly place it is. a place to have a rest just before visit to the palace :) or hagia sophia, or wherever nearby :)

Peaceful walk. Happened upon the park by accident, and delightfully surprised. The flowers, statues, benches and such were all so nicely kept. Children running around, people resting in the park. Very tranquil and relaxing.
Not that interesting. Stumbled into this park by accident. Its nice but nothing very interesting inside. Has a nice big bronze statue of Attaturk.

worth a visit. We walked throught the park to get to the ferry area which takesLonger than walking along the road where the tram goes. The park has lots of trees and so it was a pleasant walk as it was a hot day. You can just sit and relax on the benches and there is also a good status of ataturk. You can buy drinks and ice cream as well.

Tranquil. Appears to be very popular amongst tourists and locals. It is a public gardens and is rather peaceful. Lotsa trees fountains walkways and many benches to rest especially if you're walking with the elderly. Lovely quiet peaceful experience.

lots of shade, and a great little playground for kids. Perfect if you are here with a toddler.. lots of shade, and a great little playground for kids. Perfect if you are here with a toddler. family friendly.
Great Park. It deserves someone to visit it with his/her family .. very huge, clean , wonderful place .. It has got clean rest room and very great café ..

A partial oasis. Walked through on a Sunday when the Park was packed, mainly with local people. It is a pleasant enclave away from the hordes of us tourists, but a bit mucky, litter overflowing from bins and strewn on paths. Nevertheless it is pleasant to walk through.
Beautiful park. Great place to take a walk around in the evening or just sit down under a shade and relax. I can only said it look just like these online picture i have seen.
Lovely shady park. We sat and enjoyed a snack in the park it was great to find some shade lots of families having picnics plenty of street vendors offering a variety of snacks and drinks
Lovely place to take pictures. We spent couple of hours for taking pictures. Wonderful view! The best time to visit is of course morning.
Well kept park in the historic district. Took a stroll one evening. It was pleasant, the park is and well maintained, mostly geared towards children and families.
dirty , not like the pics you see online. bad experience, over crowded, and dirty. not something you anticipate after looking up the online pictures
Lovely Park!. Gulhane Park was stunning! The grass and waters were well kept, and it was quite breathtaking to see the park. This was very relaxing, and a great place to bring the family!

Beautiful escape. I love this park! It offers a beautiful escape from the city and also a cool escape - lots of shade means you can cool down on a hot day. It also offers some interesting/unusual public art/statues for you to explore as well

Peaceful reflection . After a morning of sightseeing, walking slowly through and sitting in Gulhane Park was so very relaxing and provided a time to recharge the energy level and to reflect on all that had already been experienced in Istanbul. The grounds are meticulously cared for and are absolutely beautiful. Take a few moments to appreciate the views which generations of Ottoman royalty saw. No big excitement here, but plenty of peace!

gulhane park. charming park , full of flowers even in summer , quite , romantic , excellent for walks and for children to play , well organized , clean very close to sultanahmet , you can walk from there
one of the relaxant corners of istanbul. its nice to walk around and relax here you can just seat down and enjoy the view or have something to drink or snack on.
Nice place. Very good park you can lie down ans relax we like this park big very big park we was happy there. .. we always went to there also near topkapi place ita good place and free...
Peaceful heaven. Great park with mature trees. You can enjoy your on-the-way lunch in this place if you are walking from Sultan Ahmet to Top Kapi
Best Places for tea during day time. The best for a long walk and do not forget top go Sea Entrance of park, walk up stairs and enjoy tea and great Sea view
Relax with an ice cream after visiting the Aya Sofia!. This is such a pretty park! Full of locals hanging out with picnics. A great spot for people watching and a welcome respite from the main sites.
Beautiful park. Beautifull park in the heart og Istanbul around Topkapi Palace. You can walking 1 and more hour, relax and visit some objects

A nice place to enjoy your time after visiting the Topkapi Palace. This park is very close to the Topkapi Palace and the Museum of the History of Science and Technology in Islam. Therefore, it is a good place to have a nice time, enjoying the place which is very relaxing. Doing this while having some Turkish tea would be very perfect. There is a place where you can do this.Definitely one should visit this place

A Good Park Adjacent to Aya Sophia. A reasonable park to let the kids run around in and enjoy. It had one major playground area. If you have small kids, you know it takes very little to please them. A swing set in the boonies of America or in busy Istanbul will make them squeal with excitement! Good place to take break from Aya Sophia/Blue Mosque and other sites that kids may get tired of touring.

BIRD POOP GARDEN!. Seen much better kept parks/gardens in my holidays. I wouldn't say this one was very well kept for a capital city. Lots of patches of dead grass and bird poo everywhere including the benches which isn't very visitor friendly. Istanbul has a lot of improvements to make. They need more flowers too, it was just grass and trees everywhere, didn't feel very park like.
Nice Park. A nice part of Istanbul to relax in. Close to Topkapi Place as well as Haga Sophia. In August a prefect place to watch the world go by.

A perfect place to relax . It's a hot day in Istanbul.. I thought it would be good idea to pass on the park and take a break before we continue our walking to spice bazaar and Sirkage. It's just next to Gülhane tramway station and entrance is free. Good place for all types of visitors. I suggest to have any kind of transportation across the park it's around 169k m2 and can't cover on foots.

Hotel. We stayed in the Gulhane Park hotel,very good service and it was also so close to all the attractions in the old city,walking distance to everything,lots of lovely shopping to be done right near our hotel, the Gulhane Park was also very lovely to wander through.

Gulhane Park. This place is like a breath of fresh air in a hot, crowded city. It is right in the centre of the city, but once you enter the gates the hustle & bustle of the city fade away. The gardens are beautifully kept and it isvery pleasant to sit under the tree and catch your breath for a few miutes
ehh. Only green space in the city but a below average park. tea at the restaurant worth it. dontt go if you do not like birds!

You Must Walk Here, Not for the Sights per say, but for the feel of it.. As we strolled here each day ( from our hotel) to get to each sight, or to the tram, one has a sense of the centuries. Many of the men hustling to be a guide, or sell you something are on the rude to obnoxious scale. Just ignore them.

A bit of tranquility. I had walked by the park wall several times before finally venturing in, and I'm sure glad I did. It is a beautiful, calming park, even though it was still high season for tourists. There are benches available so you can just sit and take in the beauty. There was a vendor selling grilled corn so if you wanted to, you could just sit and have a snack. It would be a great place to have a picnic lunch, perhaps a Turkish doner!
A Walk oin the Park !. Beautiful trees and flowers ! Great place to stroll through daytime or evening.Right next to the Topkapi Palace. Many benches to sit and relax.

Nice walk and marvelous Tea Garden. It has two gates. One from the historic area of Sultanahmet and the other to the sea side. You can sit and relax and have the traditional Turkish tea with a high location with a wonderful Marama sea and the Phosphorus bridge.

A nice, green break. Visited after completing Topkapi Palace tour. A nice place to sit and have some rest. Easy to access. There's a story of a poet who had been chased by police and came here, climbed a tree, and his lover also arrived and she did not notice him either.
Worth a visit. Nice public park centrally located. Well shaded by mature trees to keep you cool in the heat of the day. Ideal for having a nice Turkish ice cream!
the park. another beautiful scenery for natural park with fresh air to breathe... very relaxing and self-healing
Nice park.. Nice park to go to have a break from all the historical attractions. Went there in the spring, it was tulip time, beautiful.
beautiful park for family!. Enjoyed this park with my family! Enjoyed tea from the local man who brought it to the park. Beautiful place!

Walking distance from Hagia Sophia & Blue Mosque!. Beautiful and free! Quiet and peaceful early in the morning before the crowds! Not far at all from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, etc. We walked there in the morning during August. As hot as the days are, the park was cool in the morning due to the ocean breeze from nearby. The sycamore trees are a must see since this used to be the royal garden!
Beautiful and green. A good choice if you need a rest and admire nature. Also there is a nice restaurant near the Park with decent prices.

Great and huge. It is a great and huge park with great scene from above where you can see bosphorus bridge and sea in the upper restaurants. Majority of museums are near the park and you will anyway enter to this park and you will like it.

From Topkapi till the Galata Bridge. Exit Topkapi on the way of the Archeological museum go down till you see the Tram. Then follow down the tram line it will bring you till the Galata harbour. A nice ride. Then before Galata bridge you can take a ferry for 4TL to do like locals in Uskudar Asian side and then Bektasi, Bebek, ...

Любимый парк:). Always a lot of people there. This park is close to my house, so usually I start my day with jogging in this park.During the summer time Gulhane Park full, but it's huge, so don't worry, you will find a place where you will spend your time.It's very easy to find this park: tramway stop "Gulhane"I'm in love with Istanbul.

A quiet respite in the middle of the city. We stayed only 5 minutes away from the park and walked though it several times. It is beautiful, clean, has interesting historical items, and its' walls keep the city noise out. It gets very crowded during the weekend, which is predictable, but is quite quiet during the week.

Beautiful, Relaxing and Huge. Its a huuuge park and on the way to Topkapi palace. Beautiful massive green grassy spaces with prettily cut shrubs/bushes planted everywhere. Huge tall trees lined up on the pathways. We spotted some rose bushes or so too. Lots of people were just lying down or relaxing on the grassy patches....and u can see many tourists walking to Topkapi palace.
happy feet in turkey. It was amazing to see so many people enjoying their sunday evening. Nice sprawling greens perfect for a sunday evening with family and friends.
ok. This is a long park, nothing spectacular. You will find tree and flower and small water fountain which are common every where.
Ok. Limited shelter from the heat in the height of summer but this is a well kept park and gives some greenery to a city that is mostly very built up

Peacefully serenity in middle of bustling city. Loved walking through this park during the afternoon heat.
Cool relaxing and peaceful.
Some interesting statues and lovely shrubberie and fountains.
Part of historical complex of Topkapi Palace.. Beautiful introduction to surrounding historical sites, such as Topkapi Palace and Museum of Science and Technology in Islam.
Nice place. Nice and quite garden. Near Topkapi palace .you can reach by metro easly . Huge trees and water ,many types of flowers. Nice place

Peaceful. If you are in the area seeing the Hagia Sophia etc., take a little time to unwind in this large park. It can get busy in the evening and at weekends, but otherwise is not crowded. It is a well kept pretty park with flowers, and very tall trees forming a canopy over the walkways. You can find refreshments in the park.

It's a Park. As you stroll down the shaded avenues of this park, imagine that you have been transported back in time to the age of the Ottoman Empire. Imagine that the people milling around you are not there to block your way, but instead to fan you gently with large palm leaves, and pass you cold beverages to quench your thirst, or dolma to satiate your hunger.Unfortunately reality has a habit of reasserting itself, the park stubbornly remains in the 21st century, and the crowds are merely crowds. Nonetheless, a pleasant walk.
nice city park. lovely for a stroll away from the hustle and bustle of the busy streets. tea, coffee and refershments available cheaply

Serene, tall trees, not over crowded. It's a park. Its serene (unlike a lot of places in Istanbul), have beautiful tall trees and green grounds. Walking distance from a lot of attractions so good place to take a break. Avoid the museum in there we had bad experience with power failures and unfriendly staff.

Beautiful park for walking and relaxing.. A very beautiful and romantic place to go for a walk, or relax on the grass. Sit on a bench with your sweetheart and enjoy the sound of the water fountains and pond. Very clean and safe to walk in the evening. An oasis in the city.
Depends on what you like. . If you think you would like to spend half a day in a green area and relax it would be a nice place. But since today weather was too humid, we didn't like it that much.

A natural retreat. One of the good things we booked our hotel for is its proximity to Gulhane Park. We visited the park almost on a daily basis to enjoy its beauty and to meditate.The park is just few minutes walk to Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia and Gulhane Tram Station. It has a clean and a well serviced WC, but you need to keep change on you as you have to pay 1TL as a fee.

Amazing view from the top. Gulhane is big enough for everyone and it is nicely green. It has tea sets on the top and you can see the whole Bogaz from here. They have some fun statues and stands as well.
One of good parks. Very beautiful fresh green and tidy park. Part of other sight seeing places of area..,very well managed with specially grown colourful flowers here.

Beautiful oasis!. We had a rest here on a busy day of sightseeing! There are lots of tall trees so plenty of shade, and some lovely fountains to watch or paddle in! There is even ice cream for sale there. The only thing it needs was more benches, but we didn't mind sitting on the ground.
Normal garden. Just Normal garden nothing special about it Just the view in the end of it unless you have extra time
A place to relax & unwind. A wonderful park to go for a walk and chill. Lots of greenery and structures that you would see nowhere.

Beautiful!. We unknowingly wandered into this park and became enchanted with the beautiful benches, landscaping and fountains. It's an absolute must-see on your way up to see the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia.
The Rose garden. Lovely early evening walk through this park. Clean and tidy with some nice sculptures. It is easy to find and below the Topkapi Palace. Popular with locals

Quiet and relaxing. Great for walking and relaxing away from the hustle and bustle of the city at times. Walk to the end of the park and have a nice tea in traditional teapots and enjoy the phosphorus view.
Fairytale Park. Absolutely gorgeous, very scenic and refreshing after a day of sightseeing. Just relax and enjoy the breeze <3

Tranquiler park . A nice &calm place for your kids to enjoy at few hundred meters from gulhane tram station at the foot of topkapi very near to aya Sofia, basillic cistern and sultanahmet lots of lovely turkish restaurants nearby don't miss.
Mahmoud Yamani
Jordan
An oasis in the middle of Istanbul. This stunning park is perfect to catch a break while exploring Istanbul. Just sit down and relax, the park will take care of you!
wonderful walk. we hade a really wonderful walk there during the day and made a really cool photo session next to Topcapi museum

Gulhane Park. We stayed in a hotel opposite Gulhane Park it is an oasis of gardens, water features, grass to relax on and for families to spend time together amid all the chaos of busy life in Istanbul.
Nice park. Visited the park during spring. Beautiful with varieties of tulips.. A size-able park to walk around.
A little oasis in an otherwise busy concrete city. Stunning family park with lovely paths filled with people relaxing, taking romantic walks and even plenty of newlyweds taking photos!

A lovely park to relax. Lovely park to chill out at. Plenty of areas to sit down. Quirky little things to see. Generally a great layout of the park, providing opportunities to seclude yourself at the same time.

Stroll with the locals. I lived in Istanbul but had never been here until after I came back for a visit. This park is located right underneath the topkapi palace, which is probably the reason not many tourists go there. Too bad, since it is very, well, Turkish. There is a lovely, authentic tea garden (cai bahce) right at the edge, overlooking the Bosporus where you can have a glass of tea and a snack. Even though you are right near one of Turkey's most famous sights, you will not find many tourists here. Definitely off the beaten track.There are several things to take a look at. There are also good public restroom facilities (for a small amount).
Beautiful park. Lovely park, in which you can seat or ever lie down on the grass. In this full of beatiful flowers and trees you can find a littlbe bit shadow on a hot day.

Tranquil and green place. Amazing green space in the very center, Don't miss the terrace (called Setustu Cay Bahcesi, it's near the upper entrance) where you can drink Turkish tea or coffee with amazing Bosphorus view!
A great break from all the cement and marble and transit. This park is beautiful and the coolest place in Istanbul without air conditioning. A breeze just naturally blows thru.
A place to get away from the noise and bustle of the tourists. After the hustle and bustle of Istanbul streets and attractions this park offers a chance to sit and relax.
In season there are colors galore!. Go in April when the tulips are in bloom-every color you can imagine! Nice place to catch your breath after seeing the Topkapi Palace.
Nice park to relax. If there is too many people in the streets, you can always stop by in the park, where you also will find the Science & Technology Museum of Islam.

Nice spot to escape from the caos of the city.... Gülhane Parkı...Once upon a time,many years ago,this park was in bad conditions.Now,it is servicing to its community with excellent park facilities and cafes.Here you can escape from the caos of the city where you can relax in total quiet ambiance of the park.Very well maintained and clean park to take a rest.

Parrots in the park. After a few visits to Istanbul this park was an oasis from the hurly burly of a very busy city! Lovely to wander through and see parrots (yes parrots) flying round high up in the massive trees. Continue on the the end up the hill and you come to a cafe overlooking the Bosphorus where you can sit with a pot of Turkish tea or coffee and a piece of Turkish delight..lovely..

Beautiful park. Beautiful park along the seaside and good view to bosphorus .I's close to topkapi and archaeological museum. there are so many old trees and different type with colorful flower that will amaze you.Don't remember to drink turkish tea on seaside park (Bosphorus view)

Calm and kittens.. A good place for a quiet stroll or a picnic. The tea terraces overlooking the Bosporus are a good place to spend some time and watch the traffic crossing between Europe and Asia. The prices are very reasonable especially if you order a large samovar which seems to last forever!
Beautiful!. Very nice place to make a picnic or a stroll after visiting the monuments in Sultan Ahmet. You can even have a coffee at one end of the park with an amazing view of the Bosphorus.

the gardens and the view. a beautiful relaxing park , even so it was the end of end of Ramadan (maybe not quite as peaceful) there must have been thousands of people. they were picnicking all over the place, on the benches, the grass and on the side of the pond. there are huge trees, lovely flowerbeds and there were no restrictions where the children could play. it was of course much less busy after the weekend although still plenty of visitors about. the view from the restaurants to the Bosporus was very soothing. the restaurants are terraces so there are not lots of people at one place
Tree lined park in Istanbul. Nice park in the old city. Park was very crowded with families when we were there (however this was during Sugar Feast right after conclusion of Ramadan).

nice escape from the bustling city. Found the place by accident the first time. Had heard about it before, but didn't actually believe it's such a nice place. But i loved the location of it. So close to everything important, and yet so quiet, so cool, and so peaceful here. When you're tired of walking around in the city, this is definitely a great place to sit down and relax for a while. I didn't make it to the tulip season, but the park was still very nice nonetheless. One afternoon, i just sat in the park and read. Not exactly a touristy thing to do, but definitely very enjoyable.

Beautiful park. Our family had fun in this beautiful park. Unfortunately at the beginning of the park locals have left a lot of litter. Once we got past that initial part, we enjoyed the landscaping and peacefulness. It's worth checking out if you have some down time in Istanbul.

Beauty of Istanbul. A wonderful park - well maintained and great place in Summer or Winter for a stroll and relax. The park restaurant is great for a snack or a coffee/ chai while exploring.There are great views of the Golden Horn as well as some ancient Roman ruins at the Bosphorous end of the park.The park is a place where locals enjoy weekends and evenings with family, friends or lovers for a tranquil garden-like experience.

Best for rest. This park is next to Topkapı Palace (I think it belonged to the palace before). It is rather large. We loved the cafe on the side of the park. We enjoyed the stunning view of Bosphorus.
Dirty and crowded. This is a park in Istanbul. No restaurant, no Cafe. There are a lot of couples and crowded. WC is near the doors. Clean and crowded as well.

A Quiet Spot in Old Istanbul. In the complete madness that is this part of Istanbul you can find a nice quiet green space with pretty fountains, a statue of Ataturk, and a children's playground. Also good WCs and a few places to buy food.
Beautiful. This park is green and serene.Its a nice break from the hustle and bustle of walking around Istanbul.Nice break.
Perfect location for a walk. Loved this park,just behind the topkapı palace and it was just so cool to sit and view the Istanbul.

Every city should have one. or be the poorer without. Clean and well looked after. It was nearly full of people celebrating Eid al-Fitr, locally known as Seker Bayrami. The joy of the crowds was contagious

A rest from a summer heat. It is fine shady park in which it is possible to have a rest from a summer heat. It is possible to buy take-away on city streets and to eat it here on one of a set of benches.

Never seen anything like this.. This park is a place which you can't oevrlook when you go to Istanbul. It is a very beautiful and relaxing place. If you walk through it to the end, and go up-right you will see the outer side of Topkapi Palace's wall (bastion). There is a cafe there as well with a OUTSTANDIG and BREATHTAKING and MAGNIFICENT view on Bosphours bridge. So, do not miss it. :D

Very nice park. Our hotel was very close to this park. It was very peaceful and clean. Inside you can see a lot of beautiful flowers and you have a lot of benches where you can rest.Inside the park you have the Museum of History and Science and Technology in Islam and also the entry to the Istanbul Archelogical Museum .

A bit of calm and tranquility.. Nice place to cool off and wander - away from the hustle and bustle of the city .It's nestled at the foot of the Topkapi Palace. there is a cafe and drinks vendors are placed discreetly around so youo can get refreshments. You can sit and paddle your feet in a smal pool, sit and contemplate or just stroll. It was onlly a few huundred yards from our Boutique Hotel (St Sophia) and the Hagia Sophie & Blue Mosque.
It's ok. Some great old trees, some lovely foliage. Drop in for a restful few minutes if you happen to be in the area. Not worth a dedicated trip.

Unexpected lovely green space in Istanbul. I spent several hours in the Park (close to the Topkapi Palace). It was nice to have a spot where I could get away from the crowds. While there are people in the park, it is large enough to find a quiet area. There are fountains, bridges, grass, flowers, benches, sculptures and of course people watching opportunities.

Nice break from touring. Situated in the heart of a tourist area this park is a beautiful and relaxing way to break up you day. It's surprisingly large and there is a few restaurants if you want food.
Peaceful and relaxing. Even on the Eid/Bayram holiday it was peaceful and relaxing, for all the crowds. Some of the gardens needed some tending, but overall it was a lovely spot on a hot day.

magnificent flowrs. It is one of the best park in Istanbul & way to escape from busy city to relax few hours in green area with clear air.In addition there are large group of beautiful flowers in different kind and i like how they plants.I recommandeered this place for family'sGülhane Park , "house of flowers") is a historical urban park in the Eminönü district of Istanbul, Turkey; it is located adjacent to and on the grounds of the Topkapı Palace. The south entrance of the park sports one of the larger gates of the palace. It is the oldest and one of the most expansive public parks in Istanbul.
nice park. Very nice park with London planetrees, fountains and a lot of flowers in different colours, perfect place to relax a bit.

Beautiful place to relax. We only walked through right around sunset, but the park was lovely and clean. Many people and families sitting on blankets in the grass and eating (breaking Ramadan fast). There is a cafe overlooking the water with gorgeous views.
Just Chillin'. A great place to relax in the heat and just chill for a while. You can walk to the harbour from here. An excellent place to people watch or for the kids to let off some steam.
gem of a garden. The lovliest park. Well maintained. Beautiful blooming annuals and perennials. Hidden from the bustle is a coffee shop. Inexpensive and good
Cool spot for the day.. Enjoy a quiet walk , relaxing picnic, the flower and rose beds, water features and coolness from the hustle and bustle out side the walls of the vibrant city.
Beautiful in April. We loved this park in the month of May. Tulips were beautiful and blooming everywhere! There were so many colors and designs and just so many flowers.

FOR A QUIET FEW HOURS NONE BETTER !. A truly wonderful park with shady trees and colourful flower beds. A favourite of locals and visitors alike especially in the late afternoon and evening yet always peaceful. Provides wonderful views over the sea. Just relax in the outdoor café area and take in the views ! An unforgettable and relaxing experience.

This park is north of and adjacent to the Topkapi Palace grounds.. After the hustle and bustle of visiting the nearby tourist sites, take a moment to sit in this oasis of greenery and watch the legions of tourists walk by. Some know exactly where they are going; others seem totally clueless and lost.
Stroll thru gulhane park. Beautiful, cool, free, and close by the other old town sites. A great way to spend an hour and do what locals do, enjoy their park.
Blissfully beautiful break from the city. Taking in the scenery, relaxing on the grass or eating an ice cream in this clean, tranquil public park is a perfect way to spend an hour or two.
Lovely. Its just next to topkapi palace exit. There you get fruit vendors, some old statues. Pleasant to walk along. Walkable to Gulhane Tram station and also Basilica cistern.

beautiful garden. A place of beauty and a park full of fragrant and beautiful flowers that can be felt in the morning calm
It is worth seeing and a walk in the park
Lush and green, great for a relaxing break!. What a beautiful oasis next to Topkapi Palace and its for free! Beautiful flowers, bridges, relaxing atmosphere.

A walk in the Park.. Beautiful park in old part of Istanbul. Lots of shady trees to sit under in the heat of Istanbul. Also the park has a restaurant and cafe. The Topkapi palace is in the park, which is really worth a visit.

A beautiful shady tranquility. This park alongside Topkapi palace is both calming and beautiful. The flower beds are full of colour in July - I believe they are even more beautiful in spring with tulips. The grass is well cared for and there are little statuettes throughout. It a place to laze away a couple of hours out of the sun in a haven of tranquility before returning to hustle and noise of the City life
Gulhane Park. If you visit Topkapi Palace, I recommend strolling through this park. There are beautiful flower beds and this is one of the few large green spaces in the city.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park, great place to relax. We often sat here to read a book or just looked at the people. During Ramadan it's fun to watch sneaky people behind trees secretively eating ;)

heavily frequented park on the back TopKapi palace. this is a nice park that runs the entire length of TopKapi palace. It offers many seating chairs and fountains. Families frequent this park. A good place to take a break from walking around old Istanbul.

Nice Park in the Topkapi Palace Ground. A picturesque park that was once the front yard for the Topkapi Palace. Nice fountains and attractions. Added feature are the dogs who live on the park grounds. Though they probably are homeless dogs, they seemed well fed and in good health. Very interesting

A Place to Stroll. This is a large park with many pathways near the Topkapi Palace. There are many trees and benches which makes it a relaxing place to walk and sit. We even found a restaurant overlooking the Bosphorus River where we had a leisurely pot of tea.

Lovely peace of nature in an otherwise bustling city.. A lovely walk through this Park is a must if you are visiting Istanbul. Lots of different things to see and nice places to sit and relax. A great chance to take off your shoes and walk barefoot on the green grass or admire the lovely tall trees that provide good shade and quiet resting places to close your eyes for a couple of minutes to recharge the batteries before taking Istanbul on foot again.
Amazing view of Bosphorus. Very nice park, relaxing. The most beautiful view of Bosphorus can be seen from there while tasting turkish coffee or tea.
a hidden forest just in the heart ow the town!... my special thanks to the mayor of İstanbul. he converted this garbage area to a place of excellence. a peacful paradise...

Very clean and relaxing. Make some break in this park, after lonk walking day is like to be in heaven. it was very clean and full with decorative flowers. Very nice place where everybody can find place to sit or lye on the grass.
lovely place. we were here in April, 2015. my family and friend's family. it was a very lovely park, full of tulip flowers. my son loved it very much. i'll come back again for sure

Relaxing zone in the middle of the city. It is a nice green oasis in the middle of the old town. On our way to the Topkapi palace we stumbled on it. It is full of nice flowers, clean, interestingly arranged!

Springtime Splendor. We were lucky the visit to park at the peak tulip time. The flowerbeds were a riot of color and the flowering trees were beautiful. This park is a lovely spot to escape the crowds and relax. Appeared to be popular with young and old. Watching the birds with their newborn chicks in the nests high up in the huge trees was very therapeutic.
Calm and green. Go for a rest while visiting the Old City - Gulhane Park offers greenery and colorful flowers with loads of benches to rest tired feet.

Green lung. It is allways nice to get to a quiet place with green Grass and Trees with singing Birds. There is also a lot of Flowers in this large park.Benches are placed along the Paths. Turks and foreign tourist are really relaxing here

from the hotel 5 mınutes by the walkıng. all hıstorıcal place and gulhane parkıng walkıng dıstance sea side
to eıgept bazar to where you need ıts hotel aquarıum percefect locatıon

A quiet oasis.... This is a lovely park adjacent (or even part of) the old district of Istanbul. It is worth going for a walk through it or spend time resting from the hustle and bustle of sightseeing.

Gulhane Park. an excellent site and amazing nature and comfortable park , all that lead to GULHANE PARK , the first thing attract you represented with varieties of flowers especially TULIPS , which are arranged very carefully with beautiful green grass , you can see that with attached images from there , you will be admired with tall trees which are interlocked in such a way that prevent sun`s rays , really i think it`s useless ti describe or imagine tha magical scenes

Not only beautiful, but perfect for morning jogs and streches. I would recommend to mix up morning jogs and sightseeing to have the ultimate pleasure of seeing this park. The entrance of The Archeologiical Museum is also nearby.
Lovely city centre park.. A delightful park next to the Topkapi Palace. Planted with innumerable flowers, and with pleasant water features and cafe.

listen to the birds.... it is really close to topkapi palace , archeological museum , st.sophia , etc...so if you would like to rest a little bit , while listening to birds , drinking turkish coffee , this is an ideal place...

charming place. you might know that Gulhane Park is adjusting Topcapi Palace; very nice park in the middle of the over-packed neighborhood...you can have a perfect rest in the shadow of the century old trees and enjoy the singing of birds...though there are a lot of craws as well... i love this place with its flowers and charming atmosphere...

An oasis in the middle of Istanbul ~. I love to take walks in Gulhane Park, and around the Topkapi Palace grounds, whenever I'm in Istanbul. It's beautiful and serene, clean and always brimming with people, and yet it doesn't feel crowded.

Beautiful park. Located in the historic Istanbul's Old City, just next to Topkapi Palace and not far from Sultanahmet area, this park is a great place for a relaxing stroll and enjoy a moment of peace from the hustle and bustle of the city. It's a very beautiful park, full of flowers with huge shade trees. Don't forget to keep walking through the park until you reach the cafe to enjoy amazing views of Bosphorus and Asian side of Istanbul. It's also well-connected to the other part of the city as Gulhane tram station is situated just near the entrance.
Nice place to rest your tired feet!. Lovely to rest in between visits. Very peaceful and tidy garden, I wish I have had more time to explore it...

Definitely worth seeing!. It's so nice to get off the streets and out of the traffic in Istanbul. Pretty well kept park in the historical district. Check it out. Emirgan Park, Yildiz Park, Macka Park, and Sanatcilar Park are also good for walking/running.

An oasis in the city. A delightful find and oasis away from the tourist areas even though it is located directly under the Topkapi place grounds. This place is a popular one with the residents of Istanbul on weekends but on a weekday there are few people there and you can have a quiet and leisurely stroll in the beautiful grounds, sit on the numerous benches, or have a cup of tea in the cafe that looks out to Princes Island and across to the Asian side of Turkey.

An oasis within a city jungle. Its the ideal place for a break. After all the walking, you can relax in Gulhane Park, near the Topkapi palace or after wandering in the bazaar. Let your body and mind bounce back under the trees and take pictures among the gardens.

Tulips everywhere!. The park is just nice for you to walk and enjoy the morning breeze. This is a must see if you are visiting Topkapi Palace, it's right next to it. Spend like 15-30 mins to just smell the fresh air and enjoy the colours.
Beautiful. I really like this park. you can see many bride there who take photos for wedding. If you have much time in istanbul it's worth to see.

Beautiful Park. Amazing park next to the palace. It has beautiful gardens full of exotic flowers and trees. You can see green parrots flying everywhere. This place is peaceful and excellent just to relax and enjoy nature for a while. We came early in the morning, so it was just empty. Spectacular!!!

Best spot to take Bosphorus pictures. In my opinion best time to visit this park is early morning, when you can have it practically for yourself. Even their little tavern will be most probably closed, you can get there and take great pictures on Bosphorus. Ladies may enjoy photographing in the historic outfits available all around. Both entrance and the toilets in the Park are free
Beautiful Park. We find this by accident when looking for the Topkapi Palace.Very peaceful park in the heart of the city with beautiful flowers,bridges and fountains.Well worth a visit

A getaway from the Istanbul Hustle Bustle. I was quite tired of all the shop keepers and bargaining and noise and hustle bustle of Istanbul so I took a good book and set off for a 3 hour rejuv. Session at the park. Loved every bit of it!

Very nice park in the heart of the most busiest part of the city.. When you are finished yr itinerary touring in and around the touristic venues of Sultanahmet district,then heading to the Sirkeci side through the tram road,you will see this nice park in yr right hand side behind the city walls.Very large and nicely maintained park to take some rest in total relax being far from the chaos and heavy traffic of the city.Walk down and up in the park and have some good time while eating some snacks and drinking at any of available cafes with magnificient Bosphorus and Marmara Sea view.Highly advised to take a rest during a long day walking tour in the historical zone.
Just beautiful and free!. Free and the tram stops right there so you can hop on and off. Take Gulhane stop for four lira about 1.50 US dollars
Lively park by Topkapi Palace. Families strolling, couples courting, parakeets screeching, and ancient monuments that you chance across. Great fun!

like in once upon a time.... the garden is reallllly beautiful, lots of flowers with different colours and birds. It was amazing in itself too.I felt myself like in once upon a time :D ı really recommend to visit there
Magical. Beautiful colorful flowers, things attracts you to go and see from near,,, I recommend you to go there.

Tulips were just awesome. Visited the place in the month of April, there were all kinds of tulips all around. Nice place to sit and relax after walking around in near by attractions. Park is well maintained and has restroom facilities also.

an oasis of peace. situated in the middle of the historic city, this garden is an oasis of peace in the heat and bustle. Perfect for a quiet interlude in the middle of the day. The restaurant provides some nice refreshments.

Gulhane Park. Gulhane park is one of the most beautiful parks in the world. It has water fountains and is very big. Also, the trees are so beautiful. It is a wonderfull place to retreat to and relax in a city that never sleeps

Lovely park to rest, relax, or just stroll through.. A great shaded park with majestic trees, a delightful walkway guides you through the well maintained, beautiful flower beds, fountains at the top end, quite delightful.Just one word of warning, if you enter at the top end from Topkapi Palace/Hagia Sophia, the stroll through takes you well round the Golden Horn to the exit below Topkapi. It is a long walk along a busy road to get to the Galata Bridge or you have to walk all the way back, uphill! There is a cafe on the left half way down where you can exit left.

Peace & Tranquility. Excellent Park, ideal for slow stroll to unwind after sightseeing. Floral arrangements very good and they had trays and trays of flowers ready to plant to keep it looking first class. Plenty of people around but its very big with plenty of open spaces.
Gulhane Park. Attractive parkland with attractive flower beds. There were plentiful refreshment areas and toilet facilities.
tulips and people. It is very beautiful place during tulip blooming. A lot of ppl. Families, students, tourists. Good plsce to rest after visiting museums.
Lovely walk. Lovely park near Topkapi Palace. Well worth a stroll through it. Beautifully maintained. The patterns of flowers were very beautiful.

A Historically Rich Urban Park in the Eminönü. The park which is a riot of flowers that mainly includes roses, tulips, pansies, bluebonnets and more situated just down the hill north of Sultanahmet along Alemdar Caddesi adjoining the Museum of The History of Science and Technology in Islamic complex and Topkapı Palace the Gülhane Park was once the outer garden of Topkapı Palace, accessed only by the royal court and later converted into a small zoo and now back again to being a recreational park these days is crowded by locals and tourists alike to picnic or simply beat the heat under the many trees, boulevard past the formally planted flowerbeds, and enjoy wonderful views over the Golden Horn and Sea of Marmara .

A magnificent surprise - tulips galore!. We know nothing about Gulhane Park, but happened to walk in looking for the Topkapi Palace. Luckily for us, it was tulip season and there they were, in full bloom! A magnificent array of colours and garden designs - acres of them! Simply breathtaking. So lucky to have seen them at this time of year.

Quiet, cool park!. For a respite from the chaos go for a walk in this quiet park with huge shade trees. At the end of the park, Golden Horn end, take a left and go to the cafe with great views out over the wall and harbour! Great traditional Turkish tea here for a cheap price!

Lovely Park. If you need a day of just reflecting, reading or writing, Gulhane Park is the best. It has both public spaces and quiet corners. I suggest, take a bottle of water with you and better yet, take traveling mug of tea/coffee with you.

Great stroll through the park. Walking through this park is a great way to relax and take in the scenery in rather laid back part of an otherwise bustling city. There are ornate flower gardens and the park is well kept in general. There is also much to see above the park if you have the time.
Very pretty. We were there in April and the tulips were stunning. Such a pretty park and all the locals out enjoying the sunshine. Well worth it.

A quiet corner of Istanbul. We had experienced very tiring and crowded day in Istanbul and then went to this park which is near our hotel and it was nice to sit under some trees in the shade and chill out. There were many locals there and no tourists so it was nice to sit and relax.
Gulhane Park. This is a lovely park when you need to escape the maddening crowds around the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. The tree canopy is lovely on a hot summers day.

Beautiful park. This park was immaculate, very nice to walk through or sit and watch the world go by with a huge rose garden and plenty of flowers , well worth a trip if you want some time off from the hustle and bustle.
Realxing park close to city center. A cool place to go if you just want to relax a bit in a very nice and silent environment. Worth a visit!
Green Saviour. This beautiful park offered a relief with its bulbs, still some tulips out and roses about to bloom and well kept lawns, from the magnificent buildings and important structures around.

Found this by accident, and Limed it - a Lot!. Huge well kept landscaped parklands with art-works, water features and simply the most Panoramic W.C. Entrances we have seen anywhere. Great to relax in between visiting so many other nearby attractions, including the superb archaeological museum nearby.

Nice Garden. Gulhane park is just behind Topkapi palace and Archaeology museum,it is very well maintained green space with beutiful lawns,flower beds,sitting areas,benches....and a lovable sculpture of Kemal pasha Ataturk.Everyone likes to get photographed with him.
It has 2 gates,one near Gulhane and another on seafront near Eminonu or Galata bridge....

Beautiful park with nice tea garden. This is a beautiful and well kept park. Nice to stroll and sit in. There is a nice tea garden at the end, overlooking the water. The tea garden was a nice place to relax and enjoy a pot of Turkish tea.

Calm. Here is a big park where you can sit down or lay down and relax. It's clean and quite. I was there during Ramadan and when it was in the evening, families would gather there, picnic, and break their fasts.

Beautiful, safe and relaxing. Loved the floral gardens, the water features, and plenty of benches to sit and relax on. It's perfect for families, couples, and individuals. It is surrounded by historical sites and offers a nice break during your long day.

Beautiful Park for an evening stroll. Lovely green area in the middle of the city. Most of this park used to be part of the grounds of the Topkapi Palace. It's a refreshingly green and cool (especially in May) oasis after spending a day of sightseeing. Beautifully manicured with lots of flower beds. Well worth a visit at the end of a busy day.

Pulsing with people, reminded me of Seurat's "A Sunday afternoon on the island of La Grande Jatte". It was crowded on Sunday with a festive heartbeat of all sizes, shapes and ages of people and families. I quite enjoyed strolling around while my wife and guide went into the Archealogical Building ( I was overdosed on museum visits at this stage in our trip and declined the invitation to join them inside another building ). I went looking for birds and captured at least a couple of nice photos but no new species.

Manicured and idyllic. A veritable oasis. Manicured gardens, whimsical statues and lovely little bridges. Really worth your time after the crowds of the city. Nice cafe there, too. There's a small play park as well.

Great place to take a break. We had just walked 5km to the historic center from where we were staying and were swept up in a crowd of people enjoying the warm Saturday. We entered the park and immediately felt relief. It is not a peaceful park as the rush of traffic can be constantly heard, or a large park as it is limited by the walls of the palace, but it is a great place to catch your breath in a busy city.

Gulhane Park. I loved this park. It's big, beautiful and has nice views of the Bosporus at one end. There are few tea houses located there with a magnificent view of the Bosporus. Quite crowded in weekends, you might come across brides and grooms too. No fee for entering the park. In May the weather under the trees was very refreshing.

Love the tea garden!. I thoroughly recommend walking round to the tea garden at the far end of the park to sit and sip tea while looking over the Bosphorous. It's the same view that the sultans had from the Topkapi!

Peaceful haven. So close to the hustle and bustle of the old city but so peaceful and tranquil. Delightful areas to walk over bridges and through tree lined paths. Plenty of places to sit and reflect, also a cafe.

Green island in the city center. Perfect for relaxation, for instance, between visits to Topkapi, Archeological museum and other attractions. You can have here fresh simit for breakfast and hide from the sun.

Amazing flowers!. A beautiful park to wander through with fantastic planting and trees, bridges over little ponds, statues etc. Vibrant and relaxing all at once and a respite from the history and museums around.

Visit in April. We went here on the 1st of May - and boy, were we lucky! We got there on the very last day when the tulips were still in bloom. When we came back to the park on the 3rd, all the tulips were gone.The park is really only amazing when all the flowers are there. It's actually comparable to the keukenhof, in Holland, in this regard. After all, the tulips did actually originate in Turkey.

Worth a detour to stroll through. Very well maintained gardens with a few sculptures. New bathrooms take the Istanbul card or 1 lira which was handy as well as clean. Nice fountains with lots of benches.

Fabulous park. I love this place. It's relaxed, shaded, colourful and full of flowers. At the AyaSofia end entrance there are always street food sellers, and at the far end (under the end of Topkapi Palace) there is a wonderful tea garden with views over the Bosphorous to Asia. This park is a great way to see locals relaxing - there are couples holding hands, lads lazing, families playing etc. Love it.
A beautiful park. This is a really beautiful park and a must see for nature lovers, the flowers and fountains are magnificent and as you go furthere up you get a lovely view of the boshorus.

Away from the hustle & bustle..... This park is a nice place to sit & relax away from the hustle & bustle of the city. However, we arrived just after all the tulips had been removed so just lots of empty garden beds, so missed a lot of the beauty. However, it was still lush, green & peaceful.

The flowers are beautiful. I visited this park twice, both times at the weekend so both times it was crowded. None the less, it's a great space with a number of interesting paths and lots of seats from which you can watch the world.
Green. Green,green,green, very beautiful park,you will love walking at that distance,and have a turkish tea on the hill and take picture of bosphorus.

Beautiful quiet park. This is the park area next to the entrance to Topkapi Palace. It is a lovely well laid out park with fountains and beautiful gardens. Well worth a visit, especially if you would like a break from the hubbub of the city. There are some lovely statues in the grounds.

Extremely extremely busy. From Googling this place, I expected this place to be full of flowers and nature and well...beautiful. It was opposite of that. It was extremely busy, and we couldn't find a single place to sit down which wasn't 2 steps from someone else. Very disappointed.
Oasis of peace in the city.. Tall trees towering above walkways, flowers, shrubs, fountains, this is a wonderful place to rest and enjoy peace in bussling Istanbul.

Turkish Tulip heaven!. I always associated tulips with the Dutch and Amsterdam. That was until I visited Istanbul's Gulhane Park in April! It's a beautiful, calm oasis of colour amidst the frenetic madness of Istanbul. It turns out that Tulips actually originated on the Asian steppes and were first cultivated by the Ottomans and only adopted by the Netherlands in their cultivated form after that.The park is one of the best places to view them during the festival when it's a riot of colour. It's popular with locals and tourists alike and easily possible to while away a couple of hours just chilling out and taking a break from the madness of this amazing city, re-charging ready for another round of attractions.

Sanctuary in the City!. A popular haunt for the locals (especially at the weekend), this really is a beautiful park. Lovely grounds that lead you through to Eminönü. Be sure to look out for the parrots that habitate this park. Great for recharging your batteries after all the sight seeing, and when all the flowers are in blossom it is beautiful.

Lovely and relaxed. Beautiful park full of locals just chilling. Well kept and beautiful. There's a lovely coffee place with a view of the Bosporous which is highly recommended. Park toilets are spotless and well maintained.

Lovely on this sunny May day. This park was found behind old stone walls and was full of locals enjoying the flowers, food stall and the seats.The sign says it was previously part of the Royal palace and it's been maintained very well with numerous grass areas to lie down in and lots of different varieties of flowers.We just like sitting and watching the world go by.Worth a visit

Best during tulip season. Gulhane park located near Top Kapi Palace and close to other attractions is a good shady spot to rest after all the walking and sightseeing. It is nice year around, well maintained but of course in April during Tulip Festival it looks its best! This year they also had world biggest tulip carpet displayed close to the park. Tulips of all kinds and colors were all over the place, so pretty! Finally, I got to see so many tulips:) No need to bother getting Shengen visa and going to Holland, when you can just come to Istanbul! Emirgan park should be great too but having heard it is inconvenient to get there, we skipped it this time.Park has great views of Bosphosus, but unfortunately, all the places with such views are occupied with overpriced tea houses. To a have a nice view, you need to pay 15 lira per two person kettle of tea. Ours was leaking and water was not even filtered, as I made weaker tea, I could feel chlorine taste. In any grocery shop you can buy a kilo bag of great local tea for less money! Take it home, watch on internet how to brew it and enjoy for months. So better to enjoy the views while you are touring Top Kapi Palace, there is a great terrace and skip them in the park. On weekends it may get crowded and when they replace flower beds and use some noisy equipment it is also better to avoid. But in April it is a must see!
Excellent chai and awesome views. Gulhane park restaurant overlooks the Bosphorous strait with awesome views. Sit over there, with a pot of chai and baked potatoes for a real experience.

Simply beautiful. The tulips and others flowers were in full bloom and the park was kept in impeccable conditions. A definite must at this time of year. The garden design showcased the flowers beautifully against the architecture of the surrounding buildings.

Just Beautiful. Beautiful well kept gardens, relaxed and peaceful area to sit and let time tick past. Plenty of room to find a spot by yourself.Amazing view from the Coffee Shop.Just a nice way to spend a few hours.

An Istanbullu proper. Enjoy Turkish tea with a view of the Bosphorus among Istanbulli couples and families. Stay as long as you want. If this doesn´t convince you that Istanbul is a special place, I cannot help you.

Lale Festival. The tulip festival held in late April is breathtaking. The public gardens below the Topkapi palace were a spectacle of color. Late Spring weather allows for perfect strolling. Grab a fresh squeezed oj or pomegranate juice and power on to the archaeological museum.

Not to be missed. It was full of flowers with a lovely scent everywhere I walked in , there were also a restaurant with lovely view of the roses that spreaded everywhere tinglinling my nose with lovely scents .Go and see it you will not regret .

Peace and quiet. A beautiful space amid a bustling city. For some reason not highlighted in the tourist info. Families, couples and groups all strolling, playing or jus being together. Fountains, places to sit and rest and a super café at the far end overlooking the Bosphorus to Asia.

Tulips galore in splendid plantings!. This was incredible. We were lucky enough to be there when the tulips were in bloom and it was absolutely breathtaking. Hundreds of colors, varieties and the layout was a delightful stroll among the flowers at the outside of Topkai Palace. It is likely lovely all year round but since Turkey developed the tulip they take this garden very seriously. One of the best gardens I have ever visited.

Peace and tranquility in the centre of the city. We managed to visit this very beautiful park during the tulip festival, so he park was awash with colours. The gardens are set out beautifully with the Topkapi Palace as the backdrop, and with fountains and bridges throughout. There are plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by. If you want a break from the bustle, then this is a lovely place to find it!
Nice surroundings. With my friends we walked Around there , and it was really beautıful vıew, fresh air and little bit crowded

a place to relax and enjoy flowers and views. This is a must do on any walking tour, if just to relax a bit and to get away from the carpet sellers. The main entry is about a 5min walk to the north of Hagia Sophia. The main path travels about 800m thru the popular and fairly crowded gardens to a cafe on the cliff line with great views overlooking the intersection of the Golden Horn inlet and the Bosphorus Strait. At my first visit the flower beds were spectacular and full of (mainly tulips) - these had died and had been pulled out about 2 weeks later.

Peaceful. When the municipality plants the tulips (generally in April) the views are amazing. It is one of the largest green areas in the heart of the old city and just a few steps away from the tram line. Good place for families to take a short walk and escape from the noisy city.
Tulips. We were here in April with thousands of tulips in beautiful displays, and I am not generally impressed by public floral displays
Very close to main attraction. We got to this park accidentally,and we were so lucky! The tulips were still there in early May, lovely flowers! We spent hours to take pictures. Not to be missed.

Wonderful park. We were there just after the tulips but the area was still beautiful and a wonderful place to relax in the shade. Many locals seem to frequent the park, giving it a less touristy feel. There are food vendors along the paths and entrance for tea, simit (bagels), fruit and popcorn.Downsides, pay bathrooms, but that's fairly usual

Must visit during Tulip Festival. It is originally a very beautiful garden belong to Topkapi Palace switched to a public park in 1912, full of different kinds of flowers and tall trees. You feel relaxed and comfortable; a perfect place for kids to play too. The best time to visit is during Tulip Festival. Since it is very near to Istanbul Tramway line, tourists can visit the park easily.

Impressive and beautiful and relaxing. This big park used to be a garden for sultans and their families. It is located just beneath the Topkapi sultan palace. Thousands of people walking around, but it is relatively quiet non the less. Well maintained grass and flowers. Not a single paper outside the trash cans. Fountains and ponds. Tons of old trees. Some modern monuments also. At the edge is the Museum of science and technology in Islam - definitely recommended. By all means go and see it. again, the park is a great spot to relax between visiting the city's attractions.
Beautiful. We were there during the Tulip Festival, so the park was in full bloom and simply stunning. Perfect place to hang out and have a simit between Topkapi and Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque.

A cool oasis on a hot day. We walked back through this park after visiting the Palace and mosques on the hill above. The tulips were almost finished but some were still looking good as we made our way back to our cruise ship. The park is a lovely quiet place to cool down in after the heat and bustle of the crowds only a few hundred metres up the hill.

A good brake in a hot day!. We spent many hours in this park in our vacation in Istanbul. It is a good chance to stop and relax for few hours in this crazy city. It quite big , the big trees offer a good shade. Don't forget to look for the beautiful parrots ( they are green and quite hard to be seen ). At the beginning of May they were taking out the tulips and I think they were replacing them with different flowers. Even it's a crowded park is relatively clean.

Stunning during the tulip festival. These gardens were an unexpected delight. Beautiful fountains, small bridges and works of art with exceptional planting which, during the tulip festival, was just stunning! A delightful place to idle an hour or so away ...
Nice place to rest for a while. Beautiful place, lots os flowers and trees. Nice place to sit and rest for a while after vistiing Topkapi.

Sight of beautiful tulips marred by selfie-seeking tourists. Really do not like people stepping all over flowers. And they did so, just to stand in the middle of the flowers to achieve that perfect selfie. It was very sad to see, actually.
Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful Place!!. You can tell from it's beauty that this park was for kings and queens walk!! We couldn't stop taking pictures here and there! For sure a must see :)

Go when there are tulips!!!. Wow! we happened to visit during the height of the tulip bloom and this park was like Disney or an Easter basket. The colors and array of tulips were phenomenal. Just stunning. Park is shady and large, so while crowded with people and kids playing, we could always find a bench to just sit and enjoy.

tulips galore at Gulhane Park. We were there just in time for the tulip festival Istanbul style and what a treat that was. The largest tulips in the best and brightest colours and varities possible. It's a lovely park for strolling and you won't even know it's there as it's along the tram line and behind high walls, near the Archaeological museum. Well worth a visit to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Sultanamet area.

Simply beautiful!. This 'piece of eden' is a must see in Istanbul. It was crowded with flowers, namely tulips of all colors, people just resting or strolling around and... colors, colors, colors ;) What a lively place!!!
Heavy Trafic. Instead of taxies prefer metro or metrobus lines. Especially work start and finishing times prefer to have a drink at any place of Bosphorus.

Its what a park is all about. Istanbul is a busy city but this is an oasis of calm and ideal for a leisurely stroll. (good short cut to the river as well from the centre). The gardeners in Istanbul are amazing and the flower displays are something else - a pity we were just after the tulip festival but it must have been fantastic. I liked the benches where you can canoodle and also there are chaps going round selling coffee. Great.
really pretty park. this park is a little oasis from the busy city streets, and offers shade and a quieter space for a rest! really pretty and worth a visit

Amazing, beautiful park. We were very fortunate that we visited during tulip season, and walking in there really took your breath away.Huge areas filled with different colour tulips everywhere you look, lovely fountains, sufficient park benches to enjoy the view and an overall very clean and lovely little park.There are also very clean toilets in the park which you pay 1 lira for and people walking around selling chay and coffee.Take a walk to the end of the park (Bosporus river side) and there are a few restaurants selling traditional Turkish tea with views that overlook the Bosporus.Furthermore the great part of the park is that its in walking distance to most of the major tourist destinations in the area, and the metro stops right outside it.Its a great way to start your morning of sight seeing.

Simply Stunning in Spring. This place is just perfect for strolling and having your own time. The flowers bloom during Spring and the whole area comes alive with all the colors. There is no entrance fee, and they have small food carts that has coffee / "smit " turkish version for croissant and a cafe inside the park as well. It provides an access towards the port where you can trail your way towards the sirkeci port. It is a must visit place during Spring!

Beautiful spot. Gulhane Park is the perfect spot for some time out from the business of Istanbul. Located right near a number of attractions, it is peaceful and pretty. The tulips in April are spectacular.
green. perfect green place nice to walk there with your girlfriend especially.............tea garden there real perfect should go there....
Escape from city life. Nested near by all attraction and if you want lay down with your loved one it is best place. Peaceful and clean.

Great!. We had afternoon tea here and then walked all around the park. We were here during tulip season and the tulip plantings were amazing, a huge array of colors and designs. The "lungs of the city," like the Borghese park is in Rome.
Adorable. I adore parks, a lot of greens, flowers, banches, you can lye on the grass and relax. They take care very much about the beauty of this place so place is very tidy

A riot of colour. Gulhane Park is easily visited. It is right around the corner (so to speak) from Topkapi Palace and the Archaeological Musuems. It is not the largest park in the known universe but it is a great place for a wander and to give your brain a rest from all the history and architecture! It is also a riot of colour. Flowers, flowers and more flowers and the effect is quite pleasing.One of the great parts is the external view of Topkapi Palace as well as the views from the cafes that line the edge of it with wonderful vistas over the Bosphorus. In fact this chance to get off your feet and soak up the view as well as scoring some quick food is a great way of breaking up a day of sightseeing in the old part of the city.And when you are ready to start your sightseeing again you are right near the Museum of Science & Technology in Islam or you can just wander back up into the fray of the Hippodrome area.

My daughters loved this park. It was nice to take a break with my 8yr old and my 4yr old from all the historic sites by taking a walk in this park. My 8yr old had a camera and went crazy taking pictures of so many beautiful tulips. Everywhere you looked there were hundreds of flowers arranged in different shapes. The entrance is completely free and it was very relaxing. If you have kids or you just want to take a break this is the place to go

A beautiful park. A really nice place to just hang out and people watch. Beautifully kept gardens, fountains, nice tree-lined avenue - take a drink or an ice cream and just lie on the grass and watch the whole world go by in the sun. Fit for a Sultan......
Nice Park. Very picturesque with large trees and attractive gardens. From the top there are views to the Bosphorus. Is popular with many school children from time to time which can make it noisy.
