Incredible during the Tulip Festival. I went during Istanbul's Tulip Festival. It was incredible how many different kinds of flowers were there and the small ponds that they have created make it the perfect atmosphere. Additionally on your way out you can stop and get some chestnuts, no matter the time of year, so that was very cool.
Great place to get away from the crowded streets. The tulips in the park were beautiful. In a city as manic and crowded as Istanbul this is a great place to take a walk and get away from the queues.

Great for children, but can be busy. Most families love this place as it's a great spot for children. It can be busy during the season, but still very beautiful. Beautiful plane trees remember times of sultans... how cool is that.
Don't miss it. Try to get there early in the morning when it is not packed.Awesome feat of engineering.Surreal. The lighting accentuated to perfection the columns

Tulips, Tulips, Tulips everywhere! BEAUTIFUL!. I was absolutely mesmerised by this stunning park just below the Topkapi Palace. The flower arrangements were just perfect and the little fun spots you see placed in areas and beautiful water displays. A lovely place to have a little stroll in the evening after dinner.
Nice and quiet . It's nice and quiet, but you can afford to miss it if you're in a hurry.It's a really nice way to get away from the crowds for a moment.

Escape the crowds of Sultanahmet in this beautiful park. Just down the hill you'll find this oasis of calm in the otherwise frenetic tourist frenzy of Sultanahmet. Stroll through the park with its brightly coloured tulips and water fountains, statues and park, and at the other end you'll find a nice café to enjoy a quiet drink and stare across the bosphorus and if clear enough Galata bridge. Expect to pay a little more at this café, but its worth it

Nice park. Very nice park, close to the cisterns, located behind Topkapi Palace. It is a very clean park, with a playground for children and a very nice terrace with a gorgeous view and expensive Turkish tea, but the view is worth it.

Gorgeous. Amazing park and largest inside old city. There are cranes that fly up and nest high in the trees -- dozens of them. Never seen anything like it. Grounds are beautiful and a wonderful visit if you bare in the Sirkeci area of Old Istanbul, don't miss it.
Beautiful park. Came here on a sunny spring day - lovely flowers and lovely feel to the place. What a super place to just wander in.

Such a beauty!. Was a beautiful park in the midst of the busy city and a nice place to get away from all the cars and traffic, there are lots of people visiting the park everyday but it's still great to visit. We were luck enough to be here during the Tulip festival :-)

Worth the walk. Spend a couple of hours here just to look at the tulips. Late April would be the best time. Stay clear of the cafes though they are a bit expensive. Wander through the back lanes and you can get good food a lot cheaper.

Tulips Tulips Tulips. We visited towards the end of the tulip season but the carpets of colour were still beautiful. This is a clean, well cared for place with spotless toilets and a great cafe overlooking the water.

Amazing Refuge of Tranquility in the Bustling Istanbul. Absolutely wonderful park, well designed, convenient, green and not too overcrowded, though frequented by some tourists and many local people including youth, families with kids and enamored couples. Very good atmosphere of peace and relaxation of this park is what sometimes one desperately needs amidst the hectic city life of Istanbul. It seems the municipal authorities to their credit keep a watchful eye on the park, as it is almost impeccably well-maintained!

Peace and quiet. We had half a day to kill before checking out and we wanted to find a quiet place to relax and read books. We decided to check out the park and we found a cafe located within the park. It was a peaceful relaxing morning sitting on the terrace, drinking apple tea, an early lunch and having the time to catch our breath and relax in such a vibrant, busy city.
TULIPS!!. Spring is the perfect time to see all the beautifully arrange tulips blossom. The park is well manicured & clean. Perfect for photo taking naturally.

Beautiful. The park is absolutely stunning. If you are planning on visiting the Topkapi Palace or any of the adjoining museums, take the time for a peaceful stroll through the park. The beautiful flowers, the flowing streams and all of it natural splendor will be worth your time.
Tulip festival. The place to go for tulips and people watching. Just beautiful and so much fun to watch the people of Istanbul enjoying Sunday in the park.

Tulips!. I had no idea. Tulips were mentioned in the guidebook but walking through this park was stunning. Tulips blooming in beautiful designs, in incredible colors and everywhere! This is a massive display of beauty. I love going to gardens and have been to many around the world. This blew me away.

A breath of fresh air. This beautiful park in the heart of Sultanahmet district is well worth a visit, to wander through and look at the flowers, for families with kids, to play on the play equipment, and to just generally relax. It is very well maintained, and has lots of space to explore and get away from the hustle and bustle that is Istanbul.

A diamond in the rough!. Amid bustling streets, with vendors and trams at each corner, take the time to stop at Gulhane Park. The that is put into these flowers is beautiful and there are many great photo opportunities within the park. If you walk towards the Bosphorous, there is an amazing cafe perched right along the edge of the park, over looking the Bosphorous . Highly recommended!

beautiful park and gardens....alive with life and color. oh my gosh. This park is one of the most beautiful and easily reached in the heart of Istanbul, a refreshing rest, peace and quiet from the city that is just outside its entrance. A must-do while in Istanbul. Lovely fountains, an herb section, benches and resting places, easy to get to the center, tram, train station and information center as well as the shops and heart of Istanbul. The most beautifully designed flower gardens in a park and flowers as far as one can see. This park stretches out in a large area. Enjoy the sights and sounds of Istanbul but you won't be sorry to get away into this park for times of refreshing and peacefulness.

Unexpected Treasure. Our guide book had referred to the Gulhane Park as being badly tended. We couldn't understand why anyone would think that! The park was beautiful, and we stumbled across it and stayed for ages, watching the stunning birds, admiring the beautiful plantings, the clever statues, and meandering through the small and lovely pathways. It was a Sunday afternoon, and local families were visiting the park as a fun family treat. We had planned to visit other sites that day, and we ended up skipping them to spend more time in Gulhane Park.

Just a paradise close to you. Of course nothing to dislike, just in Paradise !!! You cannt believe what turkish creativity could do with flowers colours its simply incredible and so wonderful place you will never forget.

Good place to relax. If you want to relax a bit after exploring the city, visit this park. Nice park, plenty of places to relax on the grass or benches. Also nice for kids as there's a playground. We visited the park during the Tulip Festival so the whole park was filled with lovely flowers. The park is near the Topkapi Palace.

Fantastic flowers. What a fantastic place in the middle of a city! I have never seen such lovely flower displays. Great blocks of colour provided by tulips and grape hyacinth.The locals obviously appreciate it since they were there in their hundreds having photographs taken amongst the dispays.

Tulip central. In April the park,which is next to the Topkapi,is a riot of colour mostly provided by tulips in their tens of thousands,very tall poplar trees with a stork roost in them,fountains and of course thousands of people.A welcome haven in the bustling city.

Amazing views. This park is gorgeous... the flowers are so pretty and the whole place is very peaceful. There are a lot of things to see and take pictures. It also has a museum inside. Walk up the hill and you will find a cafe with scenic views ( you can see the sea and asia from there). Amazing views.
Tulips and more!. Fortunate to be in Istanbul during the tulip festival. Many beautiful displays of other flowers make for a stunning sight.

Tulip Paradise. April is Tulip month and more than 2'000'000 tulips are planted by hand in Istanbul. The arrangements of tulips and other seasonal flowers in Gulhane Park, make this an experience to rival the Chelsea Flower Show and Hyde Park put in one. The proximity to the other major attractions mean that it is often visited and well worth the time spent.

Lovely park right next to Topkapi palace. The park has a fountain, lots of beautiful tall trees and comfy benches. Most of the visitors when we were there, were locals. You can see Turkish families lazing around and enjoying the sun and green surrounding.
Tulip festival. Oh so beautiful. And so many. In wonderful patterns and great mixes. The under planting of pansies are all very appropriate.

Little bit of heaven. Every time I visited Istanbul I spent at least a bit of my time in Gulhane Park. It is a little bit of heaven and I enjoyed very much walking around it. It is ideal for spending time with family, friends or simply sitting alone in the park with a book. Visiting Istanbul in the spring is magical because city is full of flowers and especially Gulhane Park. Since this is outer Topkapi Palace park there is definitely royal feel to it. I highly recommend visiting. I loved it and enjoyed it very much!

Colouful Refuge. Safe haven to rest up a while. Plenty of good seats or grassy areas to sit. Vibrant yet calm area to watch the passers by while recovering for more sight seeing. Flowers in April/ May are superb.
April Paradise. spectacular park- tulips, daffodils and pansies. Don't forget the cafe by the water for a tea or coffee.
Nice relaxing place. Nice park, though relatively unimpressive by comparison with the other sites to see in Istanbul. Good for a break if you have the time to spare...
Beautiful park. Beautiful and well maintained. When we were there, the tulpis were starting to flourish, so it was quite impressive.

Tulips and more tulips. This is an excellent park with so many beautiful displays of flowers, mostly tulips. The park is well cared for, has WC facilities and is free to enter. There is a restaurant overlooking the sea.
amazingly beautiful! TULIPS!!!. Went there both days in Istanbul. In April there are amazing tulips, places to sit and relax, and enjoy creation :) A very relaxing part of Istanbul.

A beautiful oasis. We were lucky to be there in April while the tulips were in full bloom. What a fantastic getaway from the rush of the city. Peaceful, uncrowded and worth the time. This park is adjacent to Topkapi Palace. Take some time to unwind and rest your tired feet.
nice. the park is nice and gardening is ok, there are cafes around the park you can enjoy the sea sightseeing here.

Beautiful tulip everywhere.... Great park to visit during tulip season! It was not as crowded as I thought it would be so there were lots of good photo opportunities. Flower arrangements were spectacular too.

bursting with color. many paths to meander and in April it was filled with blooming flowers (especially tulips). People from all over the world will take the time to lay in the grass or pose among the flowers. Wish I could've spent more time there.

Tulips everywhere. Visit in spring when the tulips are out. Peaceful and beautiful place to sit and rest amidst a noisey city. As an adjunct to the Topaki palace it is easy to miss these gardens which would be a shame. Keep an eye out for the disguised WC
Nice stop during your visit to Topkapi. This park is right by Topkapi palace and is a good place to sit, have a snack and rest your feet. It is quiet picturesque.

Tulip season in April. We passed by this park after our visit to the Archaeology Museum. It's free and you can spend as short or as long as you like. Tulips were blossoming when we went in early April, they are in many different colours. Great for a quick rest for your feet! There are benches everywhere in the park which you may look out the pond and tulips. From there, you can walk to Eminou or the cross the Bosphorus Bridge to Beyoglu. Tips: remember it's free and you can take a quick rest if you are tired!

Beautiful place. I visited in April when the garden was full of tulips and hyacinths! The colours of the tulips and the smell of the hyacinths were gorgeous. I could have gone back again and again and again. There is plenty of place to sit down on benches, on the grass, in the sun, in the shade, there are families here, school outings, couples, locals and foreigners alike. I didn't see any peddlers which is nice.

Spectacular Park!!. This park is lovely. The gardens are wonderful. There are tulips are everywhere and the colours are so vibrant. Locals and tourists alike wander through this park and its is lovely and peaceful. There are play areas for children, fountains, winding walkways and tulips. It's is on the edge of the Topkapi Palace and its and easy walk to the palace or through to the Galata bridge. Tulips everywhere :) Visit this park!!

Beautiful during tulip festival. This is our second visit to the park during the tulip festival. Very nice grounds, beneath Topkapi Palace, for strolling. The Museum of Technology is located within the park and well worth visiting.

Dont Miss this park , especially in April. Dont go to Amsterdam to see the tulips, but enjoy them here at Gulhane Park, but only in April. Exotic colors of every possible combination, And enjoy a cup of turkish coffee at the Cafe.

Peacful. A great treat to walk through away from the crowds. Tulips were in full bloom along with many other spectacular displays. Raining a little - so didn't take advantage of the many seating areas to rest. Recommend.

The Park is great. We were lucky enough to go when the park was covered with Tulips in Flower. It was great but sad to see people walking into beds of flowers to get there photo taken and trampling the plants. There was only one Security Officer working to cover the area and keep people out of the gardens. Again the gardens were amazing but the ignorance of some visitors was even more amazing

Nice Place to Chill Out. Although not on any tourist sites - we stumbled upon this park by accident trying to find the entrance to the Topkapi Palace - much better than the parks we have in London and although it was sunny but still quite cold the place was still buzzing with people. We wanted to visit it again before we left but ran out of time.
Beautiful!. So glad we made it during tulip season. The park was so clean and perfectly manicured. The flowers were absolutely stunning. Nice place to relax after a long day of walking!
Very colorful. A beautiful walk by the TopKapi walls. Beautiful tulips everywhere and very clean too! A nice place to relax and take pictures during sunset.

A very large, picturesque and relaxing park. A surprise in many ways as I had not heard of this park prior to visiting Istanbul. We went because of pure luck - and given the cool temperatures, the walk across this park was very pleasant.

Tulip season. I visit this park last year at the beginning of May when the tulips had all been de-headed, I wanted to return to see them in flower, I have just done this and wasn't disappointed. Istanbul has a tulip festival running all of April.

Amazing park. There are so many impressive historic sights in Istanbul and this park was not even on our "must visit" list. But I am so glad we proceeded and visit it.Amazing display of tulips combined with other flowers.Whole park looks like is covered with carpets made of tulips. This is one of the loveliest parks I've ever visited.Took some great photos there. It was nice just to sit there in the sun and enjoy wonderful flowers.
Lale festival. Gulhane Park is Nice place must view. Fantastic gardens and milions tulips. Not need more words. April and may is a best time to visit
colorful flowers. The colorful flowers were blooming when I strolled the length of the park. Gulhane Park is a peaceful oasis in a busy city!

Amazing tulip displays. Istanbul has many impressive historic sites, but it was the flowers in this park (and in many other places) that had the biggest impact on us. They were the most spectacular we have seen anyplace in the world, and totally unexpected. Come here in April!

Amazing!!!. I don't know how the park looks like without the tulips, but right now it is simply amazing! Most likely, it looks amazing regardless of the season, so definitely worth taking at least 15 minutes to stroll through, especially since you walk by it when going to Topkapi, the Archaeology Museum or the Museum of Science & Technology
Gulhane Park. Seeing the park in the Tulip Festival was particularly lovely but there seemed to be an air of appreciation of this outdoor space by tourists and locals alike.
tulips galore in april. This was a great park for photos and sitting in the sun. The tulip colours and patterns really are beautiful.
TULIPS!!!!!. This is just so beautiful, please do not miss it' The tulips, pansies and other flowering plants were incredible.

Fantastic display of tulips and other flowers. what a surprise tulips from istanbul and what a fantastic garden Cranes and other birds nesting in the trees above and beautiful fountains A really peaceful and tranquil place

Little Oasis. This was a beautiful little park that was an oasis away from the busy city. The gardens are well cared for and a lot of attention seems to go into maintaining them. Definitely take a stroll here if you get a chance.
Breathtaking!. There is nothing more to say ... breathtakingly beautiful, especially with the tulips blooming all over the place in April

A gardeners Paradise!. Stunningly beautiful tulip and hyacinth displays.The parks landscaped department deserve an award,truly beautiful.I was however disgusted to see a boy of c.10 years old pull up a tulip- bulb and all -then run to show his mother.I was then shocked to watch as,rather than tell him off for this vandalism, she pulled him in close with the flower in front of then so daddy could take a photograph!If you can tear your eyes away from the flowers do look up occasionally for the many green parrots which live in the trees of Gulhane Park-and the herons too.At some point a few trees have died and rather than just cut them down and leave a flat stump they have been left with longer trunks which have been turned into rather nice art works.A jewel in the heart of the city.

Relaxing and pleasant. Located near the Topkapi Palace and the Museum of Archaeology, allows pleasant moments of relaxation and rest. Very well maintained with many flower arrangements, clean walkways, fountains to cool off the air. Place a welcome break in scurry around town!

Colours Galore!. This park used to be the back yard of the Topkapi Palace. It's humangous and we were lucky enought to see it full of colour - the tulips, violets and other beautiful flowers were out in full bloom. A magical place where you can relax and admire nature at its best.

Great Place for a Stroll. Grab some hot chestnuts or a simit on your way into the park and wander down its main path among fountains, flowers, a statue of Attaturk and children's play areas. It is a large, quiet and beatiful escape from the city bustle on one side of its wall and the imposing Topkapi Palace on the other. We also walked all the way through the park as an alternative way to get to the Eminonu ferry terminal.
Flower power. In April, the park hosts the annual flower (Tulip) festival - rivals anything else I have seen around the world and don't forget to look up and see the stork nests in the tree tops.

Great place for relax when walking in Sultanahmet.. Popular place for both tourists and local people. Especially in spring the garden is full of tulips and various other flowers, the park is great place for having a break during a walk in Sultanahmet area. Recommend to visit in the afternoon, i loved to observe local people walking around, enjoying the flowers, just married couples and everything, really fine place for a short rest. Entrance free

Tip toe. through the tulips ....go nowWonderful display. Most bulbs are out now but a few more to come. If you are in Istanbul in April definately worth a diversion. There are hyacinths too which smell heavenly and mass planting of grape hyacinths with the tulips all stunning.All only slightly spoiled by the tape round the trees with the intention of stopping folk walking on the flowers which isnt really working as parents arent stopping children from crossing over and grown ups taking selfies thinking it cant apply to them.We stumbled on this by accident on a Sunday and the place was rammed. We passed by again the next day much calmer and easier to see displays and take photos.If visiting at another time of year suspect would be bedding plants but some rose bushes in evidence too.

Beautiful Gulhane Park.. Springtime and the Tulip festival is a must-see in Gulhane Park. What a magnificent place with rolling lawns, carpets of tulips, hyacinths and daffodils and tall, ancient trees tipped with Ibis nests. Walking through the park is a pleasure with the heavy fragrance of the hyacinths and the manicured colourful gardens.

Beautiful Park. Went there last week (1st week of Apr) to see the tulips. Big garden, beautifully designed, it's a good place to sit down and relax while enjoying a cup of hot coffee and view the beautiful tulips. Personally i feel that this park is better than Emirgan, at least it is centrally located and accessible by trams (T1).It's next to the Archaeology Museum and Topkapi Palace, and short walking distance from Basilica Cistern, Ayasofya, Blue Mosque. A short walking distance from Gülhane & Sultanahmet Tram Station.Come out from the park and walk towards the Sultanahmet Tram Station there is a small little restaurant named 3B Kitchen which i find their food is very nice with reasonable price.
Relaxation. A very nice place in the middle of everything. Nice to go for a walk and clear your head because everything else is so busy. Calm & relaxing.

Nice walk. The Gulhane park used to be the private park of the Topkapi Palace. Nowadays is a public and very well maintained park in the heart of the Sultanahmet area.If you are not hosted in the area I recommend to visit it as a complementary visit after visiting the Topkapi Palace. In one of the corners, waterfront, you will find a delicious coffee shop with excellent views of the Marmara sea and the asian shore, very relaxing.If you are in the city in april-may you will enjoy all the parks and specially this one plenty of tulips of all the colours, it worths an unhurried visit.
Very nice park. In April there is Tulip Festival in Istanbul! So, whole park is full of flowers. Very nice place near Sultanahmet!
Stroll in the Park. The park is behind Topkapi Palace and it's definitely worth a visit -- especially now that the tulips and daffodils are blooming. Truly lovely park...lots of photo ops!

One of the best parks in Istanbul . This is the old private Park for the Topkapi Palace, transfered into a public park. Bring their with two small kids was OK due to kids facilities inside the park. I think in spring it will be better to visit due to tulip season. To cut short if you like the parks mixed with some historical signs then it's OK to visit.
Absolutely beautiful in April. The tulips and daffodils as well as many other flowers are out in swaths. Beautiful to stroll through after the madness of the roads on the other side of the wall.

Relaxing Escape. We visited this park during the tulip festival in April and it was a nice place to stroll around and enjoy the beautiful flowers and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Tourists and locals alike clearly enjoy this beautiful park.

The Tulips are Blooming--It is Fabulous. This Park is magnificent in April whilst the tulips are in bloom. There is also a small café at the end of the Park where you can have tea and look out at the water. Great experience.

Tulips Are Blooming. April is Tulip Festival in Istanbul. This is a free activity and it's worth strolling through the park to admire the different coloured tulips and lavenders. It gives you some stunning photos. The park isn't that big, so you can easily visit this park on the same day that you decide to take on the historic attractions on Sultanahmet square or go to the Bosphorous (which are within an easy walking distance).

renovated historical park of old Istanbul. Right in the middle of the historical peninsula, this historical park provide fresh air for both Istanbul's locals and wondering tourists. Easy access from archeological museum and from tram way. I remember there used to be a very old zoo in the park and the traffic was converted into the park which was very pity. But now this park is a wonderful opportunity to give a break for your tiring trip in a very historical park of istanbul (It welcomed the very first parlemanto's declaration of Ottomans)

Beautiful place with beautiful flowers. My eyes are amazed!! colorful tulips are every where!!! The park are beautifully design.. There is a water fountain look like a book in the main gate.
In the inside there is Istanbul Museum of The History of Science & Technology in Islam

Very nice and big park. I didn't like police on bikes who where driving despite of big crowd walking in the evening.
Also lot of fountains, flowers and kid attractions. All that one park should have.
Equisite Park!. beautifully manicured gardens with water features. situated just behind Hagia Sophia. perfetc to have a stroll through and relax!

Pleasant and Relaxing. Located just below the Topkapi palace, Gulhane park is an excellent place to relax and escape the bustle after some hectic sightseeing. There are lovely flower gardens and you can stroll or just sit and absorb the atmosphere. The cafe at the Northern end (Setustu Cay Bahcesi) serves tea and snacks and has a wonderful view over the Bosporus.

Eye-popping floral power - unforgettable!. I stumbled upon Gulhane Park after a long relaxing walk in Kennedy Ave. along the Bosphorus. What welcomed me was a riot of colors it was hard to blink. I came at the right time with all of the flowers were in bloom!The garden is huge, well-maintained, clean and refreshing. It was just too cold but the whole area was too good not to explore. So I did and it was worth the chilly walk.I think even those who aren't greenthumb and have no thing for flowers will fall in love with this place. Magnificent work! If it wasn't too cold, I would have spent all day relaxing there.It's a piece of heaven on earth!

Nice and beautiful views. After a long round of the city and exploring it, this is one of the places that can provide you a nice and relaxing atmosphere. The park is clean, serene and beautiful with all the foliage and floras in full bloom and vivid colors. It is a nice spot for strolls and maybe even a quick picnic. It lies close to the sultanahmet district so if you are visiting this old part of the city, try sneaking in a few hours at this beautiful park.

Perfect in the sunshine. A very beautiful park in the Sultanahmet district close to Hagia Sophia.There are lots of benches to sit on as well as a toilet block.Hundreds of flowers are planted here which when they are in full bloom will look beautiful.A relaxing place for a walk and sit in the sunshine in a busy city.

If heaven had a name it would be called Gulhane Park. A beautiful romantic park full of flowers and birds perfect for strolling around, soaking up the sun or taking some beautiful pictures. Was most beautiful early morning on a weekday. The Cafe at the far end of the garden offers spectacular views and is not to be missed. The arts and science museum in the park is also well worth a visit (1 - 2 hours).
peaceful. It's green, peaceful, with lots of sculptures made of natural materials, a park where you can take your kids or just walk around and relax
Beautiful park. April and th etulips thrive in this beautiful park with a marvellous tea terrace view of the Marmara Sea

Very clean and tidy. This was a place we found by accident, a large area of pathways and flower beds full of tulips. There were plenty of benches to enjoy some sunshine and watch the birds (parrots?) flying around the many nesting boxes. There are lots of public toilets here and you could enjoy a picnic and a rest from the sightseeing for an hour or so.
Nice Park. Gulhane park is very nice park, we went there by own and enjoyed lot over there, nice Tulips flower and other flower decoration also very nice.

Full of flowers. Gulhane park is just outside the Topkapi palace. Very quiet, pleasant place full of flowers (different ornaments are created), fountains, benches to sit and relax. The only bad thing is that sometimes cars are passing through it. There is a statue of sitting Ataturk, overlooking the park. Recommended for a nice walk from the Hagia Sophia area to the banks. From there you can continue towards the ferry harbor or bridge to Galata.

Beautiful garden. Get away from the crowd and relax in the park. Very nice designed and well maintained with beautifull flowers. Very close to the other big attractions like Topkapi, Haglia Sophia, ... Free entrance
Amazing. I think that is the most big and more nice park to Istanbul, it's close to Saltan's Palace, the entrace is free. If you go to istanbul, you must to go.

Beautiful park. This park is very well designed and is lovely to walk around. We spent a little time in here prior to going to Topkapi Palace. I would recommend having a look around as it is very clean and stunning. The water feature with the book is very unique!
Nice walk in the sunshine. Well planned out and executed gardens. Immaculate planting and well tended too. An excellent gentle walk on a sunny day

An oasis in a bustling city. This park was an oasis away from the busy crowds and traffic of the main tourist drag. Take a walk along it and admire the flowers, sit in shade of a tree and do buy yourself some boiled corn to eat whilst looking at the tourists walking by.

peaceful place near Topcapi palace. if you are tide of visiting museums and crowds of people - have a rest un Gulhane Park. it's calm and peaceful place, with nice fountains and amazing flower-beds. during blossom nothing can be compared with this place in beauty. after rest you can visit archeological museum or museum of technology in Islam (left side inside the Gulhane park)

Time for relaxation!. Gülhane park is really cool, especially in spring. There will be a sea of tulips and I am looking forward to visit it already. If you walk to the Bophorus end, take the time to get some tea in the outside café, where you have great view. Unfortunately it is crowded during high season, but if you are lucky you will get a table directly on edge. Tea is served in a teapot, so you can spend some time sitting there and enjoying the view. Since it is close to Sultanahmet/Hagia Sophia, Topkapi and various museums, it is perfect for taking a break in the middle of the day. Enjoy!

Beautiful Gardens. We had a lovely stroll around the park in late March. The landscaping was beautiful and I imagine even more so when the tulips start to flower. We were a few weeks too early unfortunately.
Lots of quirky things to take pictures of as you wander round and a playground for children too.

Beautiful, quiet park. I visited it in the end of winter but they have already planted many flowers there, which was very beautiful. Few people walked there and you can get a glimpse of the sea at one of the cafe at the end of the park.

Very Pretty Central Park. Walked from Sultanahmet square down to the ferry via this park.
Really well kept, lots of pretty flowers and a great family feel.

Green & Peaceful. I actually stumbled across this park by complete accident, and it was a beautiful, peaceful escape from the tourist crowds. It is well-maintained, has a large restaurant and belongs to Topkapi Palace grounds.
Wonderful. Really beautiful place, but best to come in the end of April-May. Amazing park, where Sultan was walking. True Oasis in the heart of Istanbul.

Fabulous. It is the roses garden for Topkapi palace. It is a very nice park. Free of charge. Nice place to spend free time there. There is a playing area for kids. Public bathrooms are extremely clean and costs 1 TL per visit. The cafeteria there is a very nice place for breakfast or eating something. The staff is cheerful and polite. They understand English language to an extent.

A lovely stroll through a charming place. We came too early to see the flowers and tree foliage that will be coming soon. Still, the park was beautiful with an enormous fountain in the center and a view of several mosques and other wonderful buildings.

What a beautiful sanctuary amongst a bit of madness.. We wandered into the park at the end of the day after a walk along the Bosphorus it was just beautiful with immaculate flower beds and lawned gardens..benches every few yards and spectacular trees..Can't explain how calming and pleasurable this was after the craziness of the Grand Bizaar and shopping..
beautiful!!. very beautiful garden with breath-taking roses everywhere :)I really love roses...my kids enjoyed playing around..
Beautiful. Hey there !If you are visiting Istanbul please make sure you check this Beautiful park of Istanbul - Gulhane park, it is just few steps away behind Haghia Sophia.
to take breath. actually its a part of Topkapi Palace and it has breathtaking beauty in spring with many kind tulips.
extremly beautiful park. extremly beautiful park alongside the topkapi palace , with Beautiful landscapes and Excellent weather

greaan oasis close to old town. Relaxing to visit after beeing in crowded areas in Istanbul old town. Just relax a bit, enjoy fountains or colorful flowerbeds (getting probably very nice in spring), sit on benches, take photos of funny sculptures..

Shady. Probably a nice place to rest when the weather is hot. I was there in a cold March. Still, any trip to a city requires a lot of walking - at least in the park you'll be able to sit on one of the many benches, rest your feet and perhaps munch on a simit (a sesame bagel).
Relax. Great place to sit and people watch, enjoy the birds in the enormous trees, have a snack in the restaurant. Good meeting point too.

Will look amazing in April!. Lovely bit of tranquility within a frenetic city. No hawkers or hassle. It was very cold & windy when we visited but even so the cafe at the top was open and we sat & enjoyed a traditional Turkish tea while looking over the Bosphorous. The planting will look stunning in the spring for the Tulip festival.

Scenic park, take a break and have a cuppa!. We were here several times. Love the cafe overlooking the park. Have a cup of Cay(Turkish tea) or Turkish coffee with Turkish delight at affordable prices. Lovely weather in march.

Great - peaceful place to sit. We went to the park just before we went into Topkapi Palace.
Well set out and peaceful place to sit.

A peaceful place to smell the roses.. The Gulhane park will provide a lovely quiet escape from what can sometimes be a very noisy city. It is good anytime of year but possibly best when the roses and tulips are out. Gulhane park was at one time the outer garden for the Topkapi palace but now the locals and visitors can enjoy it for free.

Good break with kids. Nice place to play with my little toddler. Fountains are pretty and cool. Okay play ground. Lots of benches. Good spot to chill out after seeing lots of sihjts. Right be topkapi palace.

April. I've visited Gülhane Park Istanbul several times. However, I guess that it is one of the most beautiful parks in the world, it is worth visiting it especially in April. In Istanbul April is about tulips (laleler), and the park -- and I can say that also the whole city -- is full with colourful, beautiful flowers, mostly tulips and hyacinths. Just sit down there and feel the fragrance in the air... ;-)

sit down for a little time and relax. I like to go there when I'm in Istanbul. It's a nice escape from all the busy traffic and crowded streets. Also it's nice to take a break in between visiting the monuments and museums... all nearby ;) Also the Museum for Islamic art (entrance in the parc) seems to be great. It opened after years of renovation. (I haven't visited it yet)

Once a private garden for the Sultans!. Gulhane Park is a great place for jogging or taking a break from a long days sightseeing.A beautiful heaven right next to Topkapı Palace.Very nice views at the top of the hill as there is a small coffeeshop, you can enjoy a tea or a Turkish style toasted bread and watch the sea from the top. Not a must see for people who really have limited time.But for those who stay in Istanbul for extended periods (6-7 days) It could be a nice experience.If you read about the history of it you will appreciate it even more. As a local resident myself I work in Sultanahmet and It is a nice option when you want to get away from the crowd and take a walk on this small park.

History on every step. Having watched and read about the history of Topkapi palace and Sultans, it was such a great feeling walking there on the same routs they waked on. The park is beautiful at any time of the year and has a wonderful views to Bosphorus.

Go see by yourself. The park was clean and beautiful. My friends and I spent a lot of time there. We went there in Ramadhan and Turki was very hot at that time. However, the park was cool and comfortable. We laid on the grass and to be honest I almost fall asleep.

beautiful walk and view. We had a nice walk in the park, as the weather was very nice. There are bridges and statues of lions - very nice for pictures, lots of parrots (we loved to watch them). If you go all the way to the end of the park, the view on Bosphorus is very beautiful and there's also a terrace if you want to have a tea/coffee.

Very family oriented. My family took a walk through the park on a warm September evening and found the park to have a very friendly atmosphere. There were many native families out relaxing and having a nice time enjoying the trees and flowers. Would recommend a walk through the park when visiting Istanbul.

Beautiful Blooms of Spring. Have been here twice, never once short of a beautiful floral experience. Friendly for all, lovers, friends, family, and captivating even with the spreads of flowers and awestruck visitors. Easily accessible from Sultanahmet, and cuts right through to Sirkeci.

Clean and magnificent park. Loved the fountains, gardens and the tulip and flower displays were absolutely magnificent. Offers pleasant views and pleasant walks. There is a Café and small diner situated in the Park which is ideal if you're feeling peckish.
Lovely enchanting place. Loved the fountains here, the gardens and the peaceful atmosphere. Would love to return to Istanbul just to see Gulhane Park again. Nice place to have a picnic.

Large Park, Tranquil & Peaceful.. Located near the Gulhane tram station. Great park to go on walks through after dinner etc. We went to Turkey at a time when they had planted thousands of tulips everywhere & Gulhane Park was no exception. The tulip & flower displays were absolutely magnificent. Offers pleasant views & pleasant walks. There is a Cafe & a small diner situated in the Park which is ideal if you're feeling peckish.
Escape from the crowds. Spectacular view of Bosphorous! Tranquil park to stroll in. There's a tea house overlooking the cay (sea). Great photo opp.

In the heart of the "Old City"!. We visited Gulhane park by chance, in our search for the Istanbul Museum of the History of Science and Technology in Islam. The museum building is housed in this park. It isamazing to find such a peaceful park in the heart of the "Old City"next to Topkapi Palace. Visitors are greeted at the entrance by a fountain in the form of a book - possibly depicting knowledge - and the water sprays as if a page is turning. A very pretty tree lined avenue with benches provides relief for aching feet. The Coffee shop in the park looked well attended.
Relaxing in the heart of Istanbul. Beautiful park,very clean and relaxing, with a lot of green and nice fountains.Nice quiet caffee which have a variety of drinks and snacks.
Good park. The park was good, but not great. It needs better maintenance. Maybe it was because of this time of the year.

Breathe in the fresh air. Away from the heavy Istanbul traffic, this is a well laid out park with plenty of benches for those who want to rest their feet after walking around the city. Sits beneath Topkapi Palace
A green oasis in the bustling city. Gulhane Park is in central Istanbul, below the Topkapi Palace. It is a beautiful garden, a very restful place to wander and relax after strenuous sightseeing.
Nice park. Nice park near Old City of Istanbul, you can walk from Sultanahmet to Galata Bridge and visit this park.

Tranquil Oasis . You really get to escape the sirens and beeping from vehicles at this park. It's located close to topkapi palace so it's in the historic area of Istanbul. Really cool if you're into birds. I think i saw a very colorful looking parrot-type bird during my visit. That was my highlight. It was nice to just sit and take it all in and take a break from the tourist spots and the crowds.

Some green in Sultanahmet. I like birds, so that I hoped to see some interesting species, during my stay in January. I found very few birds indeed. The place Might be crowded wehn there 's good weather. If you need a toilet (1 lira) go to the newest ones, not the oldest, thery are all in this park.

Good if you're a Birder. A beautiful park and very well maintained and manicured. A nice walk at any time and well situated. If you're a birder (I am) it's probably one of the only places to get now breeding (introduced but now wild) Alexandrine Parakeets on you Western Palearctic List.

Very nice view !. The view from the tea garden is amazing. The park is spacious and clean with some fancy birds. Could recommend anyone to visit this during the busy tours around Sultanahmet as it is within walking distance.

take a walk in this beautiful park. After getting tired of checking Topkapı Palace, Hagia Sofia, Archeology Museum, Saint Irini u can take take a seat , listen the nature, have your chestnut kebaps ;)
Very bg and beautiful. Ypu must visit this park and enjpy ur day .. free intrance and there is an Islamic meusium its very nice and deserves a visit..

Green break. Although not large enough to really consider a walking park, this is a lovely oasis to get away from the hussle of the city. There were no signs of beggers, but lots and lots of dogs, who were just lying down, kind of creepy.

Best Free Attraction in the Old City. I was leaving the palace with my wife, which we did not enjoy and happened on the Gulhane Park. It is beautiful and there is a lot to see. There are a lot of parrots and playful dogs as well. This is also a good area to jog. There is a statue of Ataturk which a lot of locals want to take a photo with.

Away from the Bustle. Huge area to walk around and enjoy space within Istanbul. In December there was heaps of garden work occurring, would love to be back to see the results in Spring. Some great views to the water and a visit to the museum is worth it

Pleasant walk. Pleasant calm walk although it is pretty small. Nice view of the Golden Horn and city from the end of the park. You can also see part of the old city wall from the end of the park. The stray dogs are really annoying but harmless.

One of the best parks in Istanbul. While walking from Sirkeci to Sultanahmet area,you will see the entrance to the park on yr left hand side before coming to Saint Sophia on yr left.İf the weather permits,lay down on the green grass in the park and listen to the songs by birds in this very quiet athmosphere.Very good park with lots of different flowers,depending on the season of course you will find out many kinds of different flowers.Always good to be at this park.
a must to visit. as a part of Topokapi palace this park should be visited after you see Topokapi palace. since you will be walking for at least 1 hour to explore all the palace sections.
A must island of green. Fun to see the locals take in green space in a city of stone and wooden structures and streets. Enjoy visiting the statues including ataturk.

Beautiful and peaceful. A relaxing place to rest your feet on some comfy grass while you recuperate from a long day of walking.
I spent an hour resting and writing my travel journal here. It's a gorgeous garden with beautiful tulips everywhere.

Keep calm and start walking !. As a tourist you end up always in Sultanahment wondering around the monuments and most of the time, if not always, you need a break! What's better than to wonder around in beautiful park. Gulhane Park means "Rosehouse Park" in Turkish and it is just a step away from TopKapi.I had the chance and I visited the park both in November and July. Gulhane Park in autumn is amazing. Yes, you can feel the cold while wondering around but its scenery is ....breathless! It is less crowded, falling leaves are everywhere.... Don't forget to treat yourself warm chestnuts. Buy them from the main entrance (Sultanahment).Thus in July, the park is obviously more green, more people are going up and down, yet it keeps the same beauty! Don't forget to pay a visit to the coffee shop which is located towards the end of the park! Treat yourself a cup of tea and enjoy the view of Bosporus!It's a very good choice to "fill up your batteries" and carry on exploring the city!

really a park fit for the sultans. the beautiful gulhane is open for everyone for free...lovely greenery....roses of all colors...tall impressive trees....and the sweet wonderful cafe overlooking the tranquil waters and magnificent boats
Nice!. Nice and charming park were to enjoy a walk. Very well saved and full of nice attractions. Best spots for a pic are the wooden bridges and the "book fountain". Worth to see.

What a beautiful peaceful visit. Walk slowly and soak up the rich beauty of this park. If you walk off to the right you'll get a spectacular view of Istanbul! The roses, when in bloom, smell like magic. The park dogs are friendly and playful, unlike many of the half-comatose dogs in other parts of Istanbul. Take a snack and sit at the overlook... you won't be disappointed.

nice addition to the historical area. very nice park with very high trees and a lot of roses where the name of the park is the house of roses (gulhane). the wind in the park is very strong making the trees producing nice sounds from the movement of the leaves.also there is a lot of birds up the trees.if you have an extra one hour in the historical area ,try to pay a quick visit to this nice little park which is the entrance of which near the gulhane tram station,after walking in the park , you will get out of the park from the other north side near sirkeci station

Parrots!. Yes, they're here! Lots and lots of them! I don't care how common they are here, I never tire of seeing them. Istanbul's a great place to bird and this should definitely be a stop for birders of all abilities. A wonderful, clean, safe place for a quiet walk too.

A clean park and, at the far end, a view to die for.. Behind Topkapi Palace you will find a clean and peaceful park for a nice walk; a lot to see even green parrots in the trees and in the walls of Topkapi Palace. Entrance to the park is just at the left of the Topkapi entrance. Walk 1km through the park toward the far north-west corner of the park and behind the palace for one of the most impressive views on the Bosphorus and where you can have a typical Turkish tea for two( 15TL - 5euro).
i love to be here. i really loved this park. the view is so nice and beautiful. the trees is so calming and relaxing. during my stay at istanbul, everyday i have my morning walk here :)
Resting place. After visiting the Topkapi please take a break in this great Park before visiting the Orient Express train station.

Best place for nargile (waterpipe). If anyone is looking for a place for smoking nargile, Gulhane and a nearest seaside is recommended. Prices quite well but very nice atmosphere and easy way to get there are the biggest advantages
Gullane park. This is a beautiful oasis in the city. Wide avenues to walk down with interesting sculptures and art to admire amongst the trees.

Escape to nature. This is an amazing escape from the crowd in the middle of the old historical city in Istanbul. At the entrance you will be faced with the shops who almost have everything from food to souvenir. The park is big and well maintained. Many old trees are there. In addition to banks for sitting. This is a good break to take natural breath.

Pretty park but needs to be cleaned up a little.. We were taken to this park by some friends. It's a pretty place with lots of potential, but there was trash laying everywhere. It gave me a feel like Central Park with its people watching and street vendors. We went to this tea/coffee cafe on the northwest corner of the park. It was great, and had pretty views across the Bosphorus towards Asia.
A sweet break. so lovely park , nice place for a break from the action of the city a place to relax and to give your feet a period of rest .

A Serene spot. I found this park to be absolutely beautiful. We strolled through the park and although it was the onset of autumn and the blooms were beginning to wilt it was still worth seeing. The park has a lot of lovely ceramic flowers, Kaftans in which you can stand and take photographs and some lovely bridges decorated with ceramic flowers. There are some beautiful fountains and this is just at the entrance. We didn't get round the whole park as it was nearly dusk but when I return to Istanbul I would love to take a picnic and spend the day watching the cats chase butterflies and just to relax and people watch. A lovely spot in the city with stunning views. If you are visiting the Palace take an hour and visit.

Nice break from madness. After going through a holiday rift with my friend i wandered out to cool down and found this place by sheer accident.As you walk through the castle like gates past security (i assume the is a government building in there somewhere) you see ornate shaped ponds and bridges over them, a walkway with alternative diversions going through to the other side of the park with flower beds either side.If anything in Istanbul is romantic i would say this is it.Go to the restaurant at the peak of the park for really good views of 'new' Istanbul and the Bosphorus. Be advised that its quite windy up there so if you are wearing a hat, wig or toupee hold onto them.

Quiet park, just below the Topkapi Palace. We walked back to the cruise ship terminal through this very pretty park although it was raining so we didn't see it at its best.There was a street cat house at the parks entrance, with two occupants - the street animals all seem to be well fed and cared for, although they don't interact much with people.There were some nice water features, including a granite "book" with water pages that appeared to be turning over, and plenty of flower beds that were still in bloom. We also spotted this rather unusual decorated tree.

Not impressed. Not much to see except for the view on Bosphorus, but from the palace itself the view is even better. Having little time on our last day I'd rather skip the park (if I knew it wasn't worth it) and go straight to the palace.

nice calm spot in the busy city. We went here on our last morning in Istanbul to relax a bit and enjoy the sunshine. Very nice spot is the viewpoint across the Bosporus where there are a couple of cafes where you can enjoy some tea and a sandwich while looking at the boats on the Bosporus.

nice start to visit. We arrived into Istanbul mid afternoon and our hotel was 5 min walk from the park.
The park was on my list to visit but it wasn't first on my list. However,was just there, around the corner and what a nice way to get into our first day after sitting on a plane for 10 hours!
Nice place to walk. One of the few places to get away from the crowds and take a nice walk. Clean, benches for sitting and interesting sculptures. Lots of trees, the park felt tranquil and quiet.
Top Park. After the hussle and bussle of the city, Gulhane Park is truly a peaceful refuge of well laid out lawns, gardens and trees. Very popular with locals as well as tourists.

Peace to soul and mind. Gulhane park is one of my favorite places in Istanbul. I visited it twice and I can't get enough of it. Located under the walls of Topkapi palace not far from the touristic sights and close to the tram station.Gulhani park offers you a tranquil time away from the hustle and the bustle of the city.Great place to meditate, read and just walk.

Morning stroll in Gulhane Park. I visited the Park on the first day of Feter Eid. The park was very crowded. It was a sunny warm day in July. Children were playing, running everywhere. Their laughter and shouting mixed with the crows screaming on top of trees and hopping on the ground.When tired I rested in one of the few restaurants. I took an outdoor table and quietly enjoyed the beauty of Gulhane.Worth a visit if nature fascinates you.
Nice for a Stroll. A beautiful park with a lot of relaxing views and perfect for children to play and have fun A full day plan where you can relax have lunch and then visit the near by shops

Beautiful park .... Went for a walk around the seawall and back through Gulhane Park and it was beautiful ... You don't need to spend a lot of time here but a walk through to observe its beauty and tranquility in such a busy city is well worth it.

Pretty park with amazing Museum on premises. Enjoyed strolling along the fountains (esp the book of turning 'pages' of water). Lovely peaceful ambience. Excellent to combine with visit to Museum of the History of Science and Technology in Islam (only 10TL) which is well worth a look .

Nice place to relax after all the busy walking at historical sights. we stopped here for a break in between visiting the historical places . Its a lovely place , calm and peaceful , you can sit on a nice wooden bench and watch beautiful parrots chirping about , you can also see brides posing for photoshoots :), just relax here and soak in the surroundings

Lovely park to relax and take a stroll. The Gulhane Park was right near our hotel and not too far from the main sites.Loved the fact we could go in for free and take a nice stroll around. A few stalls selling basic snacks, however no pressure. We took a nice walk, sat on the bench, people watched and generally had a great time.Would definitely recommend and go again when in Istanbul for a nice relaxing break from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul.
Peaceful. Peaceful park in a busy area, very well looked after and a short walking distance to the heart of Istanbul including museums and other tourist attractions.
Really amazing. The sounds of birds and so many beautiful gigantic trees with an awesome autumn breeze made my trip ti gulhane perfect.

Beautiful park. Right next to topkapi palace. Its a great place to take a break during your busy day. There are many benches to sit on and also lots of grassy areas for a picnic. Several restaurants just outside the park to get food at. The park is completely free.

Great place to relax. After the hustle and bustle of life in Istanbul, my husband and I decided to have a stroll through the park. Such a beautiful and tranquil place! Just right for sitting on a bench or lying on the grass and 'people watch'. Lovely fountains and sculptures around park, with wonderful, colourful, flowerbeds. Well worth a visit to rewind and chill out!

A nice peaceful oasis.. We took a stroll through here post lunch before visiting the Topkapi Palace. Its worth visiting to get away from the hustle and bustle. The grounds are wll kept and there is plenty of seating to rest up and watch the world go by.

Best place to be during sunset?. This park is beneath the Topkapi palace. It stretches from the Bosphorus to Hagia sophia. This park has a fountain, a Cafe, a lot of tulips and an obelisk.You can lay down in a grass, entrance is free and the view is great.
Tranquil. After spending a few hours at the Museums of Archaeology, we sat in the shade and people-watched for awhile. It was great to have this oasis on a hot day, and the crowd was very diverse.
Tea and a view. Just across from our hotel (Sirkeci Mansion), we walked through, looking up at huge Plane trees, Topkapi Palace. Ended up at outdoor tea garden overlooking Bosphorus.
A break is a busy place!. A lovely park that provides a sanctuary in the middle of a heaving delta area with all the attractions. Great picnic spot.

Beautiful Park -- The Locals Love It. Gulhane Park was across the street from our hotel (Sirceki Mansion) and easy to get to by cutting through the little cafe to get through the wall surrounding Topkapi Palace. You can access Topkapi and the Istanbul Architectural Museum and Ayia Irene from the park (near the entrance). There is a free golf cart to take you up the road if you are mobility challenged, but it isn't there all of the time.Anyway, walk around the park--especially to the far end for a little cafe that looks over the Sea of Marmara--and enjoy what the locals do, some peace and quiet the way the Sultans of the Ottoman Empire did for 400 years.

Romantic. This free park is a great place to stroll and to get away from the busy-ness of Sultanhamet. Its a nice place to take a rest or to visit with a friend or someone special. Watch for the street salesmen - they are around every corner, just be polite, say no thanks and enjoy the beautiful park. Its free.
Peaceful. Grabbed some fruit and went here to chill out. Has a history of its own and is a nice break from tourist fatigue.

An escape from the maddening crowds. The park is a little escape away from the crowds in Sultanahmet. It is a basic and simple park, but it is perfect for relaxing a bit before pushing on with the attractions in Sultanahmet. Coffee and tea available at the very end of the park, overlooking Bosphorus. Best location in Istanbul for coffee.
A must see. It may be normal to see such a beautiful park in european countries but it is not common in Turkey. And this biiiig garden is not only beautiful but also very historic.

for a stroll. it is nothing like the parks in england or belgium but it is nice to rest in the shade for a while after a long day of sightseeing in old istanbul...u just sit n watch the people go by.it is like a stretch of a street with seats to ur right n left with a small garden behind those wooden seats...

Some nature in the old city. The gulhane park is some peaceful place which can be visited after a busy day at the museums, also the park contains the Museum of history of technology in Islam which is worth a visit if you have free time and a museum card.

For children of all ages. Anyone can enjoy something different here. There are age-old walls of the Palace, a peaceful park with interesting plants and fountains, but also playgrounds for children. A wonderful place to take a rest after a long walk in the Palace and Harem.
For a nice walk. Park is full of life and if you want to go for a walk it could be the place.It is free of fee and there you can also find the Islamic Science Museum.

Good large park. we managed to get a table at the café at the top of the hill with Turkish tea and views to die for, very busy place quite enjoyable walk. toilets were not very clean and although you had to pay money to use them still were very disappointingly unclean.
Tea place at the far end. There is a nice-view tea place at the end, further from the Sofia entrance. But view is better from Topkapi.

April's Tulip Festival is spectacular. Finding this park carpeted with acres of tulips and hyacinths was a great surprise as the guidebooks talk about it as having "a neglected air". Rubbish, the place is beautiful in April and filled with happy people enjoying the floral spectacle. After the hustle and bustle of Sultanahmet Square, this is a tranquil oasis with some great views up to the Topkapi Palace and out across the Bosphorus.

Restful green space far from the madding crowds!. We has decided to walk up to the Blue Mosque, and by accident found the entrance to Gulhane Park, about 10 minutes flat walk from the spot by Galata Bridge where you buy your Bosphorus cruise tickets. What a lovely park with wide paths, well tended flower beds and lots of trees for glorious shade. We ambled through, when you looked to upper paths you could see the walls of Topkapi Palace, a bit further and there were some fountains to enjoy too. You could easily bring a picnic here to get some respite from the, sometimes overwhelming crowds and noise of Istanbul. Once through the old wall gates, trams pass by up and down the hill, then a ten minute stroll (uphill) brings you to the square with Hagia Sofia on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other, simply took my breath away. Gulhane Park definitely worth some of your time.
Heaven on earth. A beautiful park with a lot of relaxing views and perfect for children to play and have fun A full day plan where you can relax have lunch and then visit the near by shops
great place to relax. a green oasis in a busy area. nice place to relax between the touristic visits to the blue mosque, hagia sophia, basilica cistern and dolmabache.

Peaceful, beautiful park. We took a walk through this park which turned out to be a very peaceful, relaxing walk and break to our afternoon. The flowers and trees are pretty and the walkway is plenty wide to allow for many people without feeling too crowded. At the end of the walkway (near the entrance closest to the water), we walked up the hill a little ways and found a great cafe to have a drink and a small bite to eat. The view was spectacular and we enjoyed every minute!
Relaxing. There are a lot of trees so you can easily escape the heat under the shadow of some of them, this place is clean, calm and pleasant for a walk or just to relax.

A Delightful Change. We went to Gulhane Park in the evening. Its a public park and open to all. Its a little uphill from the Gulhane Tram station. It was walking distance from our hotel. There is no entrance fee and no vendors inside. The vendors are outside the gate. The old trees provided shade and its a wonderful place to relax. We strolled in the park. The paths are wide and had flowers and fountains. It was not so crowded. Since we were short of time we did not go till the end. It was a nice short visit and a respite from the crowds.
A place to relax. Just minutes away from Top Kapi and Aya Sofia, this park is idela for a short break to reload your batteries after a long tour at the area.

Nice park!. This is a nice park to relax with the kids and have a quite few hours. There is a play area with swings, slides, etc for young children. At the entrance of the park there are bread stalls as well as stalls selling watermelon slices.

Nice and dirty. The park is near to the tram station close to topkapi palace. It is a very nice place but i went on sunday it was crowded and really dirty with bottles and tissue everywhere. It is a nice place but choose a good time to be there. There is a café with a breathtaking view over istanbul go there at the sunset and enjoy a tea pot it is an amazing experience even if it is crowded.

Delightful Park in Busy City. This park is located adjacent to the Archaeological Museum and near Topkapi. I have been in Istanbul six times and this is the first time I have been to Gulhane Park. I came in the early AM to beat the heat and any tourists. It was a delight.There were some interesting art pieces in the park resembling large stylized caftans where one could stand behind and have one's photo taken. Very cute.I would not recommend going out of the way to get here, but if you in the neighborhood, a short spot of time here will be very nice.

Perfect for after dark romantic strolls. I would highly recommend visiting this park especially if your staying nearby in sultanahmet. Its best experienced after dark, it has ample lightening and is frequented by families and young couples. There is a small alfresco cafe at the end of the park which overlooks the Bosphorus very romantic.

nice stroll and view, a bit dirty. Nice park close to the Topkapi. It overlooks the sea and offers a nice view on the Bosphorus. It´s nice to stroll through it and get away from the overwhelming crowd of tourists to come across some locals: kids playing, women chatting, young guys listening to music. The onyl flipside : it is not extremely well taken care of and might result a bit dirty because of trash.

Beautiful, cool place to rest. After walking for hours in the crowded touristy area in SultanAhmet, Gulhane Park is a beautiful, cool respite from the heat and crowds. We went there at about 1 pm and had a nice stroll through the park. I am sure this place would be a piece of heaven on earth in spring time and in autumn. The cafe at the end of the park offers awesome views of the Bosphorus but the tea is pricey as I suppose the tea includes the view. Gulhane Park is very close to Hagia Sofia but visitors may miss it as it is behind an old stone gateway.
The only park worth visiting in Istanbul. Nice park, good crowd, if you're a photographer, you will be amazed of the many shots you could take.However it can be better maintained

Nice, but rather neglected and dirty on August.... Big and famous park, once the garden of the palace. We visited in mid August and the place was rather neglected, with a lot of gardage laying around, bottles, papers ect. The flowerbeds were neglected too, obviously due to the time of the year. There was a cafe where we had a glass of lemonade and some tea. Good service, average prices.
Picturesque. A picturesque park we discovered en route from the Istanbul Archaeology Museum to the Istanbul Museum of The History of Science and Technology in Islam. Great place to unwind.
Nice in evening, but.... Fountains, flowers... But you should know, that many local people go there to make a picnic. At nine PM. With small children!
scenery. open air coquettishness park:)except of this u will walk in the aged trees.at the and of the road there is a cafe sit and watch the beautiful scenery
perfect for children. kids were able to play on swings / slides as well as get cool in the water pool / fountain and lots of trees / picnic areas.

A cool place to rest after the city walk. visiting Istanbul is a lot of walking. When you want to rest and ly in the shadow you must go to Gulhane Park. The tram stops in front and you can walk into the park and find a place to ly down and rest a bit.
huge. it is a huge park where you can walk and relax, it is close to Topkapi palace and not far to sultanahmet mosque and aghia sofia

Heaven on earth. Wonderfull place specailly for people who loves nature and tourist from Asian and middle east countries who leaks trees and natural views , i was very happy by seeing it , i felt like i was a princesses in a garden i will love to visit it again .

Nice park. Nice park, very green , full of old trees, well cared for with very nice flower arrangements, water ponds. It must be very popular among Istanbul people as it was full of people in a Sunday afternoon. The tram stopps just in front of the park. The city hall has built some shelters for stray cats at the entrance - so we appreciated the care for the cats!

Good to Visit. The park was around 15 min walk from the hotel we have stayed at, it is very nice, relaxing, and cozy park. We went their mainly for our 20 months boy, who enjoyed playing on the grass, mingled with the kids around and offered them his popcorn. we had our sandwiches from a restaurant earlier and had a quick lunch their on the green grass.The Park was quite clean, a bit crowded as it was a holiday in Turkey, but that made it more enjoyable for us, as we prefer seeing people around, especially for our kid, there were some available swings and toys for kids around in different locations that kids were enjoying. we have stayed there for a couple of hours.

Stumbled across this park. We stumbled across the is park and we were so glad we did. What a gem near the palace to stroll through. The flowers were beautifully planted. We ended up having lunch at a cafe we saw just to spend a little more time here.
Nice to stroll. Nice park full of beauty, great for picnic, people watching, walking, tress are tall, though a bit dirty of some garbage scattered, hope they can maintain the cleanliness of it

Best in tulip season. The park used to be the territory of Topkap? Palace in the past. Today it's best during "Istanbul Tulip Festival". If you plan your visit at that time you'll get to see even more stunning views in city's other green spaces such as the Y?ld?z Park or Emirgan. The park is also home to a museum dedicated to history of scientific and technological development in Islamic civilizations and the Byzantine "Column of the Goths". From the north of the entrance you can reach Topkap? Palace and the linked Archeology Museum.
A little oasis. This was such a surprise, a small park with fountains and plenty of shade to either walk or take a rest.
Good place to relax. Beautiful park with a calm atmosphere. Great to walk a little or just sit and read a book in the afternoon.

Urban oasis. Hard to believe that until fairly recently this park had fallen into disrepair! It is now a beautiful oasis in the midst of the city. Quaint plaster statutes (squirrels, bears, fish) abound. Some lovely ponds with little bridges invite selfies. Had lunch in a restaurant which was very good and inexpensive. Highly recommended for a break from the crowds!
Quiet!. Boy it can be very hot in summer in Istanbul. Lovely place to cool off and charge your bateries.Enjoy!

park in old town. Nice oasis in old town. There is also nice restaurant at the end of the garden with beautiful view. It is really nice after long day walking just sit, take a cup of apple tea and enjoy view of Istanbul.
Gorgeous. A beautiful green refuge in a huge teeming city. Museum is right there as well. Lovely paths and wonderful flowers.

Peaceful park in the middle of Istanbul. Nice place to go and admire the mass planting, and just sit and relax after all the hustle of the Old Town. We would have liked to spend some more time there - it's quite a large area.

Relaxing park. this is another must visit anytime of the day but stunning at night.
love everything about the park the gardens are incredible

peaceful and tranquil space. A beautiful respite away from the bustling noise and traffic of the old city. It was a pleasant surprise to find a green, tranquil, and quiet space amid all the people and tourists. A nice place to sit and have a cup of coffee or dessert and just relax and slow down.

Beautiful!. We found this park by accident. It is very large and is beautifully manicured. They have the most wonderful planted flower designs, fountains, bridges and even a live lamb! There are lots of places to sit and relax. It was cool and breezy on a sunny afternoon.

very nice. Really prefect place quiet space with lovely trees and flowers. A nice way to spend a day & I can't imagine better place to rest & take a breath,Full of green, also full fo people,having tea and enjoyingwith views at the end of the park where there is a nice cafe,there are WC, you never know who you might meet
Solace. . A great place to relax and escape the crowded Sultanahmet. There's a playground for the kids and lots of shadow to relax beneath. A clean public bathroom too.
fun fun fun. It's a lot of fun because you have what to do. so even if you are alone, you won't feel alone here. There are special places for taking pictures.

Perfect place to take a breath. I can't imagine better place to rest and take a breath than Gulhane. Close to Topkapi Palace and water on the other side is perfect place to chillout but still close to main attractions of the city. Full of green, also full fo people but it doesn't have huge influence on your mood when you are there.
A beautifu; park. far larger than we expected and a beautiful park to walk through and reflect on the wonders of Istanbul.
Great Park. nice quiet space in the busy city- well set out and maintained with lovely trees and flowers. A nice way to spend a day
My mouth fell open. truly astounding. Really new, quiet and peacefull place. City seemed to fade away. Perfect spot to take a breath.

ok - pleasant. this park was not a lush with tulips when i was there last week, however signs of replanting going on,
it is a pleasant park for a walk in the evening
recommend;
having tea and enjoying ocean views at the end of the park where there is a nice cafe,
Beautiful and Varied,. a great place to relax from touristing. Ancient areas, flower gardens, paths to stroll, Green trees in a city of 25 million...you never know who you might meet

Peace in the Centre of Sultan Ahmet !. This is a lovely park situated next to the Topkapi Museum,. It has lion figurines throughout and various places for children to play. The toilets however need some updating with plenty of mosquitos as residents...so hold off if you can ! Lots of flower displays and it leads to the Harbour area at the bottom end.

Amazing park, but the atmosphere can be creepy in the night... Gulhane park is a wonderful touristic attraction in Istanbul, very close to the Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia mosque. The impressive view over the Bosphorus from the park is nice. Unfortunately, during the night, the atmosphere becomes quite creepy because of the people who walk through the park..

Beautiful and relaxing Gulhane Park. Having visited Istanbul in the peak of the summer heat, a stroll through the beautiful Gulhane park and a rest in the shade of the trees was most welcome. So interesting to watch the world go by.
Also visited this park in the evening as families shared picnics and broke their daily Ramadan fast together.

Entrances at both ends. We walked by Gulhane Park a number of times but didn't go through as we were under the mistaken impression that there was only one entrance/exit, and we were in a hurry or tired and didn't want to backtrack. We finally wondered through and discovered two entrances/exits, one at each end. Don't make the mistake we did. Use it as a route to get from the port area to the Sultanahmet area or vice versa. You will welcome its serene, winding paths, the many water structures, and the abundance of birdsong.

Leisure, relaxation and a lovely walk. The shaded gardens, the stylised flower bed designs, the refreshing fountain, the street-food vendors and the laid-back Istanbullus made this a park to remember. Proximity to the Gulhane tram station makes it easy to find. Access the Islamic Museum of Science and Technology from inside the park.

Quiet and beautiful. This park is next to Tpkapi Palace and Istanbul Archeological Museum, The entrance doesn't look so attractive, but the inside is different from the image from the outside. It is very quiet and there are so many old and tall trees. We also found some ruins of Byzantium. If you have a time and want to have a quiet time after busy sight-seeing, it is ideal for walking.

a pleasant place. lovely place to walk through and enjoy the peace and quiet and the water fountains. Take the time to walk to the cafes at the end of the palace walls at the far end of the park - their views are stunning over the golden horn and make for an ideal snack break in the heat
Peaceful. Nice peaceful park within the old city. Houses one of the old palaces and a museum. a good place to visit and relax away from the hectic tourist area.

A reward after tiresome day!. After spending a tiresome day around the city this is surely the reward you should seek.Give it three hours of the evening and enjoy the nature unfolding before your eyes.Dont worry about dinner you can still find many around the park specialy the way to sultan ahamet mosque.Never miss. You can do it after top kapi palace as its just outside it.

Just gorgeous...... Having a lovely park like this in the middle of a city really gives Istanbul a different feel. The park has fountains and tea gardens that are set on the hillside overlooking the Bosphorus and are so tranquil. The many trees over a welcome shade from the heat and there are lots of photo opportunities to be had!

Nice and quiet place in the hart of the touristic area. It's a nice place to take a break and relax while visiting Istanbul - just walking on the alleys, smelling the fresh air and seeing the green parrots from the secular trees or enjoying a nice turkish coffee or tea .

Peaceful oasis. This park is a very peaceful oasis in the middle of the metropolis. The garden beds with their maze of flowers are a particular highlight and one can imagine the sultan wandering among the gardens and statues in days of past.

Beautiful Park with a Surprise. This beautiful park was across the street from our hotel. Hidden from the street by the walls of Topkapi Palace this gem is worth visiting. Some welcome shade, water features, spectacular views and winding paths would be reason enough to visit the park. However, it also contains a surprise:The Column of the Goths - thought to be the oldest Roman artifact in Istanbul. Likely celebrating a victory over the Goths in the newly founded Constantinople - early 4th C.Bring a lunch and enjoy a picnic with locals.

Very nice for a stroll. When you have to walk form the historical area to the harbour then take a stroll though this park. If is not crowded and is much more relaxing than walking on a traffic filled street.

Beautiful. A short walk from The Celal Sultan Hotel were we stayed is the beautiful Gulhane Park. A great escape from the crowds and commerce that is the Sultanahmet district. Colorful, serene, and easily access made this Park a go to place for us after viewing the incredible sights that the District offers. Tulips were in bloom when we were in Istanbul and they were incredible.

Beautiful Park in Sultanahmet Region. Easy walk from our hotel - can get away from the crowds around the tourist attractions for some peace and quiet. I was impressed with all the flowers planted around the entire city, even at the airport.

Lovely oasis in the city. Looking a bit scruffy in places but clearly a lot of planting and work underway. This place is worth a visit to sit and unwind. go to the tea houses at the far end and sit amongst the trees watching the traffic on the Bosphorus - lovely.

Heat. Out of the heat of the day- Peaceful and families sitting walking brides having photos taken - little bridges over water shaded sitting areas everything you would not expect to find in a city- a must see site
