Lovely park. Gulhane Park in the past was apparently a bit tatty, but now it is being brought up to scratch with new lighting and planting. The café (opposite the tram stop) has good cakes and the whole place is great for an early evening stroll before dinner!

Last Full Day in Stanbul. We had been in the park several times But unbeknown to us there was a back which we used on our last day. We walked through the park and saw several couples who were having their wedding photos taken.
Vivid park. This is a very vivid and in the same time a relaxing park within the city center. Close to Topkapi and Sirkeci Station, it is the perfect location for a park
the best park i've been to. amazing place to relax - to walk around - a really beautiful park in the centre of the city - must visit while in istanbul!

In april is the best park in istanbul!. Due to the presence of tulips everywhere, this park in april is simply amazing.. colours everywhere, flowers everywhere.. a wonderful place to relax and have a walk!
Relax in Istanbul. It was so nice to find a place to relax after walking all day! It is big, is beautiful an oasis in the middle of the busy town!

Wonderful Greenery in the city. If you lack the nature after a squeezed city travel you can visit Gülhane Parkı with its wonderful greenery and birds. We took photos of the parrots with their colorful skin. The trees were marvellous with almost perfect maintenance. You will enjoy the air if you are tired of the city.

Escape it all. Escape the hustle and bustle of Istanbul old city and relax in Gulhane Park.Wander the tree lines walkways, while you listen to the sound of falling water in the fountains.Sit on the grass under a tree and listen to the birds.Its such a lovely relaxing place to sit, watch the world go by, or to have a family picnic.Bathrooms (WC) is available for a charge...There is no entry fee and access is via Alemdar Ave, close to Gulhane Tram Stop
Nice place . It is a very nice garden wih nice place to sit down between trees and nice green area it is very close to topkapny palace with the same entrance but different directions
Rest Area. its a good park in a great area and you will need a rest in this area located in (historical district)

A nice place to relax under shady trees and flowers. Aside from the historical background, Gulhane Park, next to Top Kapi Palace, is he place you will enjoy most when tired of walking. To tell the truth, we have been coming to Istanbul since the early 1990s but never knew of Gulhane Park, only of Gulhane Tramway Stop. However, jut inquisitive of a door in the high wall, opposite the Tramway Stop, I found access to Beltur Gulhane Kandil Tesislari and through it, making to the outdoor seating and also the Gulhane Park. Wow, what a beautiful park with tall lush green trees, grounds covered with flower beds, and lots of attractions for children. Gardeners were rushing to finish new flower beds along the main road. It has Rose Grden too (Gulhane means Rose Gaden or House of Roses) We also discovered the Museum of History of Science and Technology in Islam, opened few years ago. More cultural institutions are expected to be opened in this Park in future. Besides Turkish families, we spotted lots of visitors from the Khaleej (UAE) with children enjoying as much as the locals. I strongly recommend to visitors to Istanbul to explore Gulhane Park, don't forget your camera.

Nice, Relaxing Park Next to the Archeological Museum. This was a very relaxing, well kept park with fountains and lots of trees and landscaped areas. A great park to stop and relax before your next adventure in Istanbul!

Stroll next to Topkapi Palace. Gulhane Park redesigned and colourfully furnished with flowers, small bridges over the water among the trees and it's great to breathe and stroll "in" the city just minutes away from Topkapi Palace. If you're tired or exhausted and want a small break amongst green, nice and easy place to visit during a day at Sultanahmet area.

Serene and beautiful. What a beautiful park, tended by many gardeners who take pride in the garden. Plenty of benches to sit on and grass to laze with a picnic, beautiful flowers and little treats all-round the garden, like bridges, fountains and the gorgeous parrots above you. A wonderful place to sit and watch the world go by.The park houses a Science Museum, and you can also reach the Archaeology Museum and Topkapi through the park.

Nice place for a stroll. Very large park (think Stanley Park in Vancouver) which basically surrounds Topkapi Palace. Great place to walk, with lots of trees and flowers. Tulips in April and early May are exceptional (after all they originated in Turkey) and the roses are great. Probably more locals than tourists in the park. To the north and next to Topkapi Palace there are good views over the Bosphorous.Tip: Easy to reach via the tram, just get off at the Gulhane station.

Quiet Place To Relax Not Too Crowded. I found this place by accident after walking from cemberlitas down through Sultanahmet and investigating the side streets Divan Yolu Caddesi, it was the greenest area I had seen since arriving in Istanbul, and the calmness was a nice break from the activity on the main drag. The trees are large and the grounds are very well manicured, very beautiful and relaxing and interesting as it butts against the outer walls of Topkapi Palace complex.

A Stunning Park!. I went to Gülhane Park at the time when huge numbers of tulips were being planted all over Turkey - and Gülhane Park was no exception. The colours were vibrant and the tulips were arranged in beautiful patterns. It was an amazing sight. Gülhane Park is a beautiful place to stroll through peacefully. It also has two places where they sell food, I believe. An absolutely beautiful place!
Wonderful place for peaceful retreat. Beautiful park and parts of great views of the Bosphorus. Great place to relax. Flowers, greenery, lots of people, locals and tourists.

Looked after. Walked through here while heading up to blue mosque places to have drinks snacks,beautiful views over the Bosporus good photograph opportunities all the flower beds were being planted out while we were there should imagine when these are done would look fabulous,plenty of places to sit and relax,very close to topkapi palace and mosque area
love the birds. beautiful flowers and restful vibe...esp loved all the cranes and parrots living in the trees! good people watching, too.
Incredible beautiful!!!!. Never in my live seen so many tulips planted in a such artistic way!!!! Incredible!!!! Wonderful!!!!

Very nice park on European side. This is like Paradise in Sirkeci&Sultanahmet area where you can have many hours in and around.Some cafes are missing,However that has a very nice route through the walls and you can walk many hours under the shadow of big and old trees.Strongly recommended.

Tulips, Tulips Everywhere. We went to Istanbul in Spring. This is by far the best time to visit Gulhane Park. There were thousands of tulips everywhere. It was unbelievably beautiful to see all the different colours all over. Take a picnic basket and enjoy the park.
Tulip exhibition in the gardens in April : lovely.. We walked through this park on our way from the Topkapi Palace to the Spice Bazaar. There was an exhibition of tulips in the gardens of the park.
Lovely to walk around. Huge park that is beautiful. When we first arrived the tulips looked amazing! Lots of benches to rest on and big trees to provide shade form the sun.

Just amazing. Huge park with the most beautiful flowers I've ever seen!
Good for kids, families.
Great place for pictures and enjoy a sunny day in Istanbul.

One of the Best places I visited in Istanbul. This park is simply BEAUTIFUL. So many Tulips with different colours. You can have a walk there and at the end turn to your right to go have Chai at one of the coffeeshops located up a hill where you can have an AMAZING view of the Bosphorus.
Tulips Tulips and more. Charming park . special in April - the tulips season , colorful tulips all around , very nice views , a walk in this park is April is a MUST !

Great with flowers. I can see why the opinions on this park would differ. Off season, it is simply a park like many others. In April when we visited it though, the park is covered with tulips and other flowers and it really looks awesome. It is then the perfect nature stop after the old stones of Ayasofya or the blue mosque.

The Best Park. Historic palaces, Great Tulips... museums and mosques, while visiting tour if you need a little break to go to the Gülhane Park. Thus, a historic park and can be visited on your trip as well as the date, on the one hand can be continued. Located in Gulhane Park gives people peace. Even if you left when you are tired you forget your tiredness. Your psychology is changing all the time. Go to a day when the weather is nice
The best Park In Thé Town. We were there yesterday's with friends very nice park and tulip days many different flower its looks great everyone should go there its free...

Beautiful flowers, peaceful walk. In our week in Istanbul we returned to the park a number of times. It is April and tulip season and we never tired of seeing the endless array of tulips and other flowers that brought the park to life with their colour. It is a peaceful walk. You can walk from sultanamet area and the park is below the Topkai palace. You can walk through and find your way to Sirkeci station. Don't miss it. A haven from the usual bustle of the life of the tourist.

A beautiful stroll among the Tulips. The park is one tram stop from Sultanahmed, in Gulhanne. One one side it's bordered by the Topkapi Palace and is filled with Tulips in April. After rushing around for a few days in Istanbul you can sit back on one of many park benches and enjoy the scenery. There is a statue of kamal Ataturk in the middle.

One of the best. Not the best but still worth. Main advantage of this park is the easy access just walk 10 down hill from Topkapi Palace. Flowers' arrangement is great and many varieties. Never get lost here easy to stroll around. But simehow tulips are less than Emigran'park. May be the size of the park diffrent. Great park.

Beautiful- amazing tulips. I have been to many parks around the world, and how I agree with the previous post. This is a truly beautiful park with the flowers out- stunning. It is free and really well maintained. It was full of all types of people when we were there, enjoying themselves with picnics, etc. The park guards ensured there were no beggars or hawkers - a must-do when you are near the Hagia Sophia/ Topkapi Museum.

Go in spring, April is tulip time. Have been to the park before and it seemed just ordinary. We came in April when the tulips are out all over Istanbul. The park was a delight, the flower beds were not only a delight to the eyes, the aroma from the huge bed of hyacinths was wonderful. The park is very well maintained, the fountains sparkled, the sun shone, it was tremendous. A must visit if you find yourself in Istanbul in April, a sunny day just adds to the magic.

Stunning park. If you are in the blue mosque area take a five minute walk to this amazing park. Lovely range of blooming flowers, exotic birds everywhere, lots of places for photo opportunities, fountains, children's play area a must see area when the weather is good and you have time. Toilet facilities present although not free.

Lovely respite from crowds and walking. This park is actually quite lovely, and clearly more popular with locals than tourists. A much nicer walk from Sultanahmet to Sirkeci-area than just down the street, there are green parrots from India, nesting cranes and clean toilets as well as beautifully landscaped flower beds. The tulips are in bloom, and beautiful.

Go Early. It's early spring and the tulips are in full bloom. The park is lovely and the flowerbeds well groomed. It is the perfect place for a walk or run… in the early morning. At 9:00 a.m. we had the park pretty much to ourselves, but when we walked past the entrance in the late afternoon we looked in and could not see far because of the crowds. If you are en route to somewhere the park can be entered from either end.

A Welcome green space in the Old City. Parks are always welcome in crowded city centres.I work in landscape horticulture, and have visited a great many parks across five continents. Whilst this is not one of the worlds great parks, it is still a great place to visit for the calm and respite it affords.It gets my vote and recommendation on that alone.

Just a park...... This is just a park. there is nothing much else to it. I did not go right down to the end of it - went maybe half way. However, in that all that i saw was a lovely park. depending on the time of the year though it can be enjoyable or a pain. When i went there the temperature would have been between 15 to 18 degrees celsius. there was a soft sun that was out in all its glory - not a cloud in the sky. i spent about an hour just sitting on a bench and soaking in the great weather and looking at people. there were quite a few locals (in fact more locals than tourists). i went on a saturday and maybe because of this the local crowd was more. on a weekday it may be a bit more desolate and private.the garden is well laid out. nice flowers blooming including tulips, the grass is green, some pergolas and shaded sitting areas are present and there are a lot of benches for you to sit on - nice and clean. there is a fountain at the entrance and a small stream that runs through the park. there are wild parrots and cranes (depending on the time of year i guess) and seagulls. The cacophony of their bird call can be a bit too much sometime especially the parrots. if you want to rest after a lot of walking around then this is a nice place. if you like green areas then this will be to your liking. ther is also an islamic science museum highlighting the scientific achievements of old islamic cultures. a couple of restaurants (at least one) is also present. the weather of course is most important like in any other park. not a place that you need to separately mark out in your itinerary but then if you have the time and the ooportunity then take a peek.

Beautiful and Stunning. Absolutely beautiful, stunning, and surreal. The entire park is towered by tall trees that provide ample shade for the otherwise hot Turkish summers. Lots of green grass, flowers, and a small brook that runs through the park. This park provides a nice stop after you go through the Archaeological Museum located next door. If you get a chance, take a leisurely stroll and perhaps a nap at this tranquil and beautiful park.

Lovely little park for some quiet time.. We enjoyed a really nice walk around the park after having been to a few attractions in the city. It's a nice place to relax, sit on a bench and soak up a bit of nature in the middle of a busy city. We saw a few parrots in the trees and cats wandering around, very calming place.

Lovely park, parrots in trees and cats to stroke. Large park, small science museum, lots of benches to sit on, lots of cats, parrots in trees. A nice break from the busy streets of Istanbul and a good place to bring a picnic

Enjoy this peaceful area.. The Gulhane Park located in the heart of Istanbul's historic center, it is a few hundred meters from the Blue Mosque, it is open and accessible, a calm quiet place, personally I enjoyed the quiet and I could have rested in one of the many benches. A pleasant walk through the trees and a small lake, so many children playing around it. Pleasant and relaxing experience.

nice place. Gülhane Park was nice place to see during our tour, i didn't go deeply in the place but it was near Sultanahmet district where Blue Mosque, Hegia Sophia and topkapi palace are in, in the next turmy station. it was a good place for relaxing and refreshing.recommended : after tour in sultanahmet, go there buy sweets and leave the place.There's a cafeteria i didn't set on.there is The Museum of The History of Science and Technology in Islam, i didn't go.take some photos and leave if you want to visit other places;)

Take a breath. After spending hours in Sultanahmet district (Blue Mosque, Hegia Sophia, Basilica Cistern), here is perfect place for relaxing and refreshing. There's a cafeteria where you can have warm drinks while watching beautiful scene of bosporus.
Beautifull. Beautifull and peacefull. You can have a walk, relax drinking a soft drink and enjoy the area. It's right after the Hagia Sofia.
Just a park. Nothing more than a regular park. If you like a walk in the urban park, take it. If you think it has something special, don't go. Better take a rest before your next visit.

Nice place to chill between major attractions. The main benefit this lovely little park gave us was a place that didn't inundate the senses so we didn't overload the kids with too much culture. The play park is a bit basic but there are lots of other interesting bits and pieces to entertain and relax like model squirrels and lions to play on.

A lovers park. Wouldn't go put of my way to go here. It's nice and all, but just a regular park. Probably better in summer. Amusing we're the great amount of couples here, sitting on benches and cuddling, eacaping from their guarded home life.

A peaceful respite. This is a lovely park, and a great way to escape the bustling city. There are wild parrots flying through the trees and flower-lined paths, just below the walls of Topkapi Palace. I went on a Sunday and saw two Turkish wedding parties taking pictures, which was an interesting sight! Definitely worth strolling through for a relaxing time.
TEA with a wonderful view. Just go there at sun set and it is beautiful, at the end of the park you will fin a tea garden just sit and relax a tea with a magnificient view. Very romantic!
peace and quiet. it was just a nice quiet park close to our hotel would not go out my way to go there.It is next door to the Topkapi Palace and used by the locals for strolling.
Very peaceful. Wonderful to find a quiet haven after walking the streets of Istanbul. The park appears to be well maintained with a good playground for kids. Cooler too under the large tree canopy.
Perfect for a Picnic. This is a beautiful park below the Topkapi Palace walls. It is the perfect location for a quick escape from the heat of the city and for a relaxing picnic.

Beautiful. Good place to rest your feet.... We went to the Gulhane park after our visit to the Chora Church and the Istanbul Archaelogical museum.... we went simply because it was on our way back to our hotel and we were not disappointed. Beautiful park...granted, we did not walk the entire park, I would still give rate it highly, as a place to rest your tired feet and engage in people watching ;-)
Nice Park to relax. Great place to relax eat some peanuts and popcorn which are for sale at the entrance. Kids enjoyed running around there. Saw some wild parrots as well.

A floral delight. I have visited this Park twice this year. I was lucky enough to see it in Spring. At this time it was a beautiful area blanketed in a colourful array of flowers. This was predominantly tulips and there were a number of artistic displays including raised ramps. Adding the water features and fountains it was a lovely place to relax and spend time. I returned in July and was disappointed to find that there were few floral displays and the fountains were not switched on. It is still a quiet oasis within a bustling city but it is a pity that the feast of floral displays is not continued through the summer months.

Good place but overlooked. I had a very nice feelings about this place but perhaps its overlooked. As I entered the place it did not give any impression of a good place. I could not go further after walking half a kilometre in to this place and came out with a bad feelings. I think the place is good but overlooked and is not maintained as it should be. The beautiful tall trees and calm and peace of the place indicate it to be a good resting place.

nice. nice for a good stroll after topkapi palace visit.its under rated tourest attaraction ,you may see some young couples cuddling but its not like other park at besiktas because there ?? yeah more than that...

Quiet time walk or short cut. Just round the corner from the HotelLino and Can CafeGulhane Park is the place to walk for quiet time although it is very popular. At one end it overlooks the Bosphorus and Asia, take a tea or coffee and relax. Gulhane park is also a short cut to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Place or Hagia Sophia bypassing some of the many shops

Wonderful break from busy dirty City!. Take the tram to gulhane, bring a blanket, a book and some water and enjoy a couple of hours in green sorroundings. Be aware -as a woman, that you are Not allowed to Sun-bath in hotpants/bikini-pants. You must wear shorts or skirt thatcovers the inner thighs.

Green and beautiful. A beautiful park just in the middle of touristic district of Istanbul with lots of beauties.Tips:- There is a very nice cafe with a beautiful view of Marmara sea but check the price before go inside!

Lovely to experience a slice of Istanbul life. This park is a wonderful place to stroll and observe the families of Istanbul relaxing and enjoying themselves -- sitting underneath massive ancient trees, eating roasted chestnuts or sweet corn from a street vendor, and connecting with friends and family. While we were in Istanbul we were fortunate to stay near this park and never missed an opportunity to walk through it. Enchanting, and I think it should be a higher priority on visitors' "must do" lists while in Istanbul. The diversity is amazing -- locals and tourists, young and old, and some women covered from head to toe and others in miniskirts. We even saw a wedding couple getting their photos taken while we were there.

Plan ahead. Plan ahead sand make a picnic out of gulhane. The park is amazing: green, organized and , clean. Bring a thin blanket with u maybe w couple sandwiches an get ur self some of Turkish cay(tea)Gulhane was one of my best places I got to this may and the weather was amazzzzzinggg

Some Advantages over Yeldiz. If you're torn between going to Gulhane or Yeldiz, go to Gulhane Park. I think that Gulhane has some advantages over Yeldiz. First, it's closer to the tourist sites in Sultanahmet. You can walk to Gulhane after lunch and a morning of sightseeing. It will provide you with a nice afternoon break before resuming the rest of your sightseeing for the day. Second, Gulhane is bigger and the paths are clear. We got lost a bit in Yeldiz, which wasn't fun because the park was hilly. We did notice, coincidentally, that there were more cuddly PDA-type couples in Yeldiz; so if that's your priority, then Yeldiz will appeal to you more. Yeldiz has more woody and shaded areas, but Gulhane has the flowers. We were there the first week of May. Most of the tulips were gone, but for some reason the yellow ones have survived till then. Lastly, Gulhane has more benches than Yeldiz. The few that were available in Yeldiz were already occupied when we were there. If you enjoy walks in parks, try to make it to Gulhane. I'm not sure if it's going to be worth it when the weather gets hot though. By then Yeldiz will be a cooler place to spend your time since it's more shaded than Gulhane.

Setüstü Çay Bahçesi. After a nice walk in the park you reach the little cafe in the end. It has a beautiful view of Bosporous and Golden Horn and cute little stools to sit on. The Turkish style tea for two is quite interesting and tastes good.

Colourful Gem. The tulips were in bloom and the gardens were beautiful. It was a Sunday and it was great to see so many families enjoying the fine afternoon and the splendour of the park. We discovered the Museum of Science and Technology in the park and returned the next day for a visit.

Tulip heaven!. What luck to be able to see the tulip festival in Gulhane Park in April. The park is difficult to find, but as you walk along the street from the Hagia Sophia to the Topkapi Palace, keep your eyes trained to the right. When you first look into a window, it looks like a mirage. You have to walk into a building and then out the back, but, there before you is the most stunning view. The best time to go is on a weekend because you will see all of the inhabitants of Istanbul out for a stroll. I learned after my visit that the tulips are also beautiful in Emirgan Park, but I missed them.

Escape the frenzy of Istanbul's tourist hot-spots in this glorious park. It is easy to miss as not much is made of it in tourist literature and it is reached either by a lane (which has attractive wooden houses and the splendid Sarnic cistern restaurant) in between Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace or at the north end of Alemdar Cad. There is also a 'Gulhane' tram stop a short way north of the entrance.This is a wonderful park: with views of the Golden Horn and Bosphorus on one side and the wall of the Topkapi Palace (interesting to view this sight from below) on the other. It is beautifully planted and very well provided with benches and various quirky and attractive features. Be warned, though, that the toilets cost a Lira and are of the dreaded 'Turkish' type. At the far end of the Park is a cafe Set Ustu Cay Brahces with superb views over the water. Unfortunately the range of drinks is very limited - I couldn't get an orange or a lemonade and certainly didn't want a Fanta, so we had a pot of tea for two at 14 Lira. But it's a great place to just sit and look out over the Bosphorus as a mid-point in a circuit of the park.

It's one of the beautiful parks in Istanbul.. It's located near Sultanahmet and Topgapi museum. It's a best time to go there as there are many tulips are blooming with many different colors. Also there is good cafe and restaurant there where you sit and enjoy the view on Bosporus. It's quite interesting to walk on the roads among of the old trees and near an old city walls

Peaceful Refuge at the skirt of Topkapi Palace. This is a wonderful park to take a break from walks and visits in the middle of the old Istanbul just at the bottom of Archaeology museum. There are great tall trees and flowers in season the sea of Tulips with wonderful colours.It is a great place to have a picnic and take a break from the crowd of tourist ;once you walked all the way down you will be by Sarayburnu the sea side and Eminonu pier.

Found by accident. Having spent time having a nice stroll along the sea front we decided to head back towards the Blue Mosque, and passed through this lovely picturesque part of the city that we didn't know was even there. With beautiful flower displays and nicely manicured lawns you would not believe you are only 5 minutes or so from Sultan Ahmet Square. There are bird boxes everywhere and a very large and busy Heronry high in the trees. An absolutely peaceful open space in such a busy city an absolute joy to behold. Free admission as well

Amazing park. This public park is a must see, especially if you love long walks or if you have outgoing kids. Gulhane park extends over a vast area and is ridiculously full of greenery and long trees in addition to ALOT of tulips arrayed in different beautiful and breathtaking designs. I visited in mid April and was lucky enough to see the blooming of the tulips all over Istanbul.To reach the park, you need to go to Sultanahmet area, which is easily accessible by Tram. The entrance of the park is next to Topkapi palace, as it used to be part of the palace itself.
Beautiful space. Peaceful and lovely, we were lucky to see the tulips, and enjoyed walking through the gardens which are obviously loved by the local people.

Walking from Blue Masjed to Gulhane Park. As I knew before landing in Istanbul, April is the Tulip season, once we finished our tour in Sultanahmet through visiting the Blue Masjed and the Hgia Sofia, it was minutes walking to the Gulhane Park, free entrance, just walk, take photos, sit and enjoy the nature and the beauty.

Turks at leisure. Walking through Gulhane Park at tulip time was both beautiful and fascinating. The flowers were terrific. Indeed, the tulips all over Istanbul were amazing. Seeing people sitting amongst them for photos was even more amazing. Coming from our "keep off the grass" culture, it was an unfamiliar sight to see folks taking a short cut through th blooms. Relatively few of the flowers were trampled as everyone used the same short cuts. It was not only the children posing with the garden ornaments, adults were cheerfully posing with large fibre glass squirrels. If you can't beat 'em, join 'em - I shamelessly posed with a giant plastic squirrel. Just people having a really nice time and being very relaxed.The high point in the park - the Museum of Science and Technology in Islam is brilliant.

Take a break from the hectic tourist activity. Whether you just finished a day at Topkapi, the Archeology Museum, Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia, consider a small break in this delightful park frequented by locals. Well manicured lawns, flowering plants, sculptures and a large water feature replenish the soul. Buy a fresh sesame "bagel" from one of the vendors outside the gate (for 1TL), sit on a bench and you will find yourself rejuvinated in no time,
Nice place to unwind but may not be touristically relevant. Nice park in middle of a huge, nearly treeless, metropolis. Good place to relax with children and see the birds, especially the Parakeets.

a dream place for a short relax. Basically it's only a park. In reality is a corner of paradise. I agree with most of the reviews i.e. to visit it after a tiring walk, after the Bazar or after a day of turist stay. But - and this is my suggestion - I prefer to visit it early in the morning (9 a.m or before) when I stay in Istanbul for my business and before meetings or other engagements.early in the morning in a sunny day, it's just like to cross a door out of the word and far from any fighting. The birds cancell any town noice (traffic, crowd, confusion... nothing will still exist inside). the colors and the flowers are beautiful. Very few people inside, some yung mother with her children, some studends crossing out of the traffic, some old people on the park benches, some dogs playing and following - happy - the people crossing the parkit sounds like a jump in another dimention, especially if compared with the usual and nice confusion of a town like Istanbul.I abitually stay there for a while (half an hour) before taking a taxi to my meetingsIf I have time enough, I stay for more and I have the opportunity to write many pages for my future books. If not, only five minutes are sufficient for a sort of "oriental cleaning" of my mind.Last time (5 days ago), I had the fantastic opportunity to see many cicognas (storks) with their babies in their nests up above the white trees. No words able to descive that!To visit it? Easy. From Santa Sofia, down in direction to the sea. 500 meters walking, you'll find three stone arches on the right. Crossing them you can see and enter the park. A long avenue with a duble line of white high plane trees. Green everywhere and flowers. Inside the only "noise" is the voice of many different birds. You can cross it and go out on the left, closed to the railway station in front of Bosphorus the only negative remark is due to the many public cars using this lane for crossing the area. take care... and enjoy this incredible corner of paradise

Take a stroll after a tiring day. Take a walk here and relax after visiting all the touristy areas like Sultanahmet, Spice Bazaar and Eminonu Square, which are within walking distance. Still, the best time to visit would probably be after March that is once the flowers grown.
Good place to think. You can stay in peace here for a long time. Very good place to visit after tiring day of walking in a crowd of tourists :)

Peaceful way to spend a few hours. What a lovely place to spend a few hours. The gardens were lovely and well cared for. We didn't see any rubbish , although there is work ongoing to create more pathways and exhibits. There is a super tea veranda where they serve the most amazing jacket potatoes and the view is simply stunning. I would thoroughly recommend this one The walkways are all concreted so wheelchair access shouldn't be a problem

Dirty place. I was shocked with all the trash on the ground while there were a lot of trash bins. This ruined all the impression. The place is nice, especially near the palace where you can see beautiful view on Bosphorus.

empty place. not so interesting place, there is only one small museum and thats all...u can only use it after visiting topkapı palace and close museums for sitting and take a short rest...nothing else...

..really enjoyed taking tea in the outdoor cafe. A delightful place to take a quiet stroll as a relief from the hectic schedule of sightseeing. We really enjoyed taking tea in the outdoor cafe at the end of the park with a view over the sea. We were there in the Spring (2012) and enjoyed thousands of flowers from the generous planting of bulbs.

more than amazing. if you 're nit rated this park 5stars then rethinking again cUS its really lovely romantic place, u can talk through green places full of flowers and some of cute architecture models . u can sit and enjoy spent peaceful time there and at the end of this park from the sea side u can have a walk through endless Cornish which gives u opportunities to c istanbul Asian side on the other site ... highly recommended.

Nice park...you would forget you are in Instanbul. Your could walk through this park and think you are in a small city anywhere in the world. Very green, lots of seats, a little break away from the crazy crowds!

Quiet park for a stroll. This park was located right behind our hotel therefore we would always walk through it as a detour to the major sites in Istanbul.. ie the Hagia Sofia.. Blue Mosque etc. It's a great place to stroll after a big lunch or dinner. Plenty of cute little cats and kittens around to entertain you as well.
Nothing to say. This park is probably nice in the summer season for pcknic but in autumn you can only listen to the birds and see many huge trees and just walk.
Time out. Great spot for a rest in between Topkapi Palace and the Archeology Museum. The park is well maintained with toilets available. A peaceful spot in a very busy city
not touristic. eventhough it is next to the Topkapi Palace this park is no good for tourists, it does not have any facilities you will need if you are tired of walking, the toilets are not clean.

Green Happy Park. My kids love this park. In fact all of us love spending time in this park. We went to Istanbul in August and thus it was summer so we see lots pf people spending time in the park. We saw two ladies happily did some sewing under the trees. We saw newly wed couples, local kids in national costumes.It was a perfect way of breaking the routine of historical visits :)
pretty park. we liked to walk back through the park from the grand bazaar area to our hotel. A peaceful place used by many of the local families for a quiet stroll.
Lovely & relaxing. A large leafy park right next to Topkapi palace, full of old statues, gazeebos and all the lovers in Instanbul. Good for an afternoon stroll.

Peaceful oasis near Topkapi Palace. This park is an oasis of green, and peaceful place to take a break from the hustle and bustle, or for a picnic. The stray dogs and cats are a significant presence, and seem to be treated much more kindly here than in most Western countries.
Sad. Sad to see all the fountains and water features broken and in disrepair inwhat was a beautiful park, shame on the city authorities for this lack of maintenance.

Relaxing!!!. When just couldn't walk anymore after visiting Topkapi palace or The Archaeology museum, this park comes to your rescue! It's so beautiful to sit by a shady tree and see the world go by. If you have the time while in Istanbul don't miss it!

oasis in the chaos.. This is an attractive park enclosing the topkapi palace and museum and extending down to near the sea. There are lots of mature trees and fountain. The woods echo to exotic birds and it is cool in the midday heat.

Nice shades througout. The park is within walking distance of Gulhane tramway station and located near the main attraction sites.As you enter you appreciate the sheer size of the trees with their over hanging branches which provide shade throughout the park thus providing a cool place to relax.Even better you can sit next to many if the water fountains which make for an even cooler relaxation.

A very pleasant place to amble or sit.. After our visit to the adjacent Museum of Archeology we wanted a quiet walk. In the height of summer this park, formerly part of the Topkapi Palace gardens, has lots of cool shade from the glorious collection of tall trees. So we strolled through, sat on one of the many new clean benches, avoided the odd car dashing too fast throlongtime park along its widest path and exited at the far gate at the tip of the peninsula. The walk back to the ferry area was less salubrious due to the heavy traffic along the dual carriageway alongside the railway cutting. But the park is pleasant and safe.
Good for people watching. A great park especially after sunset. Sit by the coloured water fountains. A haven in a busy busy city. Bliss.

if you need some peace. Sultanahmet is a great location to visit but some over crowd may bother you so Gulhane park might give you some peace and space. Lovely garden (especially in spring time) and if you walk all the way through tea places with an exceptional bosphorous view. It is also place to go with kids so that they can run and play around...

The Tea Garden- Great View. I liked the Tea shops at the end of the park with the marmara sea view, the tea is delivered in the authentic Turkish teapot. There are some roman ruins around. A very calm place To go to and with great sceneries.

Amazing .. but not for winter !!. We've been there last March, when weather was still cold and you barely can find a leaf on a tree in the entire city.The park was so beautiful to have a walk and to rest after a long day of walking exploring the area.The only problem that we found it by chance and we entered just for curiosity. No signs or Ads to guide you that there is a park inside. We even had a doubt that this is just a park !!!
Lovely park. Great walk through the park with plenty of places to relax and things to see. Nice cafe with wonderful views of the Bosphorus.
Nice park but not wow. It is very nice park for walking and relaxing to enjoy a break, but not important to visit if you have a busy dau

perfect park!. Gulhane is not just an ordinary park! It is a park that houses The Museum of Islamic Inventions and Technology,just a few steps on your left when you enter the park.It also leads the way to the famous Topkapi palace.And it the park walk finishes with a glorious view on the Marmara.That is not to mention the enchanting multi-colored rose shrubs all over the place,hence the name Gulhane (roses in Turkish).Tha park has many wooden seats if you ever feel tired of strolling around the place.There are also corn,chesnut and simit vendors outside the park is you are hungry.So basically you are covered for your needs!The park is amazing place to unwimd after a long tiring day of walking and site-seeing.It is also a bonus for you if you choose to stay in one of the hotels in the old city section,Sultanmehemet,which covers most of the touristic Turkish sites.Do yourself a favor,stop by and smell the roses,literally.Magical!
Amazing park. Although a small park, but still well maintained and a beautiful park. Quite peaceful.
relaxing area. inside of topkapi palace where you can smell fresh air !!! you can hear birds , you can see marvelleous flowers that surrounds all area.
Wonderful in spring. One of the few parks in Istanbul, bustling with people and tulips in early May. Take a rest there after you have visited some of the nearby attractions.
Relaxing park so pretty.. This is a lovely park. After having a busy morning it was lovely to walk through here and sit on a bench and watch the world go by! The tulips are spectacular.
Beautiful park. Check for the tango fests.. I had the best EVER tango fest in Gülhane park's mili (darphane) section. Also there's a nice cafe at the Sirkeci side of the park.

Loved the toulips in Gulhane. Got the name of this park on your website so decided to visit it.. we had a good time on this day, specially that we went there in the starting of this month, were u can find toulip, beautiful toulips and a nice weather.. I didn't know that Istanbul got some parks.. we also visited Floria park.. it's a big park but didn't hv enough time to spend in it. It's also a nice park and kids enjoyed playing and see many dogs there. It's a big park similar to Hyde park in London.

Quiet walk through Gülhane Park. I have walked through Gülhane Park in september 2011. It was very peacefull and not crowded at all. I was in Istanbul for the 15th time, but never before found the time to go in.I did discover another waterbasin, like the Yerabatan Saray, but it was closed. I started my walk in Sirkeci and finished it at the cafe at the end, overlooking the Bosphorus. Try a tea (çay) overthere, its expensive but you will discover you are getting a nice teapot, and the sight is beautiful. When i am there again end of this month i will certainly go again. At this moment there is the tulipfestival in Istanbul and i am sure there wil be many tulips in the Park.
Tulips were in bloom. and this park was gorgeous! But i suspect that any time of year it's a nice respite from the busy streets.

Pure Beauty. Flowering trees, birds' nests and cosy wooden pavillions all over the place make the park a must-visit attraction. It is right next to Topkapi palace and has an amazing view from up the hill in the very end of the palace wall

Great place for a short stroll or a good sit. Gulhane park is very close to most of the tourist sites. It is a very relaxing place and very safe as it is mostly families. Good place to get away from the crowds. Its very beautiful at sunset, and you can frequently see parrots and storks, who build their nests there.

Good place during the week but not at weekend if it is Summer!. It is always so much crowded if you are in this park at weekends. It is the garden of the Ottoman palace. nearby you can visit all such museums and historical place. It is close to old Istanbul.

A rare piece of green spot in old city.. It is just next to the Topkapi palace. 50 years ago it was a circus place. Than a zoo was build in the garden. Nowadays it is picnic place. There is nothing interesting there. It is very crowded during the summer.
Beautiful. A beautiful park, but since its just adjacent Topkapi palace, most people skip it to get to Topkapi. But its definitely worth a brief walk.

Natural beauty in the city. We sort of stumbled into this gem of a park on the last day of our trip and only wish we had found it sooner. On guidebook maps, it looks small, but it is actually much larger than we had imagined. Well worth some quite time strolling and sitting in this park.
Picnics, children and romantic places. This is a place, where you can go with your small kids and let them run and play without worries. Many nice places for family picnics and love pairs. :)

Peaceful place within Istanbul's Old City. This park is a nice respite from the tourist queuing madness in nearby sights such as Topkapi, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Basilica Cistern. Full of trees and foliage, it's nice to sit on a bench and enjoy the stillness for a while.
If you feel peckish there's simit (pretzels) and roasted corn sold by the park gates.

Relaxing walk... Routine for locals.... This district is very famous since my childhood. And before... The cosy coffee place at the end of walking path is a must visit when you need a break in the busy city tours. Can't say more... just go and enjoy the view.

Visit the park for a relaxing walk. Nice for a walk to relax for a while away from all the sight-seeing.
Make sure the weather is not hot though.
Pleasant to walk. In the shadow of Topkapi Palace stroll around this park and enjoy the shade from the heat of the sun.

Lovely place with fantastic views. Look out for the parrots. When I first visited over 20 years ago there was a zoo there - now gone but presume they released the parrots! Like to sit at cafe and look down on the Bosphoros sipping tea. Wonderful.

Great place. This is one of those places that I enjoyed the most. The line was not too bad on the day that i went. Only 20 Lira and they give you a little packet with a towelette in it to keep your hand cleans. the only caustion I am going to offer is going up to the upper lever. Be very, Very careful going up. Over the years thousands of people have climbed the uneven cobblestones steps and they are very slick, no heels please. they have no handrails to hold onto, just the wall, but did have a handrail going down. Please be careful.

Gulhane Park. If you are visiting the Topkapi Palace and/or the archeology museum, then for sure you'll be passing by the Gulhane Park either before or after your visit of the museums.Gulhane Park is a nice huge park with really tall trees lining a clean wide pedestrian lane, colourful flowers alongside and all around the park. A fish pond and fountain, statues and lots of green grass area and wooden benches for sitting.If you walk until the end of the park going to the seaside, you can turn right just before the exit and go up to a cluster of coffee/tea shops and enjoy a great view of the bosphorous while drinking a hot cup of tea from the the tea garden cafe.So if you're tired and want a piece of a little peace after several museum visits, come to the park, rest for awhile, sit at the grass, recharge.
Serene sprawling Park. Beautiful, serene, sprawling park. A great place to spend a few peaceful hours.

A Lovely Park for a Walk, right next to Topkapi Palace. This lovely park is nestled right beneath Topkapi Palace, outside the palace walls. The tree-lined walking paths are stately and wide, and the flower beds and blooming shrubbery are lovely. It's quite a long park, with walls running the length and large ancient gates on either end. You can also get into the park by a small road coming out by the Archeology Museum (which sits on the edge of the grounds of the Topkapi Palace). This park is perhaps Istanbul's answer to Manhattan's Central Park (although smaller, of course). There were few tourists there, mostly locals who were really enjoying the park with their families and friends. The trees provide gentle shade, and it is quite lovely for a stroll. There are a few food carts, but not many. There are public bathrooms, and a very lovely old fountain for hand-washing at one end. At the end of the park (furthest from Topkapi Palace) there are some cafes right on the hill overlooking the Bosphorus, and you can sit right at the edge and look down over an amazing view. In my opinion, this was the best view I saw on my Istanbul trip. I really recommend a stroll through Gulhane Park, perhaps before or after you see the Topkapi Palace or the Archeological Museum. There's a small park in the grounds of Topkapi Palace, but Gulhane is much nicer and much larger, so you can get quite a lovely stroll. And, on the plus side, there are not really large tour groups, so its much easier to stroll at your own pace in the lovely walkways, without the crazy crowds.
